question: Q.1. Which is the most widely accepted model to explain the formation and evaluation of the solar system? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Cloud hypothesis ', '(b) Gas hypothesis ', '(c) Nebular hypothesis ', '(d) Solar hypothesis ']
solution: Sol.1.(c) Nebular hypothesis - The planets were formed out of a cloud of material associated with a youthful sun, which was slowly rotating. The theory was developed by Immanuel Kant. But Mathematician Laplace revised it in 1796. Other Hypothesis: Big Bang Theory - Propounded by George Lamaitre related to the origin of the universe .

question: Q.2. Terrestrial planets are composed of______. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) metals and air ', '(b) rocks and metals ', '(c) metals and gas ', '(d) rocks and gas ']
solution: Sol.2.(b) Rocks and metals. Terrestrial Planets - Mercury, Venus (Earth‚Äôs sister planet), Earth and Mars. They are categorised into the following: Silicate Planets, Iron Planets, Coreless Planets, Carbon (diamond) Planets. Saturn, Jupiter, Uranus and Neptune are called Jovian Planets because of their large size (Jovian is named after Jupiter) and their hydrogen content.

question: Q.3. Which trend is found about the distance between the galaxies? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.3.(d) Increasing. In 1929, Edwin Hubble announced that almost all galaxies appeared to be moving away from us. He found that the universe was expanding - with all of the galaxies moving away from each other. This phenomenon was observed as a redshift of a galaxy's spectrum.

question: Q.4. On which planet has a rotating oval of clouds, twice as wide as Earth, called the 'Great Red Spot' been observed for more than 300 years ? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.4.(c) Jupiter is the largest planet in the solar system. It is made mostly of hydrogen and helium. Number of Moons - 95. Neptune - It is the only planet in our solar system not visible to the naked eye. It has 14 Moons.

question: Q.5. Which scientist thought of the concept of the steady state of the universe? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Harold Jeffrey ', '(b) Edwin Hubble ', '(c) Fred Hoyle ', '(d) Pierre - Laplace ']
solution: Sol.5.(c) Fred Hoyle. Steady-State Theory : It is a theoretical model i n which the U niverse is constantly expanding but with a fixed average density. The theory was put forward by three scientists (1948) : Sir Hermann Bondi, Thomas Gold, and Sir Fred Hoyle.

question: Q.6. From the given alternatives, identify the dwarf planet. Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 2)
solution: Sol.6.(a) Pluto. The five dwarf planets are Ceres, Pluto, Makemake, Haumea, and Eris. A dwarf planet is a celestial body that is in orbit around the Sun and has enough mass to be roughly round in shape.

question: Q.7. Which among the following planets is also known as "morning star"? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.7.(c) Venus - The second planet closest to the sun. It is also called Earth‚Äôs twin sister because it is similar in size and density as of the Earth. It is also known a s Morning and Evening Star. It rotates from east to west i.e. in clockwise direction. It does not have its own natural satellite.

question: Q.8. Cosmic snowballs of frozen gases, rock and dust that orbit the Sun are known as_______. SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.8.(d) Comets. Meteors are bits of rock and ice that are ejected from comets as they move in their orbits about the Sun. Meteorite - Asteroids after the collision are known as a meteorite. usually originate from the asteroid belt between Mars and Jupiter.

question: Q.9. Which among the following is the coldest planet in the solar system? SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.9.(d) Uranus. Neptune is the second coldest planet. Venus is the hottest planet of all eight planets.

question: Q.10. The Kuiper Belt is a ring of icy rocks & dust bodies just outside the orbit of___. SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.10.(d) Neptune - Farthest-known planet from the Sun. R otation on its axis - 16 hours. Revolution - 165 Earth years. Size - 17 times the mass of E arth. Moons - 14. Natural satellite - Triton (largest moon). Only a planet which i s invisible to the naked eye.

question: Q.11. The moon moves around the earth in about ______ _ days. SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.11.(c) 27. Moon is the only natural satellite of planet Earth. It takes 27 days, 7 hours and 43 minutes to complete one revolution around the Earth. Earth's Moon is the fifth largest m oon in the solar system (Largest - Ganymede of Jupiter). Distance - 384,400 kilometers from Earth.

question: Q.12. Minal wrote an essay on the largest moon of Saturn. Which among the following moons is it? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.12.(b) Titan - The second-largest moon in our solar system. Ganymede (Jupiter‚Äôs moon ) is the largest moon in the solar system. Atlas - It is a satellite of Saturn which was discovered by Richard Terrile. Carme - It is one of the moons of Jupiter which was discovered by Seth Barnes Nicholson. Europa - It is the moon of Jupiter.

question: Q.13. What is the radius of the earth? SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.13.(b) 6371 km. Earth Distance from the Sun (150 million km), Surface area: 510.1 million km¬≤, Land area: 149 million km¬≤, Gravity: 9.8 m/s¬≤.

question: Q.14. Which of the following constellations is also called the hunter? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Cassiopeia ', '(b) Leo Major ', '(c) Ursa Major ', '(d) Orion ']
solution: Sol.14.(d) Orion is located on the celestial equator and can be seen throughout the world. It is named after the hunter in Greek. Ursa Major or Great Bear: A constellation in the northern sky. The constellation Leo : Seen in the northern hemisphere in the spring. Cassiopeia : A large constellation located in the northern sky, named after Cassiopeia, the vain and boastful queen in greek. There are 88 constellations.

question: Q.15. Which among the following is another word for universe? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.15.(c) Cosmos (Greek word) meaning both "order" and "world". Q.16 . Each orbit of the International Space Station (ISS) takes _____minutes . SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) 80 - 82 (b) 85 - 87 (c) 90 - 93 (d) 83 - 86 Sol.16.(c) 90-93 . In 24 hours, the space station makes 16 orbits of Earth, traveling through 16 sunrises and sunsets.

question: Q.17. In approximately how much time does Mars complete one spin on its axis? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.17.(d) 1 d ay. R otation time of p lanets (Approx.): Earth (1 day - 23 hours 56 min), Jupiter (9 hours 56 minutes), Saturn (10 hours 4 0 minutes), Uranus (17 hours 14 minutes) and Neptune (16 hours).

question: Q.18. Which among the following is not a type of solar eclipse? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.18.(c) Penumbral (Lunar eclipse) . A solar eclipse occurs when the Moon passes between Earth and the Sun. Types of solar eclipse: Total (Completely blocking the face of t he Sun), Hybrid (the Moon is farther away from Earth, it appears smaller than the Sun and does not completely cover the Sun) and Annular (when Sun is at or near its farthest point from Earth).

question: Q.19. The distance of the Sun from the Earth is about ________ light minutes. SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.19.(d) 8. Interstellar distance: Distance between any two celestial bodies; measured in astronomical units (AU). Moon: 1.3 light-seconds away from the Earth. Proxima Centauri: 4.2 light-years from Sun. Light - year is the distance light travels in one year. 1 Light year = 63241 AU (approx).

question: Q.20. The asteroid belt lies between which two planets ? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Jupiter and Saturn ', '(b) Mars and Jupiter ', '(c) Saturn and Uranus ', '(d) Mercury and Venus ']
solution: Sol.20.(b) Mars and Jupiter. Asteroid Belt separates the inner and outer planets. Jupiter and Saturn, Uranus and Neptune are the Outer planets (Last four from the Sun) and also known as Jovian Planets. The first four planets (Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars) are known as Inner or Terrestrial planets.

question: Q.21. In early 1610, who discovered with his newly invented telescope that Jupiter has four moons? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Simon Marius ', '(b) Tycho Brahe ', '(c) Galileo Galilei ', '(d) Johannes Kepler ']
solution: Sol.21.(c) Galileo Galilei. He was an Italian astronomer and scientist. He described the rings of S aturn, t he phases of Venus, sunsets, and the bumpy lunar surface. The four moons he discovered were: Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto.

question: Q.22. Who was the first to accurately describe the rings of Saturn as a disc around the planet in 1655? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Hideki Yukawa ', '(b) Galileo Galilei ', '(c) Christiaan Huygens ', '(d) Giovanni Cassini ']
solution: Sol.22.(c) Christiaan Huygens. His other inventions: pendulum clock, Centrifugal governors and magic lantern.

question: Q.23. The moon completes ______ rotation on its axis as it completes one revolution around the Earth. SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning) ( a) 3 (b) 2 (c) 1 (d) 4 Sol.23.(c) 1. The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite circling the planet at an average distance of 384,400 kilometers. The Moon's presence helps stabilize our planet and moderate our climate. A single orbit of our planet takes the Moon 27.3 Earth days - The same amount of time it takes for the satellite to also rotate once on its axis. Huygens is the Moon's tallest mountain.
Q.24. Which of the following is a part of celestial objects? I. Stars , II. Planets , III. Moon SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Only I and III ', '(b) Only I and II ', '(c) I, II and III ', '(d) Only II and III ']
solution: Sol.24.(c) I, II and III. Celestial bodies (heavenly bodies) include: Planets, Stars, Satellites, Comets, Asteroids, Meteors and Meteorites, Galaxies. Halley's Comet (1P/Halley) is a short-period comet visible from Earth every 75‚Äì79 years.

question: Q.25. Which of the following statements regarding the moon is correct? I. The size of the illuminated part of the moon visible from the Earth increases each day after the new moon day. II. After the full moon day, the sunlit part of the moon visible from the Earth decreases in size every day. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Both I and II ', '(b) Only I ', '(c) Neither I nor II ', '(d) Only II ']
solution: Sol.25.(a) Both I and II. When there are two full moons within a month, the second full moon is called a Blue Moon, When a full moon occurs at its perigee (the moon is closest to the earth) it is called a Supermoon.

question: Q.26. Which of the following dwarf planets lies in the main asteroid belt ? SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.26.(c) Ceres is a dwarf planet in the asteroid belt between the orbits of Mars and Jupiter. Eris i s the most m assive and one of t he largest known d warf planets in the Solar System. Haumea is a dwarf planet located beyond Neptune's orbit.

question: Q.27. The ______ radiation belts are giant swaths of magnetically trapped highly energetic charged particles that surround Earth. SSC CGL 13/04/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.27.(a) Van Allen. An aurora is a natural phenomenon which is characterized by a display of a natural-coloured (green, red, yellow or white) light in the sky. Kuiper belt, flat ring of icy small bodies that revolve around the Sun beyond the orbit of the planet Neptune.

question: Q.28. Which of the following celestial bodies has a natural satellite named ‚ÄòCharon‚Äô? SSC MTS 05/10/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.28.(b) Pluto . Charon is known as Pluto. It is the largest of the five known natural satellites of the dwarf planet Pluto.

question: Q.29. Which of the following is the windiest planet in the solar system? SSC MTS 14/10/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.29.(a) Neptune is the eighth and farthest-known Solar planet from the Sun. It is 17 times the mass of Earth. Neptune is dark, cold, and very windy.

question: Q.30. In which of t he following periods is the meteor shower named Quadrantids generally visible from Earth? SSC MTS 20/10/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.30.(d) December/January. The meteor shower named Quadrantids is generally visible from Earth . The Quadrantids can produce over 100 meteors per hour in a moonless sky.

question: Q.31. In which of the following months may the meteor shower named Lyrids be seen from Earth? SSC MTS 20/10/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) April ( b) February (c) June (d) August Sol.31.(a) April. The radiant point for t he Lyrid meteor shower is near the constellation Lyra, which has the bright star Vega in the east.', '', '', '']

question: Q.32. IC 1101 is a ______. SSC CHSL 06/08/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.32.(b) galaxy. I C 1101 is a supergiant elliptical galaxy at the center of t he Abell 2029 galaxy cluster and is one of the largest known galaxies.

question: Q.33. The approximate period between two consecutive new moons is ___ days. SSC CPO 24/11/2020 (Morning)
solution: Sol.33.(c) 29.5 days . The time interval between a full moon and the next repetition of the same phase, a synodic month, averages about 29.53 days.

question: Q.34. What is the radius of the moon? SSC CHSL 19/03/2020 (Morning)
solution: Sol.34.(d) 1.74 √ó 10 6 m . The distance between the moon and the earth is 384,400 km.

question: Q.35. During the phenomenon of aphelion, the approximate distance between the earth and the sun is: SSC CHSL 12/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 137 million km ', '(b) 152 million km ', '(c) 147 million km ', '(d) 142 million km ']
solution: Sol.35.(b) 152 million km. Aphelion is the point of the Earth‚Äôs orbit that is farthest away from the Sun. P erihelion is the point of the Earth‚Äôs orbit that is nearest to the Sun.

question: Q.36. The _____ is responsible for E arth's magnetic field. SSC CHSL 16/10/2020(Morning)
options: ['(a) inner core ', '(b) mantle ', '(c) outer core ', '(d) crust ']
solution: Sol.36.(c) outer core. On Earth, flowing liquid metal in the outer core of the planet generates electric currents. The rotation of Earth on its axis causes these electric currents to form a magnetic fi eld which extends around the planet.

question: Q.37. The process that moves, elevates or builds up portions of the earth‚Äôs crust is called: SSC CHSL 16/10/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.37.(d) Diastrophism . Denudation is the process of wearing away the Earth's surface by weathering and erosion. Volcanism is the process of molten rock (magma) erupting onto the Earth's surface.

question: Q.38. The bodies glowing i n the night sky are known as ______. SSC CGL 03/03/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.38.(a) Celestial bodies are objects in space, such as stars, planets, moons, and galaxies.

question: Q.39. Lucifer is another name for the planet______. SSC CGL 03/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.39.(c) Venus. Lucifer means ‚ÄúLight- bringer‚Äù. Other Planet Nickname - Ringed Planet (Saturn), Red Planet (Mars), Giant Planet (Jupiter).

question: Q.40. Planetary scientists call the thin gaseous envelope around the Moon as the ______. SSC CGL 04/03/2020(Morning)
options: ['(a) lunar exosphere ', '(b) lunar stratosphere ', '(c) lunar thermosphere ', '(d) lunar endosphere ']
solution: Sol.40.(a) lunar exosphere bounded by the emptiness of space and the Moon‚Äôs surface , is an atmosphere so thin that atoms really collide. Chandrayaan-2 observed Argon-40 in the lunar exosphere.

question: Q.41. How many degrees does the Earth rotate about its own axis in one hour? SSC CGL 06/03/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.41.(d) 15. On i ts axis, the earth rotates 360 degrees every 24 hours. Longitudes and Latitudes

question: Q.42. Which of the following sets of statements are correct about Inter Tropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ)? a. The ITCZ is a broad trough of low pressure in equatorial latitudes. b. This is where the northeast and the southeast trade winds converge. c. The ITCZ is the equatorial trough normally positioned about 5¬∞N of the equator and remains there throughout the year. d. The ITCZ moves over to the plane of Ganga in Summer. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Only a and c ', '(b) a, b and c ', '(c) Only b and c ', '(d) a, b and d ']
solution: Sol.42.(d) a, b and d. Intertropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) - The region that circles the Earth, near the equator, where the trade winds of the Northern and Southern Hemispheres come together. Seasonal shifts in the location of the ITCZ drastically affects rainfall in many equatorial nations, resulting in the wet and dry seasons of t he tropics rather than the cold and warm seasons of higher latitudes.

question: Q.43. During October-November, the apparent movement of the sun is towards the __________. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.43.(d) South. The position of the rising sun keeps on moving towards the south in the period from 21st June to 22nd December. This period is called Dakshinayan . From 22nd December to 21st June, the sun keeps on moving towards the north. This period is called Uttarayan.

question: Q.44. The southern part of India lies in the _________ belt. SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon
solution: Sol.44.(d) Warm - The region between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn is characterized by hot temperatures, high humidity, and abundant rainfall.

question: Q.45. T ropic of C ancer (23¬∞30‚Ä≤ N) passes through__________ state of india. SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.45.(c) Chhattisgarh. The Tropic of Cancer passes through eight states in India - Gujarat (Jasdan), Rajasthan (Kalinjarh), Madhya Pradesh (Shajapur), Chhattisgarh (Sonhat), Jharkhand (Lohardaga), West Bengal (Krishnanagar), Tripura (Udaipur) and Mizoram (Champhai).

question: Q.46. On which of the following two dates does the equinox fall? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) 21 June and 23 September ', '(b) 21 March and 21 June ', '(c) 21 March and 23 September ', '(d) 23 September and 22 December ']
solution: Sol.46.(c) 21 March and 23 September . Equinox is the situation when the equator receives the vertical rays of the Sun and day and night are equal. S pring e quinox - 21st March, Autumn equinox - 23 September. 21st June (winter solstice in Southern Hemisphere, Summer solstice in Northern hemisphere) - The rays of t he sun fall directly on the Tropic of Cancer. 22 December (Summer solstice in Southern hemisphere, winter solstice in Northern Hemisphere) - The rays of the sun fall directly on the Tropic of Capricorn.

question: Q.47. From the north most t o south most point of India, what is the extent of India? SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.47.(c) 3214 km. Extent of India: East to west (2,933 km), land frontier (15,200 km), coastline (7,516.6 km). The westernmost point (Ghuar Moti in Kutch). The easternmost point (Kibithu in Arunachal Pradesh). Indira Col (northernmost point). Indira Point (Great Nicobar Island, Andaman sea) is the Southernmost point of India while Kanyakumari is the southernmost point of the Indian Mainland.

question: Q.48. What is the zone between the arctic circle and north pole called? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Torrid zone ', '(b) Frigid zone ', '(c) North temperate zone ', '(d) South temperate zone ']
solution: Sol.48.(b) Frigid zone. The North Frigid Zone, between the North Pole at 90¬∞ N and the Arctic Circle at 66¬∞33‚Ä≤48.7" N, covers 4.12% of Earth's surface.

question: Q.49. The 90 degree East Meridian does NOT pass through: SSC CPO 24/11/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.49.(b) Sikkim. The 90 degree East Meridian passes through Assam and Meghalaya in India and it crosses Bhutan and Bangladesh.

question: Q.50. 1¬∞ latitude is equal to approximately ______ km. SSC CHSL 16/10/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.50.(a) 111 km. This distance decreases marginally as one travels to poles and increases marginally as one goes towards the equator.

question: Q.51. Lines joining located at equal t ravel time from a common centre are called: SSC CHSL 21/10/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.51.(b) Isochrones . Isohaline - A line drawn on a map to indicate connecting points of equal salinity in the ocean. Isonomal - A line on a chart connecting points of equal abundance values of a plant species sampled in different sections of an area. Isobronts - A line drawn through geographical points at which a given phase of thunderstorm activity occurred simultaneously.

question: Q.52. All parallel circles from the Equator to the poles are known as ______. SSC CHSL 26/10/2020(Evening)
options: ['(a) Parallels of Latitude ', '(b) Arctic Circle ', '(c) Tropic of Cancer ', '(d) Antarctic Circle ']
solution: Sol.52.(a) Parallels of Latitude. The parallels of latitude refer to the angular distance, in degrees, minutes and seconds of a point north or south of the Equator.

question: Q.53. Name the state capital located 530 metres above the sea level between 93 East longitude and 27 North latitude. SSC CGL 09/03/2020 (Evening)
solution: Sol.53.(b) Itanagar (capital of Arunachal Pradesh). Other State Capital Latitude and Longitude - Patna (25 North, 85 East), Dispur (26 North, 91 East), Hyderabad (17 North, 78 East). Continents and Oceans

question: Q.54. Which of the following is the correct match between column-A and column-B? Column - A Column - B (Elements in earth (Total % in earth crust) crust) i. Oxygen a. 8% ii. Silicon b. 28% iii. Aluminium c. 47% iv. Iron d. 5% SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) i-a, ii-b, iii-c, iv-d ', '(b) i-c, ii-a, iii-b, iv-d ', '(c) i-c, ii-b, iii-a, iv-d ', '(d) i-b, ii-a, iii-c, iv-d ']
solution: Sol.54.(c) i-c, ii-b, i ii-a, iv-d. Abundances of other Element in the Earth‚Äôs Crust: Calcium (Ca) - 3.63%, Sodium (Na) - 2.83%, Potassium (K) - 2.59%, Magnesium (Mg) - 2.09% and others - 1.41%. Earth has three layers: crust (upper layer), mantle (middle layer), and core (lower layer).

question: Q.55. Continental Shelf which is the shallowest part of the ocean has an average gradient of: SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) 1¬∞ or even less ', '(b) 2¬∞ or even less ', '(c) 8¬∞ or even less ', '(d) 5¬∞ or even less ']
solution: Sol.55.(a) 1¬∞ or even less. The Continental Shelf is the extended margin of each continent occupied by relatively shallow seas and gulfs. About Continental Shelf : The shelf typically ends at a very steep slope, called the shelf break. Their width varies globally, with an average of about 80 km, but c an be narrower or even absent in some regions, such as the coasts of Chile and the west coast of Sumatra.

question: Q.56. The earth's perihelion occurs in: SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.56.(b) January. Perihelion - It is the point of t he Earth‚Äôs orbit t hat is nearest to the Sun. This always happens in early January about two weeks after the December Solstice. Aphelion - It is the point of the Earth‚Äôs orbit that is farthest away from the Sun. It always happens in early July about two weeks after the June solstice.

question: Q.57. What is the name of the large supercontinent that existed 200 million years ago when all the continents were together ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.57.(a) Pangea. Alfred Wegener propounded Continental Drift Theory in 1912. He proposed that the continents were once united into a single supercontinent called Pangaea (meaning all earth). The evidence in support of t he continental drift theory: Jigsaw Fit, Geological Fit, Tectonic Fit, Glacial Deposits, Fossil Evidence.

question: Q.58. Living organisms have been on Earth for how much percent of Earth's history? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.58.(c) 80%. Taking Earth's age as nearly 4.6 Billion Years (BY), instead of 13.7 BY from the Big Bang, unicellular life appeared nearly 3.8 BY ago. This percentage is 3.8/4.6 X 100 = 82.6%, nearly.

question: Q.59. Choose the correct statement(s) related to ‚Äòcontinentality‚Äô. a. The sea exerts a moderating influence on climate. b. As the distance from the sea increases, the people experience extreme weather conditions. c. As one goes from the surface of the earth to higher altitudes, the atmosphere becomes less dense and temperature decreases. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) b and c ', '(b) Only c ', '(c) a and c ', '(d) a and b ']
solution: Sol.59.(d) a and b. C ontinentality - Found in inland areas. It is very hot during summers and very cold during winters. Continental climates are common between 40¬∞ and 70¬∞ north latitude and experience large temperature differences between day and night.

question: Q.60. The Arabian Sea is an extension of which of the following oceans? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Pacific Ocean ', '(b) Southern Ocean ', '(c) Arctic Ocean ', '(d) Indian ocean ']
solution: Sol.60.(d) Indian ocean is the only ocean in the world which has been named after a country. The Indian Ocean bridges the gap between East and the West. The Western and Eastern parts are known a s the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal. Pacific Ocean - Largest and deepest ocean in the world.

question: Q.61. What does El Ni√±o refer to ? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Hot water current ', '(b) Pressure water current ', '(c) High air pressure ', '(d) Low air pressur ']
solution: Sol.61.(a) Hot water current. The term E l Nino (Little Boy in Spanish) - Warming of the ocean surface, or above-average sea surface temperatures, in the central and eastern tropical Pacific Ocean on the coast of P eru. El n ino leads to weakening of trade winds in a region. La N ina (Little Girl in Spanish) - The periodic cooling of ocean surface temperatures in the central and east-central equatorial Pacific.

question: Q.62. Which of the following oceans is surrounded by the continent of North America and South America to the east? SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Pacific Ocean ', '(b) Atlantic Ocean ', '(c) Indian Ocean ', '(d) Arctic Ocean ']
solution: Sol.62.(a) Pacific Ocean (world‚Äôs largest and deepest ocean): It represents 45 percent of the global ocean surface. The International Date Line (established in 1884) passes through the mid-Pacific Ocean. Atlantic Ocean (S - shaped) : Deepest trench - Puerto Rico; The Sargasso sea, the only sea in the world without any shore (land boundary), is present in the Atlantic ocean. Indian Ocean (the warmest) : Deepest trench - Sunda (or Java trench). The Antarctic Ocean (Southern Ocean) is known for i ts turbulent waters.

question: Q.63. Which of the following oceans extends into the Mediterranean Sea ? SSC MTS 08/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Indian Ocean ', '(b) Pacific Ocean ', '(c) Atlantic Ocean ', '(d) Arctic Ocean ']
solution: Sol.63.(c) Atlantic Ocean is the 2nd largest ocean in the world. The Mediterranean is an intercontinental sea spread between Europe, North Africa, and Western Asia and connected to the Atlantic Ocean through the strait of Gibraltar. Indian Ocean - 3rd largest Ocean in the world. Pacific Ocean - Largest ocean in the world. Arctic Ocean - Smallest ocean in the world.

question: Q.64. The mohororvicic (Moho) discontinuity separates ? SSC MTS 13/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ["(a) Earth's lithosphere and asthenosphere ", "(b) Earth's atmosphere and hydrosphere ", "(c) Earth's crust and the inner core ", "(d) Earth's crust and the mantle "]
solution: Sol.64.(d) Earth's crust and the mantle. Moho discontinuity - It occurs at an average depth of about 8 kilometers beneath the ocean basins and 32 kilometers beneath continental surfaces.

question: Q.65. The periodic growth and drop of sea water level is known as: SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.65.(c) Tide: Forms when there is an increase or decrease in the sea level that happens periodically because of the gravitational force of the moon and sun. Types of Tides: Tides Based on Frequency - Semi-Diurnal Tides, Diurnal Tides, Mixed. Tides Based on the Position of Earth, Sun, and the Moon - Spring Tides, Neap Tides.

question: Q.66. Due to the attraction of t he sun and the moon, what is the frequency of up and falls of ocean water in a day? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.66.(a) Two. When the Earth, Sun, and Moon line up, their gravitational power combines to make exceptionally high tides where the bulges occur, called spring tides, as well as very low tides where the water has been displaced. When the Sun is at a right angle to the Moon, moderate tides, called neap tides. There are generally three types of tides: Diurnal - One high and low t ide each d ay, Semi-diurnal - Two high and low tides each day, and Mixed - Two high and low tides each day of different heights.

question: Q.67. Where does the lower salinity water rest with the higher salinity dense water? SSC CGL 20/0g7/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Above ', '(b) Below ', '(c) It combines ', '(d) It is separate ']
solution: Sol.67.(a) Above. Salinity is the measure of t he amount of d issolved salts in water. Evaporation of ocean water and formation of sea ice both increase the salinity of the ocean. Lake Van of T urkey has the highest salinity in the world at 330 %. The saltiest ocean water is in the Red Sea and in the Persian Gulf region (around 40 ppt) due to very high evaporation. Freshwater from rivers has a salinity value of 0.5 ppt or less.

question: Q.68. Which is the correct sequence of oceans according to size (from largest to smallest)? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Pacific Ocean > Antarctic Ocean > Indian Ocean > Atlantic Ocean ', '(b) Pacific Ocean > Indian Ocean > Antarctic Ocean > Atlantic Ocean ', '(c) Pacific Ocean > Atlantic Ocean > Indian Ocean > Antarctic Ocean ', '(d) Pacific Ocean > Indian Ocean > Atlantic Ocean > Antarctic Ocean ']
answer: (c) Pacific Ocean > Atlantic Ocean > Indian Ocean > Antarctic Ocean
solution: Sol.68.(c) Pacific Ocean (the world‚Äôs largest) : The name was given by Ferdinand Magellan; The International Date Line passes through the Pacific Ocean.

question: Q.69. Identify the odd option in relation to the oceanic layers. Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1)
options: ['(a) The Oceanic Deeps ', '(b) The Oceanic Slope ', '(c) The Continental Shelf ', '(d) The Continental Slope ']
solution: Sol.69.(b) The Oceanic Slope. Continental Shelf - Extends from the coastline of a continent to a drop-off point called the shelf break. Continental Slope - From the break, the shelf descends toward the deep ocean floor. The Deep Sea Plain (Abyssal plain) i s an underwater plain on the deep ocean floor, usually found at depths between 3,000 meters and 6,000 meters. Trenches (The ocean deeps) are prominent long, narrow topographic depressions of the ocean floor

question: Q.70. Where is the deepest point on earth, the Mariana Trench, located? SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Atlantic Ocean ', '(b) Pacific Ocean ', '(c) Indian Ocean ', '(d) Arctic Ocean ']
solution: Sol.70.(b) Pacific Ocean - largest ocean on the Earth. It occupies one-third of t he earth‚Äôs surface. It separates Asia and Australia from North America and South America.

question: Q.71. The Arctic Ocean is located within the Arctic Circle and surrounds the North Pole. It is connected with the Pacific Ocean by a narrow stretch of shallow water known as SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.71.(a) Bering. Bosphorus strait is a natural strait, located in northwestern Turkey, connecting the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara. Hudson Strait links the northern seaports of Manitoba and Ontario with the Atlantic Ocean. Palk Strait is a strait between India and Sri Lanka. It connects the Bay of Bengal in the northeast with the Gulf of Mannar in the southwest.

question: Q.72. Which continent provides more than half of the world's tin? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.72.(c) Asia . It is the largest (30% of the Earth‚Äôs land area) and most p opulous (60% of the total population) continent. Asia is the biggest producer (90% of the world‚Äôs production) of rice. About 3 0% of the world‚Äôs reserves of i ron ore are found in Asia. Biggest producer of tin (in the world) - China. Leading tin producing state in India - Chhattisgarh.

question: Q.73. Which of the following statements regarding ocean currents is correct? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) The Labrador Ocean current is warm current. ', '(b) The areas where the warm and cold currents meet provide the best fishing grounds. ', '(c) The cold ocean currents move towards the poles. ', '(d) The warm ocean currents move towards the equator. ']
answer: (b) The areas where the warm and cold currents meet provide the best fishing grounds.
solution: Sol.73.(b) Ocean currents are the continuous, predictable, directional movement of seawater driven by gravity, wind (Coriolis Effect), and water density. Largest ocean current on Earth: Antarctic Circumpolar Current (ACC).

question: Q.74. The percentage of earth's water found in the oceans is _________. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.74.(b) 97.2 percent. Water covers 71 percent of E arth's surface. Distribution of Earth‚Äôs water: Oceans (97.2%) , Glaciers (2.1%), Groundwater (0.61 percent); Freshwater lakes (0.009 percent), Inland seas (0.008 percent), Soil Moisture (0.005 percent), Atmosphere (0.001 percent), Rivers (0.0001 percent).

question: Q.75. How thick is the lithosphere? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.75.(c) 10 to 200 km. The lithosphere is the outermost and mechanical layer of the Earth that consists of t he entire crust and the top-most portion of the mantle. Mechanically, the earth‚Äôs layers can be divided into lithosphere, asthenosphere (80-200 km), mesospheric mantle , o uter core, and inner core.

question: Q.76. The t heory of plate tectonics proposes that the earth‚Äôs lithosphere is divided into______ major and some minor plates. SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.76.(a) 7. A tectonic plate (lithospheric plate) is a massive, irregularly-shaped slab of solid rock, generally composed of both continental and oceanic lithosphere. In 1967, McKenzie and Parker suggested the theory of plate tectonics. It states that the Earth's solid outer crust, the lithosphere, is separated into plates that move over the asthenosphere, the molten upper portion of the mantle.

question: Q.77. The crust is the Earth's outermost layer that is less than ______ percent of Earth by mass, with oceanic crust and continental crust often consisting of more felsic rocks. SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.77.(b) 1. The average density of oceanic crust is 3.0 g/cm 3 , while continental crust has an average of 2.7 g/cm 3 . The mass of t he continental crust is 2.195. The continental crust ( about 30 km) is composed of lighter (felsic) sodium potassium aluminum silicate rocks, like granite. The oceanic crust (about 5 km) is composed of dense (mafic) iron magnesium silicate igneous rocks, like basalt.

question: Q.78. What percentage of e arth‚Äôs water is fresh? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.78.(d) 2.7 Percent. The present Antarctic ice sheet accounts for 90 percent of E arth's total ice volume and 70 percent of its fresh water.

question: Q.79. Movement of fault lines can cause: SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) a flood ', '(b) sudden rain ', '(c) an earthquake ', '(d) a storm ']
solution: Sol.79.(c) An Earthquake. Over 80 percent of earthquakes occur around the edges of the Pacific Ocean, an area known as the 'Ring of Fire' . Instrument used for measuring Earthquake: Seismograph.

question: Q.80. Which of the following is NOT one of the major tectonic plates of the earth? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Nazca plate ', '(b) Pacific plate ', '(c) Africa with the eastern Atlantic floor plate ', '(d) India - Australia - New Zealand plate ']
solution: Sol.80.(a) Nazca plate : Between South America and the Pacific plate. Seven major plates: A frican, Antarctic, Eurasian, Indo-Australian, North American, Pacific and South American.

question: Q.81. What is the average salinity of the Indian ocean? Graduate Level 03/08/2022 ( Shift - 3 )
solution: Sol.81.(b) 35 o/oo (35 parts per thousand) . Salinity is the amount of salt present in 1000 grams of water. A salinity of 24.7 % has been regarded as the upper limit to fix ‚Äòbrackish water‚Äô.

question: Q.82. Tsunami is NOT caused by: Higher Secondary 03/08/2022 (Shift - 4 )
options: ['(a) Hurricanes ', '(b) volcanic eruptions ', '(c) undersea landslides ', '(d) Earthquakes ']
solution: Sol.82.(a) Hurricanes. Tsunamis are giant waves caused by earthquakes or volcanic eruptions under the sea.

question: Q.83. Which of the following is a warm current? SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Labrador current ', '(b) Falkland current ', '(c) Canary current ', '(d) Gulf stream ']
solution: Sol.83.(d) Gulf stream. The Gulf Stream current in the North Atlantic and the Kuroshio Current in the North Pacific are warm currents. Warm Currents - Alaskan Current, Tsushima Current, Brazilian Current etc. Cold Current - Labrador Current, Canary Current, Benguela Current, Falkland Current, South Indian Ocean Current, Okhotsk Current, Humboldt or Peruvian Current etc.

question: Q.84. The plate movements on earth are classified into ______ types. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.84.(a) three. The movement of the plates creates three types of tectonic boundaries: convergent, where plates move into one another; divergent, where plates move apart; and transform, where plates move sideways in relation to each other.

question: Q.85. Ocean acidification is the ongoing decrease in the pH of t he Earth‚Äôs oceans, caused by the uptake of ______ from the atmosphere. SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.85.(b) Carbon dioxide. Ocean acidification is the worldwide reduction in the pH of seawater as a consequence of the absorption of large amounts of carbon dioxide by the oceans. It results in the alteration of marine food chains and food supply to humans.

question: Q.86. The lowest known p oint on earth is called ________, which is present in the Pacific Ocean. SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Factorial Deep ', '(b) Challenger Deep ', '(c) Great Blue Hole ', '(d) Great Barrier Reef ']
solution: Sol.86.(b) Challenger Deep. It is located beneath the western Pacific Ocean. Factorian Deep is the new deepest point in Antarctica's Southern Ocean. The Great Blue Hole is a giant marine sinkhole off the coast of Belize. The great barrier reef is the world‚Äôs largest coral reef located in Australia.

question: Q.87. In coastal areas, during the night, wind blows from land to sea because: SSC MTS 18/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) low pressure is created on land ', '(b) land cools slower than water ', '(c) water cools slower than land ', '(d) high pressure is created at sea ']
solution: Sol.87.(c) water cools slower than land. The wind blowing from land towards the sea is the Land b reeze. The wind blowing from the sea towards the land is a Sea breeze. Both are i nduced by differences that occur between the heating or cooling of the water surface and the adjacent land surface.

question: Q.88. Which of the following countries belong to the polar regions? SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.88.(a) Canada. The Polar region covers parts of eight countries: Canada, Greenland, Iceland, Norway, Sweden, Finland, Russia, and the United States.

question: Q.89. The process of seepage of water into the ground is called ____. SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.89.(a) Infiltration occurs when surface water enters the soil. Depletion is an accrual accounting technique used to allocate the cost of extracting natural resources such as timber, minerals, and oil from the earth. Replenishment of the mineral resources includes the process of mineral deposit exploration.

question: Q.90. Which water body covers an area 2 of 1,55,58,000 ùëòùëö and makes up only 4.3% of the global ocean? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Atlantic Ocean ', '(b) Arctic Ocean ', '(c) Southern Ocean ', '(d) Indian Ocean ']
solution: Sol.90.(b) Arctic Ocean is the smallest and shallowest of the world's five major oceans. The Arctic Ocean is centered approximately on the North Pole. The Pacific Ocean represents 45 percent of the global ocean coverage. The Indian Ocean occupies 20 percent of the global sea area. The Southern Ocean circles Antarctica and connects the Indian, Atlantic, and Pacific oceans.

question: Q.91. Which is the largest continental shelf in the world? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) The shelf of India ', '(b) The Indian Ocean shelf ', '(c) The shelf in the Pacific Ocean ', '(d) The Siberian shelf in the Arctic Ocean ']
answer: (d) The Siberian shelf in the Arctic Ocean
solution: Sol.91.(d) The Siberian shelf in the Arctic Ocean. A continental shelf is the edge of a continent that lies under the ocean. Example of a Continental Shelf Landform: Siberian Shelf, Arctic Ocean.

question: Q.92. Which outside layer of the Earth is less dense, thick, and andesitic to granite composition ? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Oceanic crust ', '(b) Continental crust ', '(c) Mantle ', '(d) Outer core ']
solution: Sol.92.(b) Continental crust, the the outermost l ayer of E arth's lithosphere is mostly composed of different types of granites. It is rich in Aluminium and silica.

question: Q.93. Which of the following is a group of islands found in the tropical oceans consisting of coral reefs and a central depression? SSC CGL 19/04/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.93.(b) Atoll. Examples - Atoll Caroline Islands, the Coral Sea Islands, the Marshall Islands, the Tuamotu Islands, Kiribati, Tokelau, and Tuvalu. Guyot is an undersea mountain. L agoons are shallow bodies of water that are separated from the ocean by a barrier reef. Seamounts are underwater mountains that rise above the ocean floor but do not reach the surface.

question: Q.94. The Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument is located in the SSC CGL 20/04/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Arctic Ocean ', '(b) Arabian Sea ', '(c) Atlantic Ocean ', '(d) Red Sea ']
solution: Sol.94.(c) Atlantic Ocean. Arabian Sea, Northwestern part of the Indian Ocean, lying between India and the Arabian Peninsula. The Red S ea contains some of the world's hottest and saltiest seawater. It is red because it contains a cyanobacteria called Trichodesmium erythraeum.

question: Q.95. Which of the following statements about tides is INCORRECT? SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) High tides occur when the moon is in its first and last quarter. ', '(b) Low tides are also called neap tides. ', '(c) Tides are caused by the gravitational pull exerted by the sun and the moon on Earth‚Äôs surface. ', '(d) Spring tides occur on full moon and new moon days. ']
answer: (a) High tides occur when the moon is in its first and last quarter.
solution: Sol.95.(a) One cycle of tides actually takes 24 hours and 50 minutes . The highest tides occur when the Moon is new or full.

question: Q.96. Name the only sea in the world t hat does NOT have a land boundary. SSC MTS 13/10/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Sargasso Sea ', '(b) Pechora Sea ', '(c) Amundsen Sea ', '(d) Iroise Sea ']
solution: Sol.96.(a) Sargasso Sea. It is a part of the Atlantic Ocean. It is named so because of the presence of brown Sargassum seaweed.

question: Q.97. Which of the following was NOT a part of Gondwanaland? SSC CGL 23/08/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Australia ', '(b) South America ', '(c) India ', '(d) North America ']
solution: Sol.97.(d) North America. The ancient supercontinent Gondwana incorporated present-day South America, Africa, Madagascar, India, Australia, and Antarctica.

question: Q.98. What is the normal air pressure at sea level? SSC CHSL 19/03/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.98.(a) 1013.25 millibars . The air pressure decreases as the altitude increases.

question: Q.99. India is divided into how many earthquake zones (seismic zones)? SSC CHSL 19/03/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.99.(b) 4. The Bureau of Indian Standards has classified regions in India into 4 seismic zones on the basis of historical seismic activity. These are zones II, III, IV and V. Zone V is the most seismically active region and Zone II is the least active. The magnitude scale used to measure earthquakes ranges from 1 to 12.

question: Q.100. Millions of years ago the Indian subcontinent was separated from the mainland by a large sea known as the: SSC CHSL 14/10/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.100.(a) Tethys . This Sea separated the supercontinent of Laurasia in the north from Gondwana in the south.

question: Q.101. What was the name of the mega-ocean that surrounded the single continental mass before the continental drift as described by Alfred Wegener? SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.101.(b) Panthalassa. Pangaea w as a supercontinent that existed during the late Paleozoic and early Mesozoic eras. Panama is a narrow land bridge, or isthmus, connecting North and South America. Neighbouring Countries of India

question: Q.102. Nepal, a neighbouring country of India, is located to the _________ of India SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.102.(b) North. India shares its Land border with seven c ountries - Afghanistan and Pakistan to the north-west, China, Bhutan and Nepal to the north, Myanmar to the far East and Bangladesh to the east. Sri Lanka (from south-east) and Maldives (from south-west) are two countries with water borders.

question: Q.103. Nepal does NOT share its boundary with which of the following states in India? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.103.(d) Manipur. Nepal (1751 km - Uttrakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, West Bengal, Sikkim).

question: Q.104. With which neighbouring country does India share the Sunderbans forest? SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.104.(c) Bangladesh. Sunderban forest is a part of the world's largest delta and home to the largest mangrove forests. It is the only mangrove habitat in the world for Panthera tigris species.

question: Q.105. In the Indian subcontinent, how many country/countries share its land frontiers with every member country of the subcontinent? SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.105.(d) One. The Indian subcontinent is a geographical region that includes India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, Nepal, Bhutan, Sri Lanka, and the Maldives.

question: Q.106. What is the capital of India‚Äôs neighbouring country Afghanistan? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.106.(d) Kabul. Other countries and their capital: Bangladesh (Dhaka), Bhutan (Thimphu), China (Beijing), Myanmar (Naypyidaw), Nepal (Kathmandu), Pakistan (Islamabad), and Sri Lanka - Colombo (Legislative capital) & Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte (Judicial capital).

question: Q.107. What is the currency of Bangladesh, a neighbouring country of India? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.107.(d) Taka. Capital of Bangladesh - Dhaka, Independence declared - 26 March 1971. Countries (Currency) - Afghanistan (Afghani), Bhutan (Ngultrum), Maldives (Rufiyaa), Myanmar (Kyat), Nepal (Nepalese rupee), Pakistan (Pakistani rupee), China (Chinese Yuan).

question: Q.108. The Sino - Indian border is divided into how many sectors? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.108.(d) 3. The Indian Military has divided the LAC (Line of Actual Control) into 3 sectors - Western sector across Ladakh and the Chinese-held Aksai Chin, The central sector across Himachal Pradesh and Uttrakhand states, and the eastern sector across Sikkim and Arunachal Pradesh states.

question: Q.109. Which of the following sites is located on the hills near the Brahmaputra valley on the way to China and Myanmar? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.109.(d) Daojali Hading. It is the first stratified neolithic site discovered in Northeast India in the state of Assam.

question: Q.110. Which of the following lines separates Pakistan and Afghanistan? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) McMohan line ', '(b) Jinnah line ', '(c) Durand line ', '(d) Radcliffe line ']
solution: Sol.110.(c) Durand Line. The Radcliffe line separates India and Pakistan (It also separates India and Bangladesh). The McMahon line (Henry McMahon) separates Arunachal Pradesh of India and Tibet of China.

question: Q.111. Which water treaty was signed between India and Pakistan in the year 1960? SSC MTS 26/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.111.(c) Indus. This Treaty allocates the Western Rivers (Indus, Jhelum, Chenab) to Pakistan and the Eastern Rivers (Ravi, Beas, Sutlej) to India.

question: Q.112. Which of the following is a hill pass located between India and China? SSC MTS 26/10/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Khyber Pass ', '(b) Pangsau Pass ', '(c) Karakoram Pass ', '(d) Zojila Pass ']
solution: Sol.112.(c) Karakoram P ass . The Khyber Pass is a mountain pass in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province of Pakistan, on the border with Afghanistan. Pangsau Pass lies on the crest of the Patkai Hills on the India‚ÄìMyanmar border. Zojila Pass is the strategic link connecting Ladakh to Srinagar and the rest of India.

question: Q.113. In which year was Sri Lanka discovered by the Portuguese? SSC MTS 27/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.113.(c) 1505. Sri Lanka got independence on February 4, 1948 and became a Republic on 22 May 1972.

question: Q.114. What is the main religion of Myanmar? SSC MTS 27/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.114.(d) Buddhism . On 4 January 1948, Myanmar became an independent republic.

question: Q.115. Which of the following is the highest mountain in Bhutan? SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Gangkhar Puensum ', '(b) Kula Kangri ', '(c) Jomolhari ', '(d) Gipmochi ']
solution: Sol.115.(a) Gangkhar Puensum (7,570 meters). Other Mountains of Bhutan : Kula Kangri (7538 m), Jomolhari. Bhutan : Capital - Thimphu, Currency - Ngultrum.

question: Q.116. _ _____the world's highest polo ground, is located in Pakistan. SSC CGL 03/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.116.(a) Shandur. The polo tournament is played between the teams of G ilgit District and Chitral District, under freestyle rules. The Shandur P olo Festival is held annually in July. Indian Drainage System

question: Q.117. Match the following Characteristics / Name of River Other Name A. Area of Badland 1. Godavari topography B. Vridh Ganga 2. Brahmaputra C. Tsangpo 3. Kosi D. Sorrow of Bihar 4. Chambal SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023
solution: Sol.117.(d) A-4, B-1, C-2, D-3. Chambal river : Origin - Singar Chouri peak in the northern slopes of the Vindhya mountains (Indore, Madhya Pradesh). Tributaries - Banas, Kali Sindh, Parbati. Godavari (Dakshin Ganga) : Largest Peninsular River in India. Tributaries - Pravara, Purna, Manjra, Penganga, Wardha, Wainganga, Pranhita, Indravati, Maner and the Sabri. Brahmaputra : Origin - Kailash ranges of Himalayas. It enters India's Arunachal Pradesh and flows through Assam and Bangladesh before it joins the Bay of Bengal.

question: Q.118. Trishulganga is a stream of the river: SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.118.(d) Gandak. It comprises two streams, namely Kaligandak and Trishulganga. It rises in the Nepal Himalayas between the Dhaulagiri and Mount Everest.

question: Q.119. The drainage basin of the Godavari river is present in which of the following states of India ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu ', '(b) Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Odisha ', '(c) Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Kamataka, and Tamil Nadu ', '(d) Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Odisha ']
answer: (b) Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, and Odisha
solution: Sol.119.(b) Godavari River (Dakshin Ganga) - Second longest river in India after t he Ganges River. Origin - Trimbakeshwar near Nashik in Maharashtra. It has Largest Peninsular River system and falls into the Bay of Bengal.

question: Q.120. The rivers Bhagirathi and Alaknanda meet to form river: SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.120.(a) Ganga. The tributaries and their location where they meet Ganga: Gomti river - Near Saidpur, Kaithi. Ghagra - Chhapra, Bihar. Gandak - Sonpur, Patna. Kosi - Katihar, Bihar.

question: Q.121. The Ravi, Chenab and Jhelum are tributaries of river: SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.121.(c) Indus (Sindhu): It originates from a glacier near Bokhar Chu. I ts other tributaries - Shyok, Gilgit, Zaskar, Hunza. The Panjnad is the name of five rivers of Punjab, namely Satluj, Beas, Ravi, Chenab and Jhelum. It falls into the Arabian Sea, east of Karachi.

question: Q.122. With which neighbouring country did India sign the Farakka Treaty in 1996 for sharing of the Ganga Waters and on augmenting its flows? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.122.(d) Bangladesh. Farakka water -sharing treaty - It was s igned by then PM H. D. Deve Gowda (India) and PM Sheikh Hasina Wajed (Bangladesh). India‚Äôs treaty with its Neighbours: Nepal Treaty - Mahakali treaty (1996), and Pakistan - Indus Waters Treaty (1960).

question: Q.123. The Chambal, Hindon and Tons rivers are tributaries of the river: SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.123.(a) Yamuna is the second-largest tributary river of the Ganges by discharge and the longest tributary in India, originating from the Yamunotri Glacier (Uttarakhand). Other tributaries (Yamuna) - Chambal, Betwa, Ken, Giri, Sind, Uttangan, Sengar and Rind. Tributaries of other rivers : Mahanadi - Seonath, Jonk, Hasdeo, Mand, Ong and Tel. Kaveri - Harangi, Hemavati, Lakshmana Tirtha, Amaravathi. Tapi - Vaki, Gomai, Arunavati.

question: Q.124. Identify the dam t hat is located in South India. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Gandhi Sagar dam ', '(b) Tilaiya dam ', '(c) Mettur dam ', '(d) Rihand dam ']
solution: Sol.124.(c) Mettur dam: Built on Kaveri river and located a t Mettur, Salem D istrict (Tamil Nadu). Gandhi Sagar dam - Built on Chambal River and located in the Mandsaur district (Madhya Pradesh). Tilaiya dam - Constructed by Damodar Valley Corporation across Barakar River, in Koderma district (Jharkhand). Rihand dam ( Uttar Pradesh) - Constructed on the Rihand River and also known as Govind Ballabh Pant Sagar.

question: Q.125. Which east-flowing river basin covers the states of Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh and Orissa and has a Drainage area of 39,033 sq km ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.125.(c) Brahmani river (second largest river in Odisha): It is formed by the confluence of the Shankh and Koel rivers, both join at Veda Vyasa near Rourkela (Odisha). Baitarani: It originates from Gonasika hills and drains into the Bay of Bengal. Nagavali (also known as Langulya): It rises in the Eastern Ghats. Sarada: Originated from Kalapani in the Himalayas and flows along Nepal's western border with India and joins Ghaghra River (tributary of the Ganges).

question: Q.126. Which ports belong to the western coast of India ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Kandla port, Mormugao port, Kochi port ', '(b) Kandla port, Mormugao port, Chennai port ', '(c) Kandla port, Mormugao port, Kolkata port ', '(d) Kandla port, Haldia port, Kochi port ']
answer: (a) Kandla port, Mormugao port, Kochi port
solution: Sol.126.(a) Ports in India: West Coast - Mumbai, Jawaharlal Nehru (Maharashtra), New Mangalore (Karnataka). East Coast - V. O. Chidambaranar formerly Tuticorin, Ennore, Chennai Port (Tamil Nadu), Paradip (Orissa), Kolkata, Haldia (West Bengal), Port Blair, Haddo (Andaman a nd Nicobar Islands), Visakhapatnam (Andhra Pradesh).

question: Q.127. The Eastern Ghats stretch from the __________ to the Nigiris in the south. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Godavari Valley ', '(b) Mahanadi Valley ', '(c) Damodar Valley ', '(d) Son Valley ']
solution: Sol.127.(b) Mahanadi Valley. Eastern Ghat marks the eastern edges of the Deccan Plateau. Average elevation is 600 - 610 meters. It is discontinuous and irregular and dissected by rivers draining into the Bay of Bengal. Mahendragiri (1,501 metres) is the highest peak in the Eastern Ghats. Shevroy hills and the Javadi hills are located to the southeast of the Eastern Ghats.

question: Q.128. __________ are NOT considered surface water. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.128.(b) Aquifers : A body of porous rock or sediment saturated with groundwater that helps in store and retain groundwater levels in the soil. Types of Aquifers (two types) - ‚ÄòConfined aquifers‚Äô have a layer of impenetrable rock or clay above them. ‚ÄòUnconfined aquifers‚Äô lie below a permeable layer of soil.

question: Q.129. The drainage system formed when rivers discharge their waters from all directions in a lake or depression, as in the case of Loktak Lake in Manipur, is called ________. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.129.(b) Centripetal. Radial drainage pattern: When the rivers originate from a hill and flow in all directions. Example - Narmada. Trellis Drainage Pattern: This pattern develops in folded topography where hard and soft rocks exist parallel to each other. Example - The rivers in the upper part of t he Himalayan region Indus, Ganga. Dendritic Drainage Pattern : Most common form and resembles the branching pattern of tree roots. Example - The rivers of the northern plains, Indus, Ganga and Brahmaputra.

question: Q.130. Match the columns. Seaport State 1. Tuticorin Port a. West Bengal 2. Haldia Port b. Tamil Nadu 3. Mangalore Port c. Karnataka SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.130.(c) 1-b, 2-a, 3-c. Ports in India with states : Cochin Port - Kerala, New Mangalore Port - Karnataka, Mormugao Port - Goa, Jawaharlal Nehru Port - Maharashtra, Kandla Port - Gujarat, Port Blair Port - Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Paradip Port - Orissa, Kamarajar Port - Tamil Nadu.

question: Q.131. Dihang and Lohit are rivers in which of the following regions? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Jammu and Kashmir ', '(b) Sikkim and Manipur ', '(c) Arunachal Pradesh and Assam ', '(d) Punjab and Himachal ']
solution: Sol.131.(c) Arunachal Pradesh and Assam. Dihang River - The Brahmaputra rises in Tibet, where it is known as Tsangpo and crosses over into India in Arunachal Pradesh under the name of Dihang. Lohit River - It originates in eastern Tibet, in the Zayal Chu range and surges through Arunachal Pradesh for 200 km, before emptying into the Brahmaputra river in the plains of Assam.

question: Q.132. ________ river has the least storage capacity of usable water. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.132.(b) Brahmaputra - The river originates from the Kailash ranges of Himalayas in Tibet which is a very cold and dry area, thus, the river carries very small amounts of water but once it enters India, the river is fed by heavy rains and due to frequent floods and poor drainage system in North east the river has very low storage capacity of usable water. River Ganga has the highest storage capacity of usable water followed by Godavari and Krishna river

question: Q.133. Which river is also known as Tsangpo ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Ganga river ', '(b) Gandak river ', '(c) Kaveri river ', '(d) Brahmaputra river ']
solution: Sol.133.(d) The Brahmaputra river . It is known by the name of ‚ÄòDihang‚Äô in Arunachal Pradesh and 'Jamuna' in Bangladesh. The combined water stream of Ganga and Brahmaputra is known as the Meghna. Brahmaputra traverses a distance of 2,900 km through four countries - Tibet (China), Bhutan, India and Bangladesh before entering the Bay of Bengal. Tributaries : Subansiri, Ronganadi, Dikrong, Buroi, Borgong, Jia Bharali, Dhansiri (North) Puthimari, Manas, Sonkosh.

question: Q.134. Which of the following lakes is a saltwater lake? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.134.(b) Chilika - It is the largest brackish water lagoon in Asia and the second-largest coastal lagoon in the world. Superior Lake - world's largest freshwater lake located on the Canada-US border. Titicaca - Largest freshwater lake in South America. Malawi - African Great Lake and the southernmost lake in the East African Rift System, located between Malawi, Tanzania and Mozambique.

question: Q.135. In which state is Gobind Sagar (Bhakra Nangal Project) located? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.135.(a) Himachal Pradesh. Bhakra Dam is a concrete gravity dam a cross the Sutlej River in Bilaspur. Other dams in Himachal Pradesh: Chamera Dam (Ravi), Kol Dam and Nathpa Jhakri (Satluj), Pandoh Dam, Largi Dam and Pong Dam (Beas).

question: Q.136. The stretch between Mumbai to Goa of western coast of India is known as ____________ . SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Coromandel coast ', '(b) Konkan coast ', '(c) Malabar Coast ', '(d) Kannada Plain ']
solution: Sol.136.(b) Konkan coast. The western coast, sandwiched between the Western Ghats and the Arabian Sea, is a narrow plain. It consists of three sections. The northern part of the coast is called the Konkan (Mumbai ‚Äì Goa), the central stretch is called the Kannad Plain, w hile the southern stretch is referred to as the Malabar coast. The plains along the Bay of Bengal are wide and level. In the northern part, it is referred to as the Northern Circar, while the southern part is known as the Coromandel Coast.

question: Q.137. Which of the following peninsular rivers of India is a west flowing river? SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.137.(b) Narmada (1312 km) : Origin - Amarkantak (Madhya pradesh). It traverses Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra and Gujarat and meets the Gulf of Cambay. West Flowing Rivers: Tapi, Sabarmati, Mahi, Luni, Saravati, Periyar. Kaveri (Origin - Brahmagiri Range, Karnataka), Godavari (Origin - Trimbakeshwar, Maharashtra) and Krishna (Origin - Mahabaleshwar, Maharashtra) are east Flowing Rivers.

question: Q.138. What is the main reason behind the substantial rainfall during summer on the western coasts of India? S SC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Western Ghats ', '(b) Eastern winds ', '(c) Indus River ', '(d) Eastern Ghats ']
solution: Sol.138.(a) Western Ghats (Also known as sahyadri h ills). Western coast r eceives more rainfall in summer because Western Ghats Obstructs the South w est monsoon. It resulted in Heavy Rainfall along the Windward side of Western Ghats (West coast) and less rainfall on the Eastern side of Western Ghats.

question: Q.139. The __________ port was developed after Independence to ease the volume of trade on the Mumbai port. SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.139.(a) Kandla (Also known as deendayal port). It is Located on the Gulf of Kutch (Gujarat). It was constructed in the 1950‚Äôs as the chief seaport serving western India, after the partition of India from Pakistan left the Karachi port in Pakistan.

question: Q.140. What is the other name of Bharathapuzha, the longest river of Kerala, which flows from the west and falls into the Arabian Sea? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.140.(c) Ponnani. West flowing rivers (Kerala) : Periyar River, Pamba, Chaliyar, Chalakudy, Kadalundy, Achankoil, Kallada, Muvattupuzha, Valapattanam etc.

question: Q.141. Which river basin originates f rom the Western Ghats range of Karnataka state and has many tributaries such as the Noyyal, Kabini, Arkavathi and Amaravati? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.141.(c) Kaveri river basin falls in 3 States (Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala) and a Union Territory (Puducherry). It originates in the foothills of Western Ghats at Talakaveri. Tributaries - Shimsha, Hemavati, Bhavani, Lokapavani.

question: Q.142. The Jog Falls, one of the highest waterfalls in India is the cataract of which river? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.142.(c) Sharavati - It originates at a place called Ambutheertha in the Thirthahalli taluk (Karnataka). Tungabhadra River is formed by the confluence of the Tunga River and the Bhadra River, The two rivers originate in Mudigere Taluk of Chikmagalur District (Karnataka). Cauvery River rises at Talakaveri in the Brahmagiri range in the Western Ghats, Kodagu district (Karnataka).

question: Q.143. With a stretch of about 724 km, which river is one of the most important rivers of peninsular India ? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.143.(a) Tapi River - It flows through the states of Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Gujarat. The river originates in the Satpura Mountains in Madhya Pradesh and flows westwards before emptying into the Arabian Sea.

question: Q.144. Which river originates from the southern part of Devarayanadurga hill in Tumkur district, and flows for about 221 km before joining Kaveri? SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Shimsha river ', '(b) Girna river ', '(c) Ghataprabha river ', '(d) Waghur river ']
solution: Sol.144.(a) Shimsha River (a tributary of the river Kaveri). Shimsha has a waterfall at Shimshapura in Malavalli Taluk (Mandya district, Karnataka). Devarayanadurga is a small hill station located in the Indian state of Karnataka. Girna River - It originates near Kem Peak in western ghats of M aharashtra and is a tributary of Tapti river. Ghataprabha River - Right bank tributary of t he Krishna River. Waghur River - Its source is near Ajanta through the Khandesh region.

question: Q.145. Which glacier is the source of river Gori Ganga which is an important tributary of river Kali? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Tipra Glacier ', '(b) Milam Glacier ', '(c) Namik Glacier ', '(d) Kafni Glacier ']
solution: Sol.145.(b) Milam Glacier. Indian R ivers originate from Glaciers: Ganges - Gangotri Glacier (Uttarakhand). Indus - Bokhar Chu Glacier (Himalayas). Brahmaputra - Angsi Glacier (Tibet). Yamuna - Yamunotri Glacier (Uttarakhand). Chenab - Bara-lacha la Glacier (Himachal Pradesh). Ghaghara - Mapchachungo Glacier (Himalayas of Nepal). Mandakini River - Chorabari Glacier (Uttarakhand). Lidder River - Kolahoi Glacier ( Himalayas). Pushpawati - Tipra Glacier. Ram Ganga - Namik glacier. Kafni River - Kafni Glacier.

question: Q.146. Which of the following lakes is the longest in India? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Vembanad lake ', '(b) Kanjia lake ', '(c) Ansupa lake ', '(d) Wular lake ']
solution: Sol.146.(a) Vembanad lake : Length - 83.72 km. Located - Kerala. It is connected to the Arabian Sea. The lake is known for its backwaters (a network of canals and waterways). Kanjia Lake - Odisha. Ansupa Lake - Odisha. Wular Lake - Jammu and Kashmir. It is the largest freshwater lake in India. Smallest lake - Pookode Lake.

question: Q.147. Which river from the following flows through a rift valley? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.147.(a) Tapi. Rift valley : It is a lowland region that forms where Earth‚Äôs tectonic plates move apart. Famous rift valleys - Great Rift Valley (East Africa), East Rift Valley or Hualien - Taitung (Taiwan), Baikal Rift Valley (Southern Siberia). Sabarmati River : Originates from the Dhebar Lake in Aravalli range at Udaipur, Rajasthan.

question: Q.148. Which tributary of the Indus River originates near the Rohtang Pass at an altitude of 4,000 meters above mean s ea level ? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.148.(c) Beas. Ancient name - Bipasha. Tributaries of the Beas river : Parbati, Banganga, Tirthan, Suketi, Sainj, Gaj, Chakki and Uhaul.

question: Q.149. Which is the biggest tributary of the upper Brahmaputra that originates in the Tibetan Himalayas and winds its way into India through Arunachal Pradesh ? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.149.(a) Subansiri. Tributaries: Ronganadi, Dikrong, Buroi, Borgong, Jiabharali, Dhansiri (North), Puthimari, Manas, Beki, Sonkosh are the main tributaries on the North while the Noadehing, Buridehing, Desang, Dikhow, Bhogdoi, Dhansiri (South), Kopilli, Kulsi, Krishnai, Dhdhnoi, Jinjiran are the main tributaries on the South.

question: Q.150. What is the name of a type of waterfall with an enormous volume of water? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.150.(c) Cataract. Types of Waterfalls: Horsetail - Descending water maintains some contact with bedrock. Plunge - Water descends vertically, losing contact with the bedrock surface. Block - Water descends from a relatively wide stream or river. Multi-step - A series of waterfalls one after another of r oughly the same size each with its own sunken plunge pool. Segmented - Distinctly separate flows of water form as it descends. Cascade - Water descends a series of rock steps. Punchbowl - Water descends in a constricted form and then spreads out in a wider pool.

question: Q.151. Which of the following rivers originates near Sihawa in Raipur district of Chhattisgarh, flows through Odisha, and eventually empties into the Bay of Bengal ? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (2nd shift)
solution: Sol.151.(a) Mahanadi - The largest river of Odisha state. Krishna - Originates near Mahabaleshwar (Satara) in Maharashtra and flows through Maharashtra, North Karnataka, Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Q.152. Which of the following states is NOT a part of the Tapi Basin? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.152.(a) Rajasthan. Tapti River - A river in central India that flows westwards b efore draining into the Arabian Sea. Origin - In Satpura r ange in the Gawilgarh h ills of t he northern part of the Deccan Plateau (In Betul district, Madhya Pradesh). Flows through the states - Maharashtra, Gujarat, and Madhya Pradesh. The Tapi river is known as the 'Gateway of International trade' as it conducts much international trade. Narmada, Periyar and Tapti are only rivers which f orm estuaries. An estuary is an area where a freshwater river or stream meets the ocean.

question: Q.153. Which group of rivers is a part of the peninsular drainage system? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Gandak and Ghaghra ', '(b) Mahanadi and Godavari ', '(c) Ganga and Yamuna ', '(d) Damodar and Sarda ']
solution: Sol.153.(b) Drainage System of India :- Himalayan Drainage System - Indus River System {Indus, Sutlej, Ravi, Jhelum, Chenab (largest tributary of Indus) and Beas}, Ganga River System (Ganga, Yamuna, Ramganga, Gomati, Ghaghara, Gandak, Kosi and Mahananda), Brahmaputra River System (Brahmaputra, Dibang or Sikang, Lohit, Burhi Dihing and Dhansari). Peninsular Drainage system - Narmada, Tapi, Godavari, Krishna, Kaveri, Mahanadi.

question: Q.154. Which of the following is not a freshwater lake in India? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.154.(a) Pulicat Lake (Andhra Pradesh) is the second largest brackish water lagoon in I ndia, (after Chilika Lake, Odisha). Loktak (Manipur) is a freshwater lake in Northeast India.

question: Q.155. Identify the water harvesting system in Western Himalayas. SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Khadins ', '(b) Johads ', '(c) None of these ', '(d) Guls ']
solution: Sol.155.(d) Guls. Water Harvesting - It is the activity of direct collection of rainwater, rather than allowing it to runoff. Other names of water harvesting in Indian states: Paar system, Talab /Bandhis, Saza Kuva, Johad, Khadins, Taanka - (Rajasthan); Pat - (Madhya Pradesh), Bandharas and Tals - (Maharashtra), Ahars and Pynes - (Bihar), Surangams - (Kerala).

question: Q.156. Which state ranks first with a total length of 31.2 thousand km o f r ivers and canals, which is about 17% of the total length of rivers and canals in the country? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Kerala ', '(b) West Bengal ', '(c) Uttar Pradesh ', '(d) Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.156.(c) Uttar Pradesh - Fourth largest state according to area and 1st state in population. Longest canal i n India - Indira G andhi Canal, Longest river - Ganga River (2525 km), Origin - Gangotri. Longest canal of U ttar Pradesh - Sharda Canal.

question: Q.157. Tila, Seti and Beri are the tributaries of : SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.157.(b) Ghaghara. It originates in the glaciers of Mapchachungo and a major left - bank tributary of the Ganges River. Its Tributaries : The left bank tributaries - Bheri, Sarju, Kuwana, Rapti, Chhoti Gandak and the right bank tributaries - Seti, Dahawar, Sarda, Budhi Ganga.

question: Q.158. What is the name o f t he branch of river Godavari that joins the Bay of Bengal flowing through the Yanam enclave of the union territory of Puducherry? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.158.(c) Gautami. Drainage Basin - Maharashtra, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka and Union territory of Puducherry. Projects - Polavaram Irrigation Project, Kaleshwaram, Sadarmat Anicut, Inchampalli, Sriram Sagar.

question: Q.159. Which of the following is NOT a tributary of the Godavari river? SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.159.(a) Mahi (Bhadar is a right bank tributary and Panam, Kun and Goma are left bank tributaries of Mahi river) .

question: Q.160. Where does the Narmada river rise? SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Western Ghats ', '(b) Gawilgarh Hills ', '(c) Satpura Ranges ', '(d) Amarkantak Range ']
solution: Sol.160.(d) Amarkantak Ranges. The Narmada River flows through Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, and Gujarat between Vindhya and Satpura hill range before falling into the Gulf of Cambay in the Arabian Sea. The Dhuandhar Falls is located on the Narmada River. Q.161 . Which of t he following rivers does NOT flow in Kerala State? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (3rd shift) (a) Bharathapuzha (b) Periyar (c) Pamba (d) Penner Sol.161.(d) Penner - It rises in Nandi Hills in Chikballapur District of K arnataka and falls into the Bay of Bengal. Bharathapuzha river is Kerala's second longest West Flowing River, draining into the Arabian Sea. Q.162 . A long, winding ridge of stratified sand and gravel is known as: Graduate Level 27/06/2023 ( Shift - 4) (a) whorl (b) esker (c) lop (d) arch Sol.162.(b) Esker. These are ridges made of sands and gravels, deposited by glacial meltwater flowing t hrough tunnels within and underneath glaciers, or through meltwater channels on top of glaciers. Other depositional landforms: Drumlins are smooth oval shaped ridge -like features composed mainly of g lacial till with some masses of gravel and sand.

question: Q.163. Which is a saltwater lake located in the Tibet Autonomous Region, China, to the west of Lake Mansarovar and to the south of Mount Kailash? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 1)
options: ['(a) Lake Yamdrok Tso ', '(b) Lake Rawok ', '(c) Lake Rakshastal ', '(d) Lake Basum Tso ']
solution: Sol.163.(c) Lake Rakshastal. Pangong Lake - World's highest saltwater lake . Loktak Lake ( Floating lake, Manipur) is famous for phumdi and Keibul Lamjao National Park is the only floating national park in the world located on it. Ranwu Lake (Rawok-Tso) - Largest lake of Eastern Tibet (Pasho). Yamdrok Lake (Freshwater lake inTibet).

question: Q.164. The Jhelum River rises from which of the following sources? Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) Chemayungdung Glacier ', '(b) Mansarovar Lake ', '(c) Spring at Verinag ', '(d) Rakas Lake ']
solution: Sol.164.(c) Spring at Verinag. Jhelum river is called Vitasta in the Rigveda, Hydaspes in Greek, and Vyeth in Kashmir. Tributaries - Kishanganga (Right), Neelum Kunhar, Poonch. It joins the Chenab at Trimmu.

question: Q.165. Which river i s the third largest in the peninsula of India and the largest river of Odisha state? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.165.(b) Mahanadi - Flows through Chhattisgarh, Odisha. Source : The river originates in the northern foothills of Dandakaranya, Raipur District (Chhattisgarh) and drains into the Bay of Bengal.

question: Q.166. Most of the Himalayan rivers are of which type? SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.166.(b) Perennial. It flows throughout the year in all the seasons. Ex: Brahmaputra, Ganges, Yamuna, Indus, etc. Exotic River - It starts in a humid region and flows into a dry region. Ex: Nile. Seasonal River - It flows only in a particular season that is monsoon. Ex: Godavari, Mahanadi, Kaveri, Krishna etc. Episodic river - It is found in areas with very dry climates and only flows after a particular event like heavy rain, or run-off channels. Example: Nossob River in the Kalahari region of Southern Africa.

question: Q.167. Which is a major tributary of Bhagirathi river? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.167.(a) Bhilangna: Originates from Khatling Glacier ( Tehri Garhwal district of Uttarakhand) . It joins the Bhagirathi river near Old Tehri. Bhagirathi river: It originates from Gomukh (Uttarakhand), located at the base of Gangotri and Khatilang glaciers. Dhauliganga - It originates from Vasudhara Tal (largest glacial lake in Uttarakhand), located at Niti Pass in Chamoli district. It merges with Alakananda at Vishnuprayag . Pindar - It originates from Pindari Glacier w hich is located in Bageshwar district of Kumaon region in Uttarakhand.

question: Q.168. The Almatti Dam of Karnataka is built over which of the following rivers? SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.168.(d) Krishna. Other dams on Krishna river - Achakdani ( Maharashtra), Achler (Maharashtra). River (Dams) :- Kaveri {Alalur (Karnataka), Amaravathi, (Tamil Nadu)}, Periyar {Mullaperiyar (confluence of the Mullayar and Periyar rivers in Kerala)}, Sutlej {Bhakra Nangal Dam (Punjab)}.

question: Q.169. Which of the following statements is correct regarding large dams? I. They have social problems because they displace a large number o f p easants and tribals without adequate compensation or rehabilitation. Il. They have Environmental problems because they contribute enormously to deforestation and the loss of biological diversity. SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Only l ', '(b) Both l and Il ', '(c) Only ll ', '(d) Neither I nor Il ']
solution: Sol.169.(b) Both I and II. Advantages of Dams - Irrigation, tourist attraction, flood control, hydro power generation, etc. Disadvantages of dams - High construction cost, unbalanced sedimentation, deforestation, ecological imbalance, endangered aquatic life etc.

question: Q.170. Which of the following rivers originates in Rajasthan? SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.170.(d) Banas . The river originates from the Khamnor hills of the Aravali range. It is a tributary of the Chambal River. It is also known as ‚ÄúVan ki Asha‚Äù. Length of Banas: 512 km. Tributaries : Kothari, Dai, Dheel, Menali etc.

question: Q.171. Jabalpur is located on the banks of which of the following rivers? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.171.(d) Narmada (also called Reva r iver, 1312 km) : 5th longest in India and largest west-flowing river in India. This River runs in a rift valley running west amid the Vindhya and Satpura Mountain Ranges.

question: Q.172. Which among the following lakes is also known as the "Srinagar's Jewel"? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.172.(c) Dal. On its banks Tulip Garden (Asia's largest), Mughal Garden, Shalimar Bagh and Nishat Bagh are situated. Lakes i n India - Vembanad Lake (Kerala), Chilika Lake (Odisha), Shivaji Sagar Lake (Maharashtra), Indira Sagar lake (Madhya Pradesh), Pangong Lake (Ladakh), Pulicat Lake (Andhra Pradesh), Nagarjuna Sagar Lake (Telangana).

question: Q.173. Which of the following is not an important river of Malwa plateau? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Chambal river ', '(b) Mahanadi river ', '(c) Ken river ', '(d) Betwa river ']
