question: Q.344. Which of the following is a negative effect of t he Green Revolution in India? (i) Depletion of groundwater table (ii) Deterioration in the quality of soil (iii) Increased input cost SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.344.(c) (i), (ii) and (iii). Negative Effects: Increased use of water in irrigation led to water depletion. The heavy use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides has had adverse effects on soil health in certain areas. Farmers became dependent on expensive inputs such as hybrid seeds, chemical fertilizers, and pesticides which increased input cost. Q.345 . Dr D.S. Athwal was k nown a s the 'Father of___________Revolution in India'. SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (1st shift) (a) Oilseed (b) Rice (c) Millet (d) Wheat Sol.345.(d) Wheat. Father of Agricultural revolutions in India : Green Revolution (Agriculture) - M.S. S waminathan, White Revolution or Operation flood ( Milk/ Dairy products) - Dr. Varghese Kurien, Blue Revolution (Fish and Aqua) - Dr. Arun Krishnan and Dr. Harilal Chaudhari, Golden Revolution (Fruits, Honey, Horticulture) - Nirpakh Tutaj, Silver Revolution (Eggs) - Indira Gandhi, Yellow Revolution (Oil Seeds) - Sam Pitroda, Pink Revolution (Pharmaceuticals, Prawns, Onion) - Durgesh Patel, Brown Revolution ( Leather, Coco) - Hiralal Chaudri, Red Revolution (Meat, Tomato) - Vishal Tewari.

question: Q.346. Which of t he following is NOT one of the characteristics of the new agricultural strategy? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Use of chemical fertilisers ', '(b) Use of hybrid seeds ', '(c) Extensive irrigation ', '(d) Use of organic manures ']
solution: Sol.346.(d) Use of organic manures. New Agricultural Strategy (1960) was adopted during the third five year plan (1961-1966). Some Important Features: Consolidation of land holdings, Modern Farm Machinery, Guaranteed Minimum Prices, Agricultural Research and Education, Plant Protection Measures, Greater Intensity of Cropping, Role of Public Institutions. Chemicals used in Farming: Pesticides, insecticides, Herbicides, Fungicides, Glyphosate, Anhydrous ammonia.

question: Q.347. The first phase of the Green Revolution was restricted largely to two crops and the regions where they are grown. Which of the following pairs best represents these two Crops? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Rice, corn ', '(b) Wheat, rice ', '(c) Cotton, indigo ', '(d) Millet, wheat ']
solution: Sol.347.(b) Wheat, rice. Green Revolution - Initiated by Norman Borlaug (Father of Green Revolution in World) in 1960s, Who won the Nobel Peace Prize (1970) for developing High Yielding Varieties (HYVs) of wheat.

question: Q.348. Identify the ODD one out. SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Modern agricultural technology ', '(b) White revolution ', '(c) Green revolution ', '(d) Seed-fertilizer-water technology ']
solution: Sol.348.(b) White revolution. It is the largest dairy movement started by the government of India in 1970 to make India a self - dependent country in milk production.

question: Q.349. In which type of f arming, t he land is used for growing food and fodder crops and rearing livestock? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Dairy farming ', '(b) Plantation farming ', '(c) Mixed farming ', '(d) Commercial farming ']
solution: Sol.349.(c) Mixed farming. Dairy farming - It is a class of agriculture for long-term production of milk. Plantation farming - The practice of c learing a large parcel of forest land and planting the desired crops in huge numbers on the cleared land.

question: Q.350. Which of the following is NOT an example of Millets or coarse grains? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.350.(c) Wheat. Coarse grain - Jowar, proso millet, kodo millet.

question: Q.351. "Agricultural Census" is conducted in India at an interval of _____. SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) six years ', '(b) five years ', '(c) four years ', '(d) ten years ']
solution: Sol.351.(b) Five years. ‚ÄúThe Eleventh Agricultural Census‚Äù (2021-22) - Launched by The Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers' Welfare. Aim - Focus of the census is on increasing the income of the farmers and empowering them by organizing small farmers. Agriculture Census Scheme has been undertaken by the Agriculture Ministry since 1970-71. Agriculture Census - Conducted in India on the basis of guidelines of decennial World Census o f Agriculture (WCA). It is formulated by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations.

question: Q.352. Which of the following is termed as "sericulture" ? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Cultivation of grapes ', '(b) Growing of fruits ', '(c) Breeding of fish ', '(d) Commercial rearing of silk worms ']
solution: Sol.352.(d) Commercial rearing of silkworms. ‚ÄòBombyx mori', ‚ÄòEri‚Äô, ‚ÄòMuga‚Äô and ‚ÄòTasar‚Äô are silkworm species used in sericulture. These are used to produce silk fiber (protein) from their silk glands . Moriculture refers to the cultivation of mulberry plants. Other types of farming : Horticulture (fruits or vegetables). Aviculture (Bird). Apiculture (Bee). Pisciculture (fish). Viticulture (Grapes). Fungiculture (mushroom). Arboriculture (tree). Silviculture (fodder crops). Olericulture (vegetables).

question: Q.353. The technique of watering plants by making use of narrow tubes which deliver water directly at the base of the plant is called _________ . SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) sprinkler irrigation ', '(b) canal irrigation ( c) drip irrigation (d) surface irrigation Sol.353.', '(c) Drip irrigation (Trickle irrigation) . Types of irrigation: Sprinkler irrigation - Water is sprinkled into the air through small nozzles and allowed it to fall on the ground surface like rainfall. Canal irrigation - Canal is built along the river, reservoir or any tank to transport water to the fields to perform irrigation. Surface i rrigation - Water flows and spreads over the surface of t he land with the help of gravity.', '']

question: Q.354. Which type of farming is practiced to meet the needs of the farmer's family? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Pisciculture farming ', '(b) Subsistence farming ', '(c) Commercial farming ', '(d) Sericulture farming ']
solution: Sol.354.(b) Subsistence farming. Other Types of Farming - Commercial Farming - It is carried out on a large scale with the intention of selling the produce for p rofit. Organic Farming - It is a method that emphasizes the use of natural fertilizers and avoids the use of synthetic chemicals such as pesticides and herbicides. Other types are Dryland Farming, Intensive Farming, Horticulture, Sericulture, etc.

question: Q.355. In which o f t he following methods of irrigation, the water falls drop by drop directly near the roots? SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Manual irrigation ', '(b) Sprinkler system ', '(c) Lateral move irrigation ', '(d) Drip system ']
solution: Sol.355.(c) Lateral move irrigation . Manual Irrigation - A labour i ntensive and time-consuming system of irrigation. Water is distributed through watering cans by manual labour.

question: Q.356. There are regions where farmers specialize in vegetables only. This type of farming is known as ______. SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Mixed farming ', '(b) Pastoral farming ', '(c) Dairy farming ', '(d) Truck farming ']
solution: Sol.356.(d) Truck farming. Mixed farming is a kind of cultivating that includes both the harvesting of crops and raising animals. Pastoral farming is a type of farming where farmers raise livestock, such as cattle, sheep, and goats. Dairy farming is a type of f arming where farmers produce milk f rom dairy cows.

question: Q.357. Which among the following terms means growing of fruits? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.357.(c) Pomiculture. Apiculture - The maintenance of honeybees and hives. Arboriculture - Cultivation of trees, shrubs, and woody plants for shading and decorating.

question: Q.358. Jhum cultivation or shifting cultivation is also known by the name o f _________ . SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Plantation ', '(b) Mixed farming ', '(c) Extensive farming ', '(d) Slash and burn agriculture ']
solution: Sol.358.(d) Slash and burn Agriculture. Jhum cultivation (North East India) is a traditional farming method where vegetation is cleared, burned and then cultivated for a limited number of years.

question: Q.359. India is the ____ producer of pulses and the ____ consumer of pulses. SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) second largest, second largest ', '(b) largest, second largest ', '(c) second largest, largest ', '(d) largest, largest ']
solution: Sol.359.(d) largest, largest. India is the largest producer (25% of global production), consumer (27% of world consumption) and importer (14%) of pulses in the world. Pulse producing states in India - Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh. 2016 as the International Year of Pulses (IYP) marked by the United Nation. World Pulses Day - 10 February.

question: Q.360. In 2018, India was the ________ producer of groundnut in the world. SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) fourth largest ', '(b) third largest ', '(c) largest ', '(d) second largest ']
solution: Sol.360.(d) Second largest. Groundnut (Kharif crop): Accounts for about half of the major oilseeds produced in the country, important protein crops in India grown mostly under rain-fed conditions. China is the largest producer of groundnuts in the world. India is the world's largest producer of milk, pulses and jute and Second largest producer of rice, wheat, sugarcane, vegetables, fruit and cotton.

question: Q.361. It is a tropical as well as a subtropical crop. It grows well in hot and humid climates with a temperature of 21¬∞C to 27¬∞C and an annual rainfall between 75cm and 100cm. Which of t he crops is being talked about in the information given above? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.361.(a) Sugarcane. India is the second-largest producer of sugarcane after Brazil. Cotton - Tropical crop raised in India as a Kharif crop, it r equires a uniformly high temperature between 21 o C and 30¬∞C. Maize - Grown in tropics, sub-tropics and temperate regions. Rubber - Equatorial crop produced primarily for the manufacture of l atex for industrial use.

question: Q.362. Cotton requires ____ temperature, light rainfall or irrigation,_____ frost - free days and bright sun-shine for its growth. SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.362.(a) High, 210 . Cotton crop requires light rainfall or irrigation and bright sunshine for its growth. It comes under the Kharif Crop.

question: Q.363. Identify which of the following statements about agriculture in India are correct. 1. Rabi crops are sown in India from October to December and harvested from April to June. 2. Important crops grown during Rabi in India are paddy, maize, gram, soyabean and mustard. 3. Aus, Aman and Boro are three crops o f paddy in Assam, West Bengal and Odisha. SSC CGL Tier II 02/03/2023
options: ['(a) 1, 2 and 3 ', '(b) 1 and 3 only ', '(c) 2 and 3 only ', '(d) 1 and 2 only ']
solution: Sol.363.(b) 1 and 3 only. Food crops - Rice, Wheat, Millets, Maize and Pulses. Cash crops - Sugarcane, Oilseeds. Horticulture crops, Tea, Coffee, Rubber, Cotton and Jute.

question: Q.364. In India initially HYVP was implemented in about how much area? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) 5 million hectares ', '(b) 3 million hectares ', '(c) 4 million hectares ', '(d) 2 million hectares ']
solution: Sol.364.(d) 2 million hectares. HYVP was restricted to only five crops ‚Äì wheat, rice, jowar, bajra and maize. The high yielding variety of seeds (resistant to insects and diseases) played an important role in the Green Revolution of India.

question: Q.365. In the first phase of the green revolution, the use of HYV seeds was restricted to the more affluent of which group of states ? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Punjab, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh ', '(b) Punjab, Haryana and Madhya Pradesh ', '(c) Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh ', '(d) Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Madhya Pradesh ']
answer: (c) Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh
solution: Sol.365.(c) Punjab, Tamil Nadu and Andhra P radesh. The headquarters of t he Indian Institute of Wheat and Barley Research is located in Karnal, Haryana.

question: Q.366. W hich of the following is NOT a goal for the Green Revolution? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Rise in crop productivity ', '(b) Use of fertilisers ', '(c) Rise in production of food grains ', '(d) Expansion of irrigation ']
solution: Sol.366.(d) Expansion of irrigation. The Green Revolution in India started in the 1960s with the aim of increasing India's agricultural production to make India self-sufficient in food grains.

question: Q.367. In rainforests which kind of cultivation is practiced? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Dry farming ', '(b) Vertical farming ', '(c) Terrace farming ', '(d) Slash and burn ']
solution: Sol.367.(d) Slash and Burn Cultivation (Shifting cultivation/Swidden cultivation) is generally practiced in rainforest areas.

question: Q.368. The Purple revolution was launched by the Union Ministry of Science & Technology in Jammu and Kashmir. This revolution is related to cultivation of which crop? SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Marigold ', '(b) Kashmiri Rose ', '(c) Lavender ', '(d) Himalayan Indigo ']
solution: Sol.368.(c) Lavender. The Purple Revolution was initiated in 2016 through the Aroma Mission of the Council of Scientific and I ndustrial Research ( CSIR ). Main product is Lavender oil which sells for at least Rs. 10,000 per litre. In India, the lavender crop is cultivated in low rainfall regions and on the slopes of h ills of Himachal Pradesh (HP) and Uttar Pradesh(UP). Q.369 . The Planning commission of India has divided India into how many Agro-climatic Zones? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (2nd Shift) (a) 15 (b) 25 (c) 18 (d) 20 Sol.369.(a) 15. Agro-climatic zones - Western Himalayan Region, Eastern Himalayan Region, Lower Gangetic Plains Region, Middle, Gangetic Plains Region, Upper Gangetic Plains Region, Trans - Gangetic Plains Region, Eastern plateau and Hills Region, Central Plateau and Hills, Western Plateau and Hills, Southern Plateau and Hills, East Coast Plains and Hills, West Coast Plains and Ghats Region, Gujarat Plains, Western Dry Region.

question: Q.370. Which crop does not require high rainfall and high temperature? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.370.(c) Maize : (Queen of cereals, high temperature (<35¬∞ C) ) and low rainfall). Rice : (Hot and humid climate, 150-300 cm of rainfall, temperature (21 to 37¬∫ C)). Jute: (Temperature (25-35¬∞C), Rainfall (Around 150-250 cm)). Cotton : (Light rainfall (about 50 to 100 cm), needs 210 frost-free days). Kharif C rops - Rice, Maize, Sorghum, Bajra, Soybean, Cotton.

question: Q.371. W hich of the following pair(s) of State and type of crop is/are correctly matched with respect to rice cultivation? I. Punjab - subsistence crop II. Odisha - Commercial Crop SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) only I ', '(b) II only ', '(c) neither I nor II ', '(d) Both I and II ']
solution: Sol.371.(c) Rice (Oryza sativa, Kharif crop), is commercial cropping in Punjab and in Odisha, it is a subsistence crop. West Bengal is the largest rice-producing state in India. Rice bowl of India - Krishna Godavari Basin (Andhra Pradesh). Average temperature (21 to 37¬∫ C). Indian Institute of Rice Research is located in Hyderabad.

question: Q.372. Soilless agriculture is called ____. SSC MTS 12/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) hydroponics ', '(b) shifting agriculture ', '(c) dry farming ', '(d) pastoral farming ']
solution: Sol.372.(a) Hydroponics . In shifting agriculture , a clearing is made in the forest, usually on the slopes of hills. Dry farming is the cultivation of crops without irrigation in regions of limited moisture, typically less than 20 inches of precipitation annually.

question: Q.373. The word agriculture is derived from the Latin words ager and culture. What does ‚Äòager‚Äô mean? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.373.(b) Soil. The English word agriculture derives from the Latin ager (field) and colo (cultivate) signifying, when combined, the Latin agricultura: field or land tillage. Agriculture is the art and science of cultivating the soil, growing c rops and raising livestock. It is the backbone of the Indian economy.

question: Q.374. In the northern and north-western parts of India, _____ is the main food crop. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.374.(a) Wheat. India is the second largest producer of wheat after China. Soil Type: Well-drained fertile loamy and clayey loamy (Ganga-Satluj plains and black soil region of the Deccan).

question: Q.375. Which of the following is an example of a fiber crop? SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.375.(b) Hemp. Fiber crops are the crops grown in fields for their fibers that are used to make ropes, paper, cloth, etc. Examples - Cotton, Jute, Coir, Hemp, Flax, etc. Jute is known as the ‚Äúgolden fiber‚Äù because of its yellowish-brown colour and high cash value.

question: Q.376. What is the percentage of land used for agriculture in India as per the 2009 data by National Institute of Hydrology? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.376.(a) 51.09%. In India , land is 21.81% under forest and 3.92% under pasture. National Institute of Hydrology has been in IIT- Roorkee, Uttarakhand since 1978. Its four Regional centers: Belagavi (Karnataka), Jammu, Kakinada (Andhra Pradesh), and Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh), and two Flood Management Studies Centre: Guwahati (Assam) and Patna (Bihar).

question: Q.377. DDT adversely affects our environment because: SSC CHSL 02/06/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) it can kill beneficial insects like honey bees ', '(b) it can allow growth of harmful insects ', '(c) it can promote growth of harmful insects ', '(d) it can kill harmful insects ']
answer: (a) it can kill beneficial insects like honey bees
solution: Sol.377.(a) DDT, Dichloro - diphenyl - trichloroethane (C H C ) is an 14 9 l5 insecticide used in agriculture. Its usage started in the 1940s to combat diseases like Malaria . High amounts of DDT exposure can lead to problems with the nervous system and liver. The US b anned it in 1972 and it was banned worldwide. India produced it in the year 2009 to control visceral leishmaniasis and insect-born malaria disease.

question: Q.378. India lost a large proportion of _ __ growing area to Pakistan during partition. SSC CGL 18/04/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.378.(d) Cotton is one of the most important fiber and cash crops of India. Gujarat is the leading cotton growing State followed by Maharashtra. Bombay Spinning and Weaving Company was t he first cotton mill to be established in Bombay, India, on 7 July 1854. Soya b ean largest producing state is Madhya Pradesh. Karnataka is the largest producer of Sunflower. West Bengal is the largest producer of jute in India.

question: Q.379. Which of t he following is the main food crop of the semi-arid areas of central and southern India? SSC CGL 20/04/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.379.(a) Jowar i s mainly concentrated in the peninsular and central India. Karnataka is the highest maize producer. Rajasthan is the state with the highest yield of bajra in India. Karnataka is the leading producer of ragi in the country followed by Tamil Nadu, Uttarakhand, Maharashtra and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Q.380. Which of the following is a well-known variety of coffee initially brought to India from Yemen? SSC MTS 14/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.380.(b) Arabica . It is grown in the hills of Karnataka (Kodagu, Chikkamagaluru, and Hassan), Kerala (Malabar region), and Tamil Nadu (Nilgiris District, Yercaud and K odaikanal).

question: Q.381. Which of the following options is INCORRECTLY paired? SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) Guavas ‚Äì Telangana ', '(b) Apples ‚Äì Himachal Pradesh ', '(c) Oranges ‚Äì Nagpur ', '(d) Banana ‚Äì Kerala ']
solution: Sol.381.(a) Guavas ‚Äì Telangana. In India, major guava-producing states include Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Bihar. Scientific name- Psidium guajava.

question: Q.382. Which of t he following is a variety of oilseed? SSC CHSL 16/04/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.382.(a) Taramira is an important oilseed crop of drier regions of north-western India. The oil is not directly eaten, although it is mixed with mustard oil to increase the pungency o f t he latter. Arabica, Robusta, and the less common Liberica and Excelsa are the four main types of coffee beans.

question: Q.383. Which of the following factors is NOT responsible for the loss of fertility of agricultural land? SSC CHSL 04/08/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Salinisation of soil ', '(b) Higher cation exchange capacity of soil ', '(c) Alkalisation of soil ', '(d) Waterlogging ']
answer: (b) Higher cation exchange capacity of soil
solution: Sol.383.(b) For all the fertility losses there are various causes in the different regions of the country, in totality, the major cause of soil fertility decline is land d egradation which is caused through different agents such as soil erosion, deforestation, overgrazing, sedimentation, continuous farming, and pollution.

question: Q.384. The ______ water utilization is very high in the states of Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, and Tamil Nadu. SSC CPO 24/11/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.384.(c) Ground . The reason behind this is these states are advanced agricultural states and the share of the agriculture sector in water utilisation is much higher than any other sectors. Punjab in terms of land under irrigation leads in the country's States and UT's with 98.8 % of its cropland.

question: Q.385. A policy which involves fixing the maximum size of land which could be owned by an individual is called ____. SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Evening)
options: ['(a) Land mapping ', '(b) Land jamming ', '(c) Land ceiling ', '(d) Land capping ']
solution: Sol.385.(c) Land Ceiling . It minimizes inequality in land ownership and thus reduces inequality of income. The Urban Land Ceiling Act that was p assed in 1976 proposed that there should be an equal distribution of land in urban agglomerations to subserve the common good. Soil

question: Q.386. In which of the following processes nutrients or contaminants are carried away by water or moved into the lower layer of the soil? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.386.(a) Leaching: It occurs as excess water removes water-soluble nutrients out of the soil, by runoff or drainage. It is an environmental problem for agricultural professionals whether chemical-heavy fertilisers or chemicals are swept out and find their way into water bodies.

question: Q.387. The black soil of the Deccan Plateau lacks which of the following minerals? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.387.(c) Phosphorous. Black soil rich minerals - Iron, lime, calcium, potassium, aluminum and magnesium and Deficient in - Nitrogen and organic matter. Black soil or cotton soil is good for moisture and good for growing cotton, sugarcane, wheat, jawar, rice, citrus f ruits, sunflower, linseed, etc.

question: Q.388. Punjab state is rich in which natural resource from the following? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.388.(d) Fertile soil. The word P unjab means land of five rivers (Beas, Jhelum, Chenab, Ravi and Sutlej). It is known as the ‚Äòwheat granary of India‚Äô. Mineral Producing States: Iron Ore - Orissa, Chhattisgarh and Karnataka; Manganese - Madhya Pradesh and Maharashtra; Chromite - Orissa, Karnataka and Maharashtra; Bauxite - Orissa and Gujarat; Copper - Rajasthan, Jharkahnd and Madhya Pradesh.

question: Q.389. Laterite soil develops as a result of which of the following reasons ? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Compaction ', '(b) Leaching ', '(c) High temperature only ', '(d) Sedimentation ']
solution: Sol.389.(b) Leaching - It is used to extract the substances from the solids. Laterite Soil: It develops in areas with high temperature and high rainfall. These are the result of intense leaching due to tropical rains. It is commonly found in Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh and the hilly areas of Odisha and Assam. Laterite Soil is most s uitable soil for growing coffee in India

question: Q.390. The black soil area of the ___________ is known as the Deccan Trap. SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Northern Plains ', '(b) Peninsular Plateau ', '(c) Coastal Plains ', '(d) Himalayan Mountains ']
solution: Sol.390.(b) Peninsular Plateau. It is an ancient landmass composed mainly of igneous and metamorphic hard crystalline rocks. It was formed due to the breaking and drifting of Gondwanaland. Deccan Plateau - A triangular landmass that lies to the south of the river Narmada. Black Soil (also known as regur soil or black cotton soil) - Covers most o f t he deccan plateau which includes part of Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh and some part of Tamil Nadu. Black soil is generally clayey, deep and impermeable. It is rich in lime, iron, and aluminium magnesium.

question: Q.391. Which of the following crops is most suitable for black soil ? SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.391.(c) Cotton. Black soil is also known as ‚ÄúRegur Soil‚Äù or the ‚ÄúBlack Cotton Soil‚Äù. Other crops grown in black soil: tobacco, citrus fruits, castor, and linseed. Classification of S oils and crops: Alluvial soil - Wheat, rice, maize, sugarcane, pulses, oilseed; Red soil: Wheat, cotton, pulses, tobacco, oilseeds, potatoes, etc.; Laterite soil: Tea, Rice, Ragi, Sugarcane, and Cashew nuts.

question: Q.392. In which o f t he following states of India is the maximum extent of alluvial soil found? SSC MTS 11/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.392.(b) Uttar Pradesh. Alluvial Soil : Found in northern plains and the river valleys. It is rich in potash but poor in phosphorus. Two types of alluvial soil :- Khadar - New alluvium, deposited by floods annually, which enriches the soil by depositing fine slits. Bhangar - Old alluvium, deposited away from the flood plains. Other Soils : Black soils, Red and yellow soils, Laterite soils, Arid soils, Saline soils, Peaty soils and Forests soils.

question: Q.393. What is the type of s oil composed of silt and dust ? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (2nd shift)
solution: Sol.393.(c) Loess. Properties : Colour - Yellowish Brown, Homogeneous and Highly Porous. Mostly Found (India) - Kashmir Valley. Loam -The type of Soil composed of sand, silt, and clay soil. Marl - The type of soil composed of Clays and Slit. Podsol - The soil derives from either quartz-rich sands and sandstone or sedimentary debris from magmatic rocks.

question: Q.394. Which of the following soil requires minimum tillage because of its self-cultivating feature? SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Red soil ', '(b) Laterite soil ( c) Peaty soil (d) Black soil Sol.394.(d) Black Soil (Regur) - This is of Volcanic Origin and ideal for growing cotton. Laterite Soil - Rich in iron oxide and aluminium. It is suitable for rubber, coconut, and wheat. Red Soil - It contains clay and organic mineral layers. Crops : Wheat, pulses, tobacco, oilseeds.', '', '']

question: Q.395. The colour of the alluvial soils varies from ________. SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) pale white to warm white ', '(b) light orange to dark orange ', '(c) orange to red ', '(d) light grey to ash grey ']
solution: Sol.395.(d) light grey to ash grey. Alluvial soils are formed by the deposition of sediments from rivers and streams. These sediments are typically composed of sand, silt, and clay, which are all light-coloured materials. The colour of the alluvial soils can also be affected by the presence of organic matter, which can give them a darker colour. Light orange to dark o range is the colour of laterite soils. Orange to red is the colour of red soils.

question: Q.396. Which of the following is an example of micronutrient supplied by soil ? SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.396.(b) Iron. Soil is a major s ource of nutrients needed by plants for growth. Macronutrients in soil - Nitrogen (N), Phosphorus (P), Potassium (K), Calcium (Ca), Magnesium (Mg) and Sulphur (S). Micronutrients in soil - Chlorine (Cl), Boron (B), Iron (Fe), Manganese (Mn), Copper (Cu), Zinc (Zn), Nickel (Ni) and Molybdenum (Mo).

question: Q.397. Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding fertilizers ? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) They are prepared in factories ', '(b) They are very rich in plant nutrients ', '(c) They provide humus to the soil ', '(d) They are man-made inorganic salt ']
answer: (c) They provide humus to the soil
solution: Sol.397.(c) Humus is the organic component of soil that is formed by the decomposition of plant and animal matter. It can be produced naturally or through a process called composting. Manures are used to provide humus in soil.

question: Q.398. Arid soils are characteristically developed in __________. which exhibit characteristic arid topography. SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Southern Uttar Pradesh ', '(b) Western Uttar Pradesh ', '(c) Western Rajasthan ', '(d) Southern Rajasthan ']
solution: Sol.398.(c) Western Rajasthan. In India, the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) has classified soils into 8 categories. They are: A lluvial Soil, B lack Cotton Soil, Red & Yellow Soil, Laterite Soil, Mountainous or Forest Soil, Arid or Desert Soil, Saline and Alkaline Soil, Peaty and Marshy Soil.

question: Q.399. Which of the following pairs of 'soil - characteristics' is correct? I. Sandy - proportion of fine particles is relatively higher II. Clayey - greater proportion of big particles SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Only I ', '(b) Neither I nor II ', '(c) Both I and II ', '(d) Only II ']
solution: Sol.399.(b) Neither I nor II. Sandy Soil : Consists of small particles of weathered rock; One of the poorest types of s oil for growing plants (very low nutrients and poor water holding capacity); Good for the drainage system; Usually formed by the breakdown or fragmentation of r ocks like granite, limestone and quartz. Clay Soil : Smallest particles (tightly packed together with each o ther with very little or no airspace); Good water storage qualities; Very sticky to touch when wet but smooth when dried; Densest and heaviest type of s oil which d oes not drain well or provide space for p lant roots to flourish.

question: Q.400. Which of the following factors of soil formation determines the accumulation of the soil ? SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.400.(c) Relief: Altitude and slope, determine accumulation of soil. Other Factors: Fauna is all of the animal life present in a particular region or time. Flora is all the plant life present in a particular region or time, generally the naturally occurring native plants.

question: Q.401. In which of the following soil conservation methods different crops a re grown in alternate rows and are sown at different times to protect the soil from rain wash ? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Shelter belts ', '(b) Contour ploughing ', '(c) Terrace farming ', '(d) Intercropping ']
solution: Sol.401.(d) Intercropping. Its most common goal is to produce a greater yield on a given piece of land. Terrace farming - An agricultural practice where farmers employ on steep slopes, hilly areas, and higher altitudes. Contour ploughing - Process of cutting furrows into the slope of the land in order to control the flow of water.

question: Q.402. In which of the soil conservation methods in the coastal and dry regions, rows of trees are planted to check the wind movement to protect soil cover? SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Mulching ', '(b) Shelter belts ', '(c) Rock dam ', '(d) Contour barriers ']
solution: Sol.402.(b) Shelterbelts. Mulching: The bare ground between plants is covered with a layer of organic matter like straw. It helps to retain soil moisture. Contour barriers : Stones, grass, soil are used to build barriers along contours. Trenches are made in front of the barriers to collect water.

question: Q.403. W hich of t he following statements is NOT correct regarding laterite soil? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Red laterite soils in Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Kerala are more suitable for crops like cashew nut. ', '(b) They are generally rich in humus. ', '(c) This soil is very useful for growing tea and coffee. ', '(d) The laterite soil develops in areas with high temperature and heavy rainfall. ']
answer: (b) They are generally rich in humus.
solution: Sol.403.(b) Laterite soil - It is rich in iron and aluminium. Features - Deficient in organic matter, phosphate, nitrogen and calcium but abundant in iron oxide and potash, forms due to the alternation of dry and wet periods, Because of l eaching these soils have an acidic quality. Suitable for - Banana, vegetables, tapioca, yams, pineapple, pepper, fruit trees etc.

question: Q.404. Identify the step that is NOT a part of decomposition. SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.404.(d) Soil erosion is the denudation or wearing away of t he upper layer of soil. It is a form of soil degradation. There are five steps of decomposition. T hese are fragmentation, leaching, catabolism, humification, and mineralization.

question: Q.405. Which of these methods is used for conservation of land rescore? SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Deforestation ', '(b) Poaching ', '(c) Land reclamation ', '(d) Indiscriminate use of chemical pesticides ']
solution: Sol.405.(c) Land reclamation . Poaching is the illegal trafficking and killing of wildlife.

question: Q.406. Which of the following factors does NOT affect the formation of soil? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.406.(c) Landslides. Climate affects the soil due to temperature and rainfall. Parent material is the foundation of soil formation, different materials develop different soil types. Topography affects soil formation by influencing factors like drainage, erosion, and accumulation of sediments.

question: Q.407. What do you call the weight a soil can withstand before severe damage occurs to the structure of the soil? SSC CGL 18/04/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Field capacity ', '(b) Bearing capacity ', '(c) Bulk density ', '(d) Buffering capacity ']
solution: Sol.407.(b) Bearing capacity is the capacity of soil to support the loads that are applied to the ground above. Field capacity is the amount of soil moisture or water content held in the soil after excess water has drained away and the rate of downward movement has decreased. Bulk d ensity is defined as the mass of the many particles of the material divided by the total volume they occupy. Buffer capacity refers to the amount of acid or base a buffer can neutralise before the pH changes by a large amount.

question: Q.408. ______ develops on crystalline igneous rocks in areas of low rainfall in the eastern and southern part of the Deccan Plateau. SSC CGL 20/04/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Red soil ', '(b) Black soil ', '(c) Alluvial soil ', '(d) Arid soil ']
solution: Sol.408.(a) Red soil. It contains a high percentage of iron content, which is responsible for its colour.

question: Q.409. Which part of the soil contains humus? SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.409.(a) A-horizon . This layer is the top layer of soil which i s also known a s a humus layer and is mainly rich in o rganic materials. B-horizon is typically a mineral subsurface horizon and is a zone of accumulation, called illuviation. C-horizon : This soil layer lies beneath the B horizon and consists essentially of the more or less weathered parent rock. Bedrock : Bedrock in geology is a solid rock that lies under loose softer material within the crust of Earth or another terrestrial planet.

question: Q.410. ______ are thick deposits of glacial clay and other materials embedded with moraines. SSC CGL 18/08/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.410.(a) Karewas are lacustrine deposits (deposits in a lake) in the valley of Kashmir and in the Bhaderwah valley of the Jammu division of Jammu and Kashmir. These are the flat-topped mounds that border the Kashmir valley on all sides.

question: Q.411. ______ is a deep red soil found in tropical regions and often developed on mafic igneous bedrock. SSC CHSL 16/04/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.411.(c) Laterite . Arid soils are formed from the fragmentation of adjacent rocks and are largely blown from the Indus valley area and coastal regions. Saline soils are formed whenever climate, soil, and hydrological conditions favor the accumulation of soluble salts in the root zone.

question: Q.412. As per ‚ÄòSoils of India, National Bureau of Soil Survey and Land Use Planning report: Publication Number 94‚Äô which type of soil (order) is most abundantly available? SSC CHSL 16/04/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.412.(c) Inceptisols: A soil order in USDA soil taxonomy. They form quickly through the alteration of the parent material. They are more developed than Entisols.

question: Q.413. Which of the following soils is found in areas of heavy rainfall and high humidity? SSC CHSL 10/8/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Saline soil ', '(b) Peaty soil ', '(c) Red soil ', '(d) Yellow soil ']
solution: Sol.413.(b) Peaty soil or marshy soils are a result of waterlogging and anaerobic conditions. They are found in areas of heavy rainfall and high humidity, where there is a good growth of Vegetation.

question: Q.414. Which of the following statements is NOT correct about alluvial soil? SSC CHSL 12/8/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Deltas of Mahanadi, the Godavari and the Krishna are made from alluvial soil. ', '(b) Old alluvial is called ‚Äòbangar‚Äô and new alluvial is called ‚Äòkhadar‚Äô. ', '(c) In the Himalayan region we find alluvial soil. ', '(d) Northern plains are made of alluvial soil. ']
answer: (c) In the Himalayan region we find alluvial soil.
solution: Sol.414.(c) Alluvial soil is mainly found in Northern Plains and valleys, not in Himalayan region. The major soils in the Himalayas are brown hill soil, sub-mountain soils, mountain meadow soil and red loamy s oils. Alluvial soils are rich in humus as they are deposited by three important rivers of Himalayas, Indus river, Ganges and Brahmaputra River.

question: Q.415. In which year was the Soil Survey of I ndia established to carry out scientific surveys of soils? SSC CHSL 18/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.415.(d) 1956. Soil Survey of India: A comprehensive study of soils in selected areas like in the Damodar Valley.

question: Q.416. Which of the following is INCORRECTLY paired? SSC CHSL 12/10/2020(Morning)
options: ['(a) Anthropology ‚Äì Cultural geography ', '(b) Demography ‚Äì Population geography ', '(c) Hydrology ‚Äì Oceanography ', '(d) Pedology ‚Äì Phyto geography ']
solution: Sol.416.(d) Pedology - Phyto geography. Pedology is a discipline within soil science which focuses o n understanding and characterizing soil formation, evolution and the theoretical frameworks through which w e understand a soil body, often in the context of the natural environment.

question: Q.417. Robert has sandy soil in his fields. The ideal crop for his field is: SSC CHSL 15/10/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.417.(a) Gram can be grown on a wide range of soil. But well drained medium to black cotton soils are very suitable. It can also be grown in light alluvial soils which are rich in organic matter. Corn requires rich, moist, well-drained sandy soil. A well-drained sandy loam to clay loam soils are ideal for cabbage growth. Soils with a clay loam good structure and moderate water holding capacity are ideal for wheat cultivation. Vegetation

question: Q.418. Mangrove forests of W est Bengal are also called: SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.418.(a) Sunderbans. Sundarbans mangrove forest : It lies on the delta of the Ganges, Brahmaputra and Meghna rivers on the Bay of Bengal.

question: Q.419. Which of the following statements is NOT true about the moist deciduous forests of India? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) They grow in regions with rainfall of 100-200 cm. ', '(b) They are found in the foothills of Himalayas. ', '(c) They are found in the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh. ', '(d) Sal, amla, shisham and mahua are some of the main species of these forests. ']
answer: (c) They are found in the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.
solution: Sol.419.(c) Moist deciduous forests exist mostly in the eastern part of the country ‚Äì northeastern states, along the foothills of the Himalayas, Jharkhand, West Odisha and Chhattisgarh, and on the eastern slopes of t he Western Ghats. The dry deciduous forests are found in areas having rainfall between 100 cm and 70 cm. These f orests are found in the rainier parts of t he Peninsular plateau and the plains of Bihar and Uttar Pradesh.

question: Q.420. In the Himalayas, the ________ temperature with increasing altitude causes the change in vegetation. SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.420.(b) decreasing. The Himalayan ranges show change in vegetation from tropical to tundra. Since air is less dense at higher altitudes, its molecules are spread farther apart than they are at sea level. These molecules have fewer collisions, so they produce less heat. At the bottom of the mountain, the temperature is high year-round while it is much cooler at the top due to which i t is covered with snow.

question: Q.421. Under which strata do trees fall? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Second vertical ', '(b) Top vertical ', '(c) Bottom vertical ', '(d) Middle vertical ']
solution: Sol.421.(b) Top vertical. Strata are layers of vegetation that are defined by the height of the plants. Second vertical - It contains the second-tallest p lants in a forest ecosystem, such as shrubs and small trees. Bottom vertical - It contains the shortest plants in a forest ecosystem, such as mosses and ferns. Middle vertical - It contains the plants that are in between the top and bottom vertical strata, such as medium-sized shrubs and trees.

question: Q.422. The natural vegetation of India is broadly divided into ______ groups. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.422.(d) 5. Vegetation of India: Tropical Evergreen Forests - Found in regions with high temperature and heavy rainfall such as Western Ghats, Islands group of lakshadweep, Andaman and Nicobar islands, upper part of Assam and Tamil Nadu.Tropical deciduous forest (Monsoon forests): Important trees - sal, teak, peepal, neem and shisham. Thorny bushes - Found in Rajasthan, Punjab, Haryana, Eastern slopes of Western Ghats and Gujarat. Mountain vegetation: Important trees - Chir, Pine and Deodar. Mangrove forests - Sundari is a well-known species of trees in mangrove forests.

question: Q.423. In which type of forests are wild donkeys and camels found in India? SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Tropical evergreen forest ', '(b) Mountain forest ', '(c) Thorny forests and bushes ', '(d) Mangrove forest ']
solution: Sol.423.(c) Thorny forests and bushes. Animals found in different forests in India: Tropical Evergreen Forests - Elephants, Monkeys, Lemurs and Deer. Montane Forests - Leopards, Yarks, Sheep and Goats. Mangrove forest - Royal Bengal Tiger. In terms of area, Madhya Pradesh has the largest forest area in the country. It is followed by Arunachal Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha and Maharashtra.

question: Q.424. Sal, acacia and bamboo, which are types of Dry Tropical Forest, receive what amount of annual rainfall? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) From 51 cm to 151 cm ', '(b) Between 200 and 250 cm ', '(c) 251 cm or more ', '(d) Below 25 cm ']
solution: Sol.424.(a) From 51 cm to 151 cm. Tropical forests (rainforests) : A rainforest is an area of tall, mostly evergreen trees and a high amount of rainfall, Earth‚Äôs oldest living ecosystems, with some surviving in their present form for at least 70 million years. Types of Tropical forests - Evergreen Rain (200 cm or more), Monsoon Deciduous (100 to 200 cm), Tropical Savanna (50 to 100 cm), Dry Thorny Scrub (Semi-arid) (25 to 50 cm), Desert (Arid) (Below 25 cm).

question: Q.425. Which of the following forest types is found on the foothills of the Himalayas? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.425.(d) Deciduous. This is an evergreen forest where a majority of the trees remain ‚Äúgreen‚Äù throughout the year because they shed leaves not seasonally but at various periods of the year. Example - Maple, oak, and elm. Temperate - Forest found between the tropical and boreal regions, located in the temperate zone. Example - Fir, oak. Tundra - Found in the Arctic and on the tops of mountains, where the climate is cold and windy, and rainfall is scant. Example - Arctic Willow. Alpine - Occur all along the Himalayas at altitudes ranging between 2,900 to 3,500 m. Example - Spruce and birch.

question: Q.426. Which of the following is the most widespread forest type in India? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Littoral and Swamp Forest ', '(b) Tropical Thorn Forests ', '(c) Montane Forests ', '(d) Tropical Deciduous Forests ']
solution: Sol.426.(d) Tropical Deciduous Forests (Monsoon Forests): It Found in india along the Equator belt between the tropic of Cancer and the tropic of Capricorn, (Major states - Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh, Chattisgarh, Odisha, Some Parts of Maharashtra). Rainfall is in the range of 70-200 cms in Deciduous Forests. These forests are comparatively less dense than evergreen forests. There are two types of Deciduous Forests: Moist Deciduous Forests (Mixture of Trees and Grasses) and Dry Deciduous Forests.

question: Q.427. What type of vegetation is found in the plateau of Meghalaya, Sahyadri and the central and southern islands of the Nicobar group? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Dry Tropical Deciduous Vegetation ', '(b) Dry Tropical Thorny Vegetation ', '(c) Alpine Vegetation ', '(d) Moist Tropical Semi - Evergreen Vegetation ']
solution: Sol.427.(d) Moist Tropical Semi - Evergreen Vegetation are transitional forests between tropical wet evergreen forests and tropical deciduous forests. Examples - Laurel, rosewood, mesua, white cedar. Tropical Dry Deciduous Vegetation - Occurs in an irregular wide strip running from the foot of the Himalayas to Kanyakumari except in Rajasthan, Western Ghats and West Bengal. Example - Teak, bamboo. Tropical Thorn Forests - Found in Rajasthan, south-western Punjab, western Haryana, Kachchh and neighbouring parts of Saurashtra. Example - Babool, neem, cactii.

question: Q.428. Plant varieties like bamboo, epiphytes, aini, semul, gutel and mundane are found in which type of Indian forest? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Alpine forest ', '(b) Montane temperate forest ', '(c) Moist tropical forest ', '(d) Dry tropical forest ']
solution: Sol.428.(c) Moist tropical forests have 200-250 cm annual rainfall, 24-27¬∞C temperature. Alpine forest: common in both the main Himalayan regions as well as the barren cold deserts of the Trans Himalaya. Examples - black juniper and willow. Montane temperate forest: mainly generated in Northern middle Himalayas ranges (1801 to 3001 m) and Southern Niligiri higher Mountain ranges. Examples - ferns, oak and maple. Dry tropical forest: forests mainly found in Indian Northern Hilly regions and some states of Southern India. Examples - sal, acacia, mangoes.

question: Q.429. Which of the following states is associated with the tropical thorn forests? Graduate Level 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 1)
options: ['(a) Andaman and Nicobar Islands ', '(b) West Bengal ', '(c) Madhya Pradesh ', '(d) Mizoram ']
solution: Sol.429.(c) Madhya Pradesh. Tropical Thorn Forests and S crubs (receive rainfall less than 50 cm) - It includes semi - arid areas of south west Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan, Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh. Trees like ‚Äì Babool, ber, wild date palm, Khair tree.

question: Q.430. Which of the following characteristics is INCORRECT about the tropical evergreen forests of India? Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 ( Shift - 3)
options: ['(a) These forests are well-stratified. ', '(b) In these forests, trees reach great heights of up to 60 m or above. ', '(c) They are found in warm and humid areas. ', '(d) These forests receive annual precipitation of below 150 cm. ']
answer: (d) These forests receive annual precipitation of below 150 cm.
solution: Sol.430.(d) Tropical evergreen forests - Region : Found in southern India along the Western Ghats, Andaman and Nicobar Islands and north-eastern region. Occurs in warm and humid areas with an annual precipitation of over 200 cm.

question: Q.431. Mosses and lichens are found in which kind of forest? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Tropical Rainforest ', '(b) Temperate Forest ', '(c) Coniferous Forest ', '(d) Tundra Forest ']
solution: Sol.431.(d) Tundra Forest - It has relatively little rain and extremely cold temperatures. It is composed of dwarf shrubs, sedges, grasses, mosses, and lichens. Tropical rainforests - Continuous rainfall throughout the year . The Amazon is the world's largest tropical rainforest. Temperate Forest - It is found between the tropical and boreal regions. It is the second largest biome on our planet, covering 25% of the world's forest area. Coniferous Forest - It is a forest biome characterized by trees with needle - shaped or scale - like leaves.

question: Q.432. Major plantations are found in the __________ region of the world. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.432.(a) Tropical. Plantation crops - A type of commercial farming where a single crop of tea, coffee, sugarcane, cashew, rubber, banana or cotton are grown. Major plantations - Rubber in Malaysia, coffee in Brazil, tea in India and Sri Lanka. Major food crops - Wheat, rice, maize and millets. Jute and cotton are fibre crops.

question: Q.433. Which of the following is an example of a terrestrial ecosystem? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.433.(c) Grasslands. Terrestrial ecosystem - It is a land-based community of species that includes biotic and abiotic interactions in a specific area. Examples - Forest, Grasslands, Tundra, Desert. Aquatic ecosystem - It is related to water. It includes Freshwater ecosystem (Pond, lake, river) and Marine ecosystem (Ocean, sea or estuary). Kelp is a type of large, brown seaweed that grows in shallow, nutrient-rich saltwater near coastal fronts around the world.

question: Q.434. In the higher latitudes (50¬∞ - 70¬∞) of Northern hemisphere the spectacular Coniferous forests are found. These are also called as ______ . SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.434.(d) Taiga - Trees found are mainly cone-bearing trees like spruce, pine, fir, and hemlock. Veld: Open, uncultivated country or grassland in southern Africa. Tundra: A vast, flat, treeless Arctic region of Europe, Asia, and North America in which the subsoil is permanently frozen. Llanos: A vast tropical grassland plain situated to the east of the Andes in Colombia and Venezuela, in northwestern South America. Q.435 . In India, palm, coconut, keora, a gar are the common trees of which of the following forests ? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Mangrove Forests (b) Tropical Evergreen Forests (c) Tropical Deciduous Forests (d) Montane Forests Sol.435.(a) Mangrove Forests: The Ganga-Brahmaputra delta is covered by mangrove forests, mainly Sundari trees which provide durable hard timber. Palm, coconut, keora, agar also grow in some parts of the delta.

question: Q.436. I n India, trees of which f orest type shed their leaves for about six to eight weeks in dry summer? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Tropical Deciduous Forests ', '(b) Tropical Evergreen Forests ', '(c) Montane Forests ', '(d) Tropical Thorn Forests and Scrubs ']
solution: Sol.436.(a) Tropical Deciduous Forests (monsoon forests) . These forests spread over regions which receive rainfall between 70-200 cm. Tendu, palas, amaltas, bel, khair, axlewood, etc are the common trees of these forests.

question: Q.437. In India, what is the mean annual average temperature in subtropical vegetation zone ? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.437.(d) 17¬∞C to 24¬∞C. Natural vegetation - The plant life that grows in an area without the influence of human activity. Types - Forests, Grasslands (divided into savannas, steppes and prairies, depending on the climate and other environmental factors), Deserts (These are arid regions with very little rainfall and sparse vegetation), Tundra (This is a cold, treeless region found in the Arctic and on high mountain slopes), Wetland (These are areas with water-logged soil, such as marshes).

question: Q.438. Which o f the following pairs of countries - name of grassland is correct? I. Argentina - Pampas II. Brazil - Steppe SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Neither I nor II ', '(b) Only II ', '(c) Only I ', '(d) Both I and II ']
solution: Sol.438.(c) Only I. Steppe - Europe and North Asia, Pustaz- Hungary, Prairies - USA, Pampas - Argentina, Veld - South Africa, Downs - Australia, Canterbury - New Zealand, Savannah - Africa, Taiga - Europe and Asia.

question: Q.439. The wet temperate type of f orests are found between a height of _________metres. SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.439.(c) 1000 and 2000. Wet temperate forests: Average annual rainfall and temperature in wet temperate forests are 150-300 cm and 11¬∞C-14¬∞C respectively. The relative humidity is over 80% on average. Oak trees and chestnut trees are found here. Other important species include Chilauni, Indian chestnut, Deodar, Machilus, Cinnamomum, Litsea, Plum, Blue pine, Birch, Oak, Hemlock, etc.

question: Q.440. Tropical grasslands of Brazil are known as________ S SC CHSL 20/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.440.(d) Campos. Pampas grasslands are situated in Argentina. The tropical grasslands in Africa are known as savannah. Tropical grasslands are known as Llanos in Venezuela and savanna in East Africa.

question: Q.441. Thorny b ushes are found i n ____ region. SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) mediterranean ', '(b) polar ', '(c) dry desert ', '(d) high rainfall ']
solution: Sol.441.(c) dry desert . In areas where there is less than 70 cm of rainfall , thorn forests and shrubs are found in the natural vegetation. This type of vegetation is found in the north-western parts of the country, which include the semi-arid regions of Gujarat, Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Madhya Pradesh, Uttar Pradesh and Haryana.

question: Q.442. The type of f orests located in mid latitudinal coastal region is__________ SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Tropical rainforest ', '(b) Mediterranean vegetation ', '(c) Monsoon forest ', '(d) Temperate evergreen forest ']
solution: Sol.442.(d) Temperate evergreen forests . They are commonly found on the eastern edges of continents, such as in southeastern America, southern China, and southeastern Brazil. Tropical rainforests are mainly located between the latitudes of 23.5¬∞N (the Tropic of Cancer) and 23.5¬∞S (the Tropic of Capricorn)‚Äîthe tropics. Mediterranean vegetation is mostly found in the areas around the Mediterranean sea in Europe, Africa and Asia. Monsoon forests (tropical deciduous forests) a re scattered across equatorial parts of Southeast Asia, the Americas, Africa and Australia.

question: Q.443. The birds like pheasant and monals are found in which type of forest? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Temperate deciduous forest ', '(b) Tropical evergreen forest ', '(c) Temperate evergreen forest ', '(d) Mediterranean forests ']
solution: Sol.443.(a) Temperate deciduous forest - higher latitudes. north eastern part of USA, China, New Zealand, Chile, coastal regions of Western Europe. Vegetation - oak, ash, beech. Animals - Deer, foxes, wolves. Tropical evergreen forest - Hardwood trees like rosewood, ebony, mahogany. Temperate evergreen forest - hard and soft wood trees like oak, pine, eucalyptus, etc. Mediterranean forests - oranges, figs, olives and grapes.

question: Q.444. Which of the following is a tree found in Mountain vegetation? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.444.(c) Chir. Chestnuts, oaks, Pine, Deodar, Cedars, cypresses, firs, junipers, kauris, larches, hemlocks, redwoods, spruces, and yews are trees found in Montane (Alpine) forests. These trees are called coniferous trees. These types of forests are found in the state of Assam, Nagaland, Mizoram, Meghalaya, Manipur, Arunachal Pradesh etc.

question: Q.445. A species of grass named _____ is on the verge of extinction due to its insensitivity towards the environment. SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Helianthus annuus ', '(b) Saccharum officinarum ', '(c) Hubbardia heptaneuron ', '(d) Bellis perennis ']
solution: Sol.445.(c) Hubbardia heptaneuron. T he native range of this species is India (Karnataka). It is an annual and grows primarily in the seasonally dry tropical biome. Helianthus annuus (Common Sunflower).

question: Q.446. Which of the following statements is NOT correct about the decline of wildlife in India? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Incidence of forest fire ', '(b) Agriculture and human settlement ', '(c) Grazing by domestic cattle ', '(d) Industrial and technological advancement ']
solution: Sol.446.(a) Incidence of forest fi re. High atmospheric temperatures and dryness (low humidity) offer favorable circumstances for a fire to start. The three types of forest fires are crown fire, surface fire and ground fire. Ground fire occurs on land and spreads slowly. Crown fires pose a high risk as they can spread from one tree to another. However, surface fires are usually smaller and cause the least damage.

question: Q.447. The National Commission on Agriculture (1976) of India has classified social forestry into how many categories? SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.447.(c) 3. Urban forestry pertains to the raising and management of trees on public and privately owned lands in and around urban centers such as green belts, parks, roadside avenues, industrial and commercial green belts, etc. Rural forestry lays emphasis on promotion of agroforestry and community-forestry.

question: Q.448. Which biome is found in the northern parts of Asia, Europe and North America where 300 to 900 millimeters (12 to 35 in) of rain can be expected per year? Graduate Level 02/08/2022 ( Shift - 3 )
options: ['(a) Taiga forests ', '(b) Temperate deciduous forests ', '(c) Coniferous forest ', '(d) Mediterranean forests ']
solution: Sol.448.(c) Coniferous forest (composed primarily of cone-bearing needle-leaved or scale-leaved evergreen trees, Pines, spruces, fi rs, and larches are the dominant trees in coniferous forests). Taiga forest (found in Siberia, Canada and Alaska and known as North woods). Mediterranean forest (Sea region, Central Chile, the Southwest United States, Australia, and Africa).

question: Q.449. The climatic conditions of thorn forests and scrubs are the most i deal for which of the following plant species? SSC MTS 05/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.449.(d) Euphorbia. It is a perennial herb that grows to 30 cm tall in the dry grasslands of Siberia, Mongolia, China, Korea, and Japan. Rosewood (tropical tree) is native to Brazil, Honduras, Jamaica, Africa, and India. Teak (tropical tree) is native to south and southeast Asia, India, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand, and Burma. Junipers (coniferous trees) are native to Europe, Asia, Africa, and North America.

question: Q.450. Temperate grasslands are ideal for _______ cultivation. SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.450.(d) wheat . Viticulture or grape cultivation is a speciality of the Mediterranean region. Grapes are cultivated on a very wide range of soils from gravelly sands to clays that can be of high or poor fertility. Apple farming practices are suitable in loamy soils rich with organic natural matter; and pH values ranging from 5.5 ‚Äì 6.5. Tropical grasslands have great potential for the cultivation of crops like cotton and coffee.

question: Q.451. Which of the following is a temperate grassland in Russia? SSC MTS 21/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.451.(d) Steppes. Temperate grasslands have cold winters and warm summers with some rain. Examples: include Eurasian steppes, North American prairies and Argentine pampas.

question: Q.452. Dry deciduous forests are found in areas having rainfall between SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) 150 cm and 120 cm ', '(b) 100 cm and 70 cm ', '(c) 200 cm and 150 cm ', '(d) 80 cm and 50 cm ']
solution: Sol.452.(b) 100 cm and 70 cm. They are found along with the coastal belts. These are mainly found in the Jharkhand, Western Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Eastern slope of western ghat. Examples of t rees found there are oak, ash, beech, maple, etc.

question: Q.453. What type of forests are found north and south of the equator between 40¬∞ and 60¬∞ where rainfall is high, between 500-1500 mm in a year? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Taiga forests ', '(b) Coniferous forests ', '(c) Mediterranean forests ', '(d) Temperate deciduous forests ']
solution: Sol.453.(d) Temperate deciduous forests . The taiga is a forest of the cold, subarctic region. Coniferous forests consist mostly of conifers, which are trees that grow needles instead of l eaves and cones instead of flowers. Mediterranean forests and shrublands are characterised by hot and dry summers, while winters tend to be cool and moist.

question: Q.454. Sandalwood is found in which type of forests in India? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Tropical thorn forests and scrubs ', '(b) Tropical deciduous forests ', '(c) Mangrove forests ', '(d) Tropical evergreen forests ']
solution: Sol.454.(b) Tropical deciduous forests (Monsoon Forest) require moderate humidity, average temperature, and rainfall (70-200 cm). Examples of trees found are Teak, Sal, Shisham, Hurra, Mahua, Amla, Semul, Kusum, Sandalwood, Tendu, Palas, Amaltas, Bel, Khair, Axlewood, etc.

question: Q.455. Which type of biome is located in Eastern North America, W estern Europe, and Northeast Asia? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Tropical Rainforest Biomes ', '(b) Coniferous Forest Biomes ', '(c) Aquatic Biomes ', '(d) Deciduous Forest Biomes ']
solution: Sol.455.(d) Deciduous Forest Biomes - This biome experiences all four seasons, these forests are divided into five zones based on the heights of the trees. The soil is particularly fertile and nutrient-rich and is located in North America (Canada, the United States, and Mexico), Europe, and western regions of Asia (Japan, China, North Korea, South Korea, and parts of Russia).

question: Q.456. Which of the following statements about forests is INCORRECT? SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) In a forest, trees form the uppermost layer of vegetation. ', '(b) Forests protect the soil from erosion. ', '(c) In a forest, shrubs form the lowest layer of vegetation. ', '(d) Forests influence climate, water cycle and air quality. ']
answer: (c) In a forest, shrubs form the lowest layer of vegetation.
solution: Sol.456.(c) The layer of vegetation in the forest which is just below the shrub layer is called the herb layer. The herb layer consists mainly of herbs, ferns and grasses. This layer is the lowest layer of vegetation in the forest (having leafy plants). Very little sunlight remains for the plants in the herb layer.

question: Q.457. ______ are the oldest living tree species on Earth. SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Lone Cypress ', '(b) Redwood tree ', '(c) Tree of Life ', '(d) Bristlecone pines ']
solution: Sol.457.(d) Bristlecone pines. It contains three species of pine trees (family Pinaceae, genus Pinus, subsection Balfourianae).

question: Q.458. Coringa is a beautiful ____ forest where the Godavari joins the backwaters of Bay of Bengal. SSC CHSL 12/8/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.458.(c) Mangrove. Coringa Wildlife Sanctuary is an estuary situated near Kakinada in Andhra Pradesh, India. Q.459 . Which of the following trees will you find in the Littoral forests? SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Afternoon) (a) Chinar (b) Ebony (c) Sundari (d) Cypress Sol.459.(c) Sundari tree is found in Sunderbans delta in West Bengal in Mangrove forest (Littoral forests). Climate

question: Q.460. Which of the following cities in India faces monsoon rain first? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024
solution: Sol.460.(c) Thiruvanantpuram. The South west monsoon originates over the Indian ocean and travels toward the mainland of India. Due to the peculiar shape of t he Indian Peninsula, southwest monsoon winds Bifurcated into two branches: The Arabean sea branch and Bay of Bengal branch. Kerala i s the first state to receive Rainfall by monsoon. At the end of September, North-East Monsoon (retreating monsoon) brings rainfall at the eastern coastal area (Coromandel Cost) along with Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.

question: Q.461. Mawsynram receives the highest average annual rainfall in the world because the Monsoon Winds of the Bay of Bengal strike the _____________ hill. SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023
options: ['(a) Western Ghats ', '(b) Khasi ', '(c) Aravalli ', '(d) Chota Nagpur Plateau ']
solution: Sol.461.(b) khasi hills (meghalaya) . The Meghalaya plateau is further subdivided into three: The Garo Hills; The Khasi Hills; The Jaintia Hills, named after the tribal groups inhabiting this region. This area receives maximum rainfall from the south west monsoon. Cherrapunji and Mawsynram in the Khasi Hills of Meghalaya receive rainfall over 1,080 cm in a year, Jaisalmer in Rajasthan gets about 9 cm of rainfall during the same period.

question: Q.462. Which of the following statements is correct regarding the climate of the Indian subcontinent? A. The climate of North India remains similar throughout the year B. The Himalayas protect the subcontinent from extremely cold winds from central Asia. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Only Statement A is correct ', '(b) Both Statements A and B incorrect ', '(c) Only Statement B is correct ', '(d) Both Statements A and B correct S ol.462.(c) South Asia experiences two monsoons, Southwest monsoon (summer monsoon) during June to September and the Northeast Monsoon (winter monsoon) during October to December. The Indian subcontinent receives most of its rainfall from the Southwest monsoon. Continentality - It refers to a climatic effect that emerges because of the different range of temperature that exists at places lying in the interior of the continent. Continental climates are common between 40¬∞ and 70¬∞ north latitude.']

question: Q.463. What is Kalbaisakhi? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Snowfall and hail ', '(b) Heatwaves and loo ', '(c) Pre monsoon showers and thunderstorms ', '(d) Cold waves and rains ']
solution: Sol.463.(c) Kaal Baisakhi (Norwester) - Dreaded evening thunderstorms in Bengal and Assam. It is also known as Bardoli cheerha in Assam. Other famous Local Storms of Hot Weather Season : Mango Shower - Pre-monsoon showers are common especially in Kerala and Karnataka. They help in the early ripening of mangoes, and are often referred to as ‚Äòmango showers‚Äô. Blossom Shower - With this shower, coffee flowers blossom in Kerala. Loo : These are strong, gusty, hot, dry winds blowing during the day over the north and northwestern India.

question: Q.464. How many controls are there globally that influence the climate of a particular zone? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.464.(a) 6. There are six major controls of t he climate of a ny place. T hey are: latitude, altitude, pressure and wind system, distance from the sea (continentality), ocean currents and relief features. Climate is the long-term average weather conditions in a place. Weather refers to the state of the atmosphere over an area at any point of time.

question: Q.465. When was the Indian Meteorological Department,Which collects data on temperature, rainfall, wind, etc., a nd makes weather forecasts, established by the Government of India? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.465.(d) 1875. Indian Meteorological Department - An agency of the Ministry of Earth Sciences of the Government of India. It is the principal agency responsible for meteorological observations, weather forecasting and seismology. Formed - 15 January 1875. Headquarters - New Delhi. Regional offices - Chennai, Mumbai, Kolkata, Nagpur, Guwahati and New Delhi.

question: Q.466. Choose the INCORRECT statement related to monsoon. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) The intensity and position of the high-pressure area, east of Madagascar, affects the Indian Monsoon ', '(b) The Southwest Monsoon winds blow over the warm oceans, gather moisture and bring widespread rainfall over the mainland of India. ', '(c) The difference in pressure over Tahiti (Pacific Ocean), and Darwin in northern Australia (Indian Ocean) is computed to predict the intensity of the monsoons. ', '(d) The western cyclonic disturbances occur due to withdrawal or the retreat of the monsoon ']
answer: (d) The western cyclonic disturbances occur due to withdrawal or the retreat of the monsoon
solution: Sol.466.(d) Western Cyclonic Disturbances are weather phenomena of the winter months brought in by the westerly flow from the Mediterranean region. They usually influence the weather of the north and north-western regions of India. It originates over the Mediterranean: The region which includes the Mediterranean Sea and seven Member States, either partially (France, Portugal, Italy, Spain) or completely (Greece, Malta, Cyprus).

question: Q.467. Which of the following statements is NOT true for Indian monsoons ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Monsoonal rainfall is the lifeline of Indian agriculture ', '(b) Monsoonal rainfall is not affected by the relief features of the country ', '(c) Himalayas play an important role in monsoonal rainfall ', '(d) Monsoonal rainfall is affected by jet streams ']
answer: (b) Monsoonal rainfall is not affected by the relief features of the country
solution: Sol.467.(b) The climate of India is described as Monsoon type. Monsoon i s taken from the Arabic word ‚Äòmausim‚Äô, which means seasons. Due to India‚Äôs location in the tropical region, most of the rain is brought by monsoon winds. Southwest Monsoon (June to September) Season is marked by the onset and advance of monsoon and the months of October and November are known for retreating monsoons.

question: Q.468. Which winds blow across the Asian continent at latitudes north of the Himalayas roughly parallel to the Tibetan highlands ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Trade winds ', '(b) Jet streams ', '(c) Southwest winds ', '(d) Northwest winds ']
solution: Sol.468.(b) Jet streams - A narrow belt of high altitude (above 12,000 m) westerly winds in the Troposphere. Their speed varies from about 110 km/h in summer to about 1 84 km/h in winter. The polar jet is located between the 50¬∞-60¬∞ latitude lines in both the northern and southern hemispheres. The subtropical jet is located around the 30¬∞ latitude line.

question: Q.469. What type of climate is found in North Western Europe, West Coast of North America, North of California, Southern Chile, South-eastern Australia and New Zealand? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Tropical wet and dry climate ', '(b) Cold snow forest climate ', '(c) Marine west coast climate ', '(d) Subtropical steppe climate ']
solution: Sol.469.(c) Marine west coast climate - Under the Koppen Climate Classification, it comes under Warm Temperate (Mid-Latitude) Climates (Group C) and is represented by ‚Äò C fb‚Äô. Characteristics: Mild temperatures with moderate rainfall throughout the year, longer and cooler winter.

question: Q.470. Choose the INCORRECT statement out of the following. SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) There is an increase in rainfall generally from east to west in the Northern Plains. ', '(b) Most parts of the country receive rainfall from June to September. ', '(c) The annual precipitation in Meghalaya is over 400 cm. ', '(d) Some parts like the Tamil Nadu‚Äôs coast gets a large portion of its rains during October and November. ']
answer: (a) There is an increase in rainfall generally from east to west in the Northern Plains.
solution: Sol.470.(a) Rainfall decreases from the east to the west in Northern India because there is a decrease in the moisture content of the winds. The monsoon approaches the Indian landmass in two branches: The Arabian Sea branch (The monsoon winds originating over the Arabian Sea) and the Bay of Bengal branch.

question: Q.471. In which type of rainfall, winds move out from a high-pressure area with wind direction clockwise in the northern hemisphere, and anti-clockwise in the southern hemisphere ? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.471.(c) Anticyclone - It is the center of high pressure, surrounded by closed isobars. Due to Coriolis force, blowing winds are deflected from their paths to the right in the Northern hemisphere (Clockwise) and left in the Southern hemisphere (Anti clockwise). Cyclones that develop in the mid and high latitudes, beyond the tropical regions, are referred to as middle latitude or extratropical cyclones.

question: Q.472. Which of the following places experiences extreme cold in winter and pleasant weather in summer? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.472.(b) Leh. It is a cold desert because it is located at a high altitude. Weather in different parts of India : New Delhi - Extreme climate that is very hot in summer (25 ¬∞ - 45 ¬∞C) and cold ( 22 ¬∞C - 5 ¬∞C) in winter. Amritsar - Mild and moderate climate. The temperature in summer is 35¬∞ - 45¬∞C and in winter it is 7 ¬∞ -15 ¬∞C. Chennai - Average temperature in Winter 24¬∞ - 25¬∞ C.

question: Q.473. According to the Koppen classification, Which regions experience cold humid winters with short summers? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) South of Goa ', '(b) Western Rajasthan ', '(c) Arunachal Pradesh ', '(d) Northern Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.473.(c) Arunachal P radesh. Koeppen identified a close relationship between the distribution of vegetation and climate. He recognised five major climatic groups, four of them are based on temperature and one on precipitation. The capital letters : A, C, D, and E delineate humid climates and B dry climates. The small letters a, b, c, and d a re used to indicate the degree of temperature severity. The dry seasons are indicated by the letters f, m , w, and s, where f indicates no dry season, m - monsoon climate, w - winter dry season, and s - Summer dry season.

question: Q.474. Which of the following locations experiences the lowest amount of r ainfall during the monsoon season ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.474.(c) Leh is located in the rain shadow region of the Himalayas, which means that the mountains block the monsoon winds from reaching this region. India mainly receives Monsoon rainfall between June and September. The average annual rainfall in India - about 125 cm. Mawsynram (Meghalaya) in the Khasi hills receives the highest rainfall in a year. Lowest rainfall - Jaisalmer (Rajasthan).

question: Q.475. In which o f t he following states of India the 'Loo' wind does NOT blow during the summer season? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.475.(c) Goa. Loo - These are hot and dry winds, which blow very strongly over the northern plains of India and Pakistan in the months of May and June. Their direction is usually from west to east. Their temperature varies from 45¬∞C to 50¬∞C. Hot and dry winds in other regions and their names : Western North America - Chinook, parts of the Mediterranean area - Sirocco, northern slopes of the Alps - Foehn.

question: Q.476. What is the usual term used to describe the climate of India? SSC MTS 04/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Polar climate ', '(b) Tropical monsoon ', '(c) Desert climate ', '(d) Arid climate ']
solution: Sol.476.(b) Tropical monsoon . A monsoon is a seasonal change in the direction of the prevailing, or strongest, winds of a region. It always blows from cold to warm regions. The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) designates four official seasons: Winter (December to early April); Summer or pre-monsoon (April to June); Monsoon o r rainy (June to September) and Post-monsoon (October to December).

question: Q.477. What is 'Mahawat' in India? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Cold waves during the winter season ', '(b) Cloud burst during the monsoon season ', '(c) Cyclonic rainfall during the winter season ', '(d) Hot and dry winds during the summer season ']
answer: (c) Cyclonic rainfall during the winter season
solution: Sol.477.(c) Mahawat is the total amount of rainfall in the cold weather season, that is the winter season which i s caused by the western cyclonic disturbances in the north and north -western part of India.

question: Q.478. According to the Koppen classification, which letter code represents a tropical climate with dry winter seasons found in large parts of peninsular India south of the Tropic of Cancer? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.478.(b) Aw. Koppen Classification: It was developed by Wladimir Peter Koeppen in 1884. The five main groups are A (tropical), B (dry climates), C (warm temperate), D (continental), and E ( polar). The seasons of dryness are indicated by the small letters: f (no dry season), m (monsoon climate), w (winter dry season) and s (summer dry season). Climatic Regions of India: Amw, As, Aw, BShw, BWhw, Cwg, Dfc, Et, E.

question: Q.479. T he target for the first commitment period of the Kyoto Protocol is to reduce emissions of greenhouse gasses by 5.2% from 1990 levels? SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.479.(a) 6. Kyoto Protocol: It was adopted on 11 December 1997 and entered into force on 16 February 2005. It was adopted in Kyoto, Japan. It was the result of the Rio-1992 and the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC). Kyoto Protocol cover emissions of t he six main greenhouse gases (Carbon dioxide (CO ), 2 methane (CH ), nitrous oxide (N O), 4 2 hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), perfluorocarbons (PFCs), and sulfur hexafluoride (SF )) 6

question: Q.480. Which of t he following is NOT one of the factors that has contributed towards localisation of the cotton textile industry in India? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Dry climate ', '(b) Accessible port facilities ', '(c) Availability of labor ', '(d) Availability of raw cotton ']
solution: Sol.480.(a) Dry Climate. Black soil is best suited for the cultivation of the cotton. Other factors of t he cotton textile industry: Market, Climate, Power Resources. The first m odern cotton mill in India was started in 1854 (Bombay). Mumbai is the cottonopolis of India. Ahmedabad (Gujarat) is called 'Manchester of India'.

question: Q.481. In the context of m apping c limate data, what term refers to a line drawn through all points on a map that contain the same amount of cloud? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (2nd shift)
solution: Sol.481.(c) Isonephs. Isocheim - A line on a map connecting points having the same average temperature in winter. Isohel - A line on a map connecting points having the same duration of sunshine. Isochalaz - A line of constant frequency of hail storms.
