question: Q.482. What is the phenomenon called when rain fails to occur for one or more weeks during the south-west monsoon period ? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Withdrawal of the monsoon ', '(b) Break in the monsoon ', '(c) El Nino ', '(d) Monsoon depression ']
solution: Sol.482.(b) Break in the monsoon. The southwest monsoon season - Rainfall received from the southwest monsoons is seasonal in character, which occurs between June and September. The North-East Monsoons (retreating monsoon) - The months of October and November. This monsoon is limited to south India, bringing rain to Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karaikal, Yanam, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala, Mahe.

question: Q.483. According to Koeppen's Scheme, which type of c limate is denoted by 'Cwg' in India? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Monsoon with dry winter ', '(b) Semi-arid steppe climate ', '(c) Polar type ', '(d) Monsoon with dry summer ']
solution: Sol.483.(a) Monsoon with dry winter - It is mostly found in the Ganga Plain, eastern Rajasthan, Assam, and the Malwa Plateau. Amw (Monsoon type with a short dry winter season): This climate is found in the western coastal region, south of Mumbai. List of c limatic groups and their characteristics according to Koeppen: A - Tropical, B - Dry Climates, C - Warm Temperate, D - Cold Snow Forest Climates, E - Cold Climates, H - Highland.

question: Q.484. Which of the following is incorrectly matched? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Montane climate - Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand ', '(b) Tropical monsoon climate - The Western Ghats, the Malabar Coast And Southern Assam ', '(c) Tropical semi-arid (steppe) climate - Karnataka, central Maharashtra, some parts of Tamil Nadu and Andhra Pradesh ', '(d) Hot desserts, arid climate - rajasthan and some parts of Gujarat ']
answer: (a) Montane climate - Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Jharkhand
solution: Sol.484.(a) Montane climate - Found in Assam, Nagaland, Mizoram, Meghalaya, Manipur, Arunachal Pradesh, Higher hills of Tamil Nadu. Q.485 . Where does the Bay of Bengal Monsoon Branch and Arabian Sea Branch merge? SSC CGL 20/07/2023 (2nd shift) (a) Southern Part of Peninsular (b) Coromandel Coast (c) North Western Part of Ganga Plains (d) North of Deccan Plateau Sol.485.(c) North Western Part o f Ganga Plains (The Punjab and adjoining Himalayas) . South West Monsoon Season - June to mid September. It is also known as a hot-wet season . Tamil Nadu, the rain shadow area of the western ghats, receives a small amount of its annual rainfall from the southwest monsoon. North-East Monsoon : (October to December) Coromandel and Rayalaseema receive the majority of t heir rainfall.

question: Q.486. The centre of a cyclone is a calm area. It is called the_______of the storm. SSC CGL 24/07/2023( 4th shift)
options: ['(a) base ', '(b) focal point ', '(c) eye ', '(d) trigger point ']
solution: Sol.486.(c) Eye. The eye of a storm is usually circular and typically 25-40 miles in diameter. It is surrounded by an eyewall, where the most severe weather of a cyclone occurs.

question: Q.487. In how many agro-climatic zones has Tamil Nadu been classified? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift)
solution: Sol.487.(c) 7 ( North Eastern zone, North Western zone, Western zone, Cauvery delta zone, Southern zone, High rainfall zone, Hill and high altitude zone). India has 15 main agro-climatic regions as Western Himalayan, Lower Gangetic Plain, Eastern Plateau and hill. The Climate of TamilNadu is generally tropical and features hot temperatures over the year except during the monsoon seasons.

question: Q.488. According to the traditional Indian seasons, which of the following seasons falls in the months of November - December? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 4th shift)
solution: Sol.488.(c) Pre-Winter. S easons Name in India:- Spring: March - April (Chaitra - Vaishakh), Summer: May - June (Jyestha - Ashadha), Monsoon: July - August (Shravan - Bhadrapada), Autumn: September - October (Asvina - Kritika), Pre-Winter: November - December (Agrahayana - Paush), Winter: December - February (Magh - Falgun).

question: Q.489. Select the correct statement from the given options. SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) There is very little temperature difference between day and night in the coastal areas of Kerala. ', '(b) There is very little temperature difference between day and night In Rajasthan. ', '(c) There is extreme cold in southern India during winter season ', '(d) There is plenty of rain observed in central India throughout the year. ']
answer: (a) There is very little temperature difference between day and night in the coastal areas of Kerala.
solution: Sol.489.(a) The coastal areas experience a phenomenon known as the maritime effect or coastal effect, which is responsible for the minimal temperature difference between day and night. Factors contributing to this phenomenon - Water's High Specific Heat (means it can absorb and store large amounts of heat energy without a significant increase in temperature), Moderating Influence of the Ocean, Sea Breezes, Land's Lower Heat Capacity.

question: Q.490. What would happen if the difference in pressure in Tahiti was negative? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Above average late monsoon ', '(b) Drought ', '(c) Below average and late monsoon ', '(d) Above average and early monsoon ']
solution: Sol.490.(c) The difference in pressure over Tahiti (Pacific Ocean) and Darwin in Northern Australia (Indian Ocean) is computed to predict the intensity of the monsoons. Factors Affecting Monsoon - The shift of the position of Inter Tropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ); The presence of the high-pressure area, east of Madagascar; Heating of The Tibetan plateau in summers; The movement of the jet streams; Southern O scillation (SO) - Change of pressure between south Pacific Ocean and eastern Indian Ocean.

question: Q.491. What type of climate occurs along the west coast of continents in subtropical latitudes between 30¬∞-40¬∞ latitudes, covering Central California, Central Chile along the coast in South East and South Western Australia? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 4)
options: ['(a) Subtropical steppe climate ', '(b) Humid subtropical climate ', '(c) Mediterranean climate ', '(d) Marine west coast climate ']
solution: Sol.491.(c) Mediterranean climate. Types of Climates: Tropical ( India, Brazil) - It is a hot and humid zone, where the average temperatures are greater than 64¬∞F (18¬∞C) year-round and more than 59 inches of precipitation each year. Dry (West Africa, The Andes) - These climate zones are so dry because moisture is rapidly evaporating from the air and there is very little precipitation. Temperate (Middle East, Canada) - In this zone, there are typically warm and humid summers with thunderstorms and mild winters. Continental (China, Iran) - These regions have warm to cool summers and very cold winters. Polar (Denmark, Norway, Finland) - In this zone, it‚Äôs extremely cold. Even in summer, the temperatures here never go higher than 50¬∞F (10¬∞C).

question: Q.492. What is the average temperature usually in the hills of the western ghats? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)
solution: Sol.492.(c) Below 25¬∞C. Western Ghats - These are also known as the Sahyadri Hills. It covers six states - Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and Kerala. It is designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site (2012). Endangered Species to Western Ghats: Lion tailed-macaque, Nilgiri tahr, Nilgiri langur. Passes in Western Ghats: Thal Ghat Pass (Kasara Ghat), Bhor Ghat Pass, Palakkad Gap (Pal Ghat), Amba Ghat Pass, Naneghat Pass, Amboli Ghat Pass.

question: Q.493. Which winds are also known by the name of 'Roaring Forties'? SSC MTS 11/07/2022 (Evening) ( a) Polar easterlies (b) westerly winds (c) Polar winds (d) Trade winds Sol.493.(b) Westerly Wind . The polar easterlies are one of the five primary wind zones, known as wind belts, that make up our atmosphere's circulatory system. Polar winds begin near the North and South Poles. The trade winds are air currents closer to Earth's surface that blow from east to west near the equator.
Q.494. W hich among the following wind is associated with extreme cold and dryness? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Monsoon Winds ', '(b) Westerlies ', '(c) Trade Winds ', '(d) Polar Easterlies ']
solution: Sol.494.(d) Polar Easterlies . They emanate from the polar highs, areas of high pressure around the North and South Poles. They flow to low-pressure areas in sub-polar regions. Easterlies (blow from the east) - It is the name of the permanent winds that come from the direction of t heir origin. Monsoon Winds - They are caused when the air over land gets heated and rises, causing winds to blow from the ocean toward land. Westerlies - Prevailing winds from the west toward the east in the middle latitudes. Trade Winds - The permanent east-to-west prevailing winds that flow i n the Earth's equatorial region.

question: Q.495. ENSO is the phenomenon related to pressure conditions. What is the full form of ENSO ? SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) El Nina Southern Occasions ', '(b) El Nino Southern Oscillation ', '(c) El Nino South Occasion ', '(d) El Nina South Oscillations ']
solution: Sol.495.(b) ENSO is an irregular periodic variation in winds and sea surface temperatures over the tropical eastern Pacific Ocean, affecting the climate of much of the tropics and subtropics.

question: Q.496. Seasonal reversal in the wind direction during a year refers to . SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.496.(a) Monsoon is derived from the Arabic word ‚Äòmawsim‚Äô which means season. It travels from the sea to the land in summers and from land to the sea during winters. Branches of monsoon: Arabian Sea branch (South - west Monsoon) - Monsoon winds originate over the Arabian Sea. Bay of B engal branch - originate over the bay of bengal. Climate - Long-term pattern of weather in a particular area. Breeze - Wind that blows from high to low -pressure zones.

question: Q.497. The weather pattern formed on the basis of weather data collected for a place over a long period of time, say 25 years, is called ____________ of that place. SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.497.(b) Climate. It is determined by factors such as the latitude, altitude, and proximity to the ocean. Environment is the surroundings of an organism or population, including the physical factors and the living things with which it interacts.

question: Q.498. The summer months experience __________ in the northern part of India. SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) rising air pressure ', '(b) falling air pressure ', '(c) decreasing temperature ', '(d) heavy rain ']
solution: Sol.498.(b) Falling air pressure. An elongated low-pressure area develops in the region extending from the Thar Desert in the northwest to Patna and Chotanagpur plateau in the east and southeast towards the end of May. Circulation of air begins to set in around this trough. InterTropical Convergence Zone (ITCZ) - Low pressure region around which the southeast trade winds and the northeast trade winds converge.

question: Q.499. The day to day condition of the atmosphere at a place with respect to the temperature, humidity, r ainfall, wind speed etc. is called _______ at that place. SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.499.(b) Weather. Climate - It is the long-term average of w eather conditions, including temperature, humidity, precipitation, wind patterns, and other atmospheric elements, in a particular region over an extended period, typically 30 years or more. Q.500 . Which of the following pressure belts is known as the horse latitude? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Equatorial Low Pressure (b) Sub - Polar Low Pressure (c) High Pressure (d) Sub - Tropical High Pressure Sol.500.(d) Subtropical high pressure belts (Horse latitude) extend 30¬∞ N and 30¬∞ S. It is formed because the warm air rising from the equator moves towards the t ropics in both hemispheres. Equatorial Low - Pressure belt extends from 0 to 5¬∞ North and South. Subpolar low pressure belt extends around latitudes 60¬∞ to 70¬∞ North and South. High Pressure belts are located at 70¬∞- 90¬∞ North and South latitudes. There are majorly seven Pressure Belts on the surface of Earth i.e., the Equatorial Low, two Subtropical Highs, two Subpolar Lows, and two Polar Highs.

question: Q.501. When the grains of sand are very fine and light , t he wind can c arry it over a very long distance . When such sand is deposited in large areas, it is called_____. SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.501.(a) Loess. It is a clastic, predominantly silt-sized sediment that is formed by the accumulation of wind -blown dust.

question: Q.502. Following statements are made regarding global warming. A. Global warming is the long-term heating of Earth's surface observed since the pre- industrial period due to human activities, primarily fossil fuel burning, which increases heat-trapping greenhouse gas levels in Earth's atmosphere. B. Global warming causes climate change, which poses a serious threat to life on Earth in the forms of widespread flooding and extreme weather. Which of these statements are correct? SSC CGL Tier II 06/03/2023
options: ['(a) Only B ', '(b) Only A ', '(c) Both A & B ', '(d) Both A & B are incorrect ']
solution: Sol.502.(c) Both A & B. Global warming : Gradual increase in the earth‚Äôs temperature generally due to the greenhouse effect caused by increased levels of Carbon dioxide (CO ), Methane 2 (CH ), Nitrous oxide (N O). Industrial 4 2 gases : Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs), Perfluorocarbons (PFCs), Sulfur hexafluoride (SF ), Nitrogen trifluoride 6 (NF ). 3

question: Q.503. Consider the following statements about the main reasons for the excessive cold in north India during the cold weather season and identify which of the statements are correct. 1. States like Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan, being far away from the moderating influence of sea, experience continental climate. 2. The snowfall in the nearby Himalayan ranges creates a cold wave situation. 3. Around February, the cold winds coming from the Caspian Sea and Turkmenistan bring a cold wave along with frost and fog over the northwestern parts of India. SSC CGL Tier II 07/03/2023
options: ['(a) 1 and 2 only ', '(b) 2 and 3 only ', '(c) 1, 2 and 3 ', '(d) 1 and 3 only ']
solution: Sol.503.(c) 1, 2 and 3. Coastal areas have moderate temperatures because the land absorbs a nd radiates heat much faster than sea. So, during the day cool air from the sea rushes towards the land and during the night cool air from the land rushes towards the sea.

question: Q.504. Low annual range of t emperature and high annual rainfall are characteristics of a _________. SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) Mediterranean climate ', '(b) temperate climate ', '(c) tropical humid climate ', '(d) cold climate ']
solution: Sol.504.(c) Tropical Humid Climate: L ow range of temperature, Rainfall exceeds evapotranspiration for at least 270 days in a year, between Tropic of Cancer and Capricorn. Mediterranean climate (hot dry summers and humid, cool winters), Temperate climates (moderate rainfall, mild to warm summers, and cold winters), Cold climate (the mean temperature of the warmest month is below 10¬∞C).

question: Q.505. Around the time of its arrival, the normal rainfall increases suddenly and continues constantly for several days. This is known as the ______ of the monsoon, and can b e distinguished from the pre-monsoon showers. SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.505.(b) Burst. It is a sudden change from hot and dry to humid and humid weather, characterized by rainfall. The burst of monsoon is first observed over the Western Ghats of Kerala, the coastal state of India, thus making the region the first state in India to receive rainfall from the south-west monsoon.

question: Q.506. Which of the following codes signify the Cold Climate with Dry Winters according to Koeppen? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.506.(d) Dw. Koeppen recognised six major climatic groups based on seasonal precipitation and temperature patterns. The six main groups are A (tropical), B (arid), C (temperate), D (continental), E (polar) and H (highland).

question: Q.507. The cold snow forest climate is found largely in the continental region in the Northern Hemisphere between________northern latitudes in Europe, Asia and North America SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.507.(a) 40¬∞-70¬∞. India has a tropical climate because of the Himalayan mountain.

question: Q.508. In early November, the low Pressure conditions shift over the Bay of Bengal. This transfer is related to cyclonic low pressure, which originates over ________. SSC MTS 13/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Andaman Sea ', '(b) Sea of J apan ', '(c) Caspian Sea ', '(d) Pacific Ocean ']
solution: Sol.508.(a) Andaman Sea (Burma sea in Thai) is a b ody o f w ater to the southeast of the Bay of Bengal, south of Myanmar, west of Thailand and east of the Andaman Islands; it is a part of the Indian Ocean.

question: Q.509. ________ zone is generally defined as an environment with moderate rainfall throughout the year or parts of the year, with sporadic dry, mild to hot summers and cool to cold winters. SSC CHSL 01/06/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.509.(a) Temperate. Zones are divided according to latitude . A temperate zone is an area or region between the Tropic of Cancer and the arctic circle or between the Tropic of Capricorn and the antarctic circle. The tropical (Torrid Zone), lies near the Equator and extends to the Tropic of Cancer in the north and the Tropic of Capricorn in the south.

question: Q.510. Which climate zone has an average temperature of over 64¬∞F (18¬∞C) throughout the year and more than 59 inches of rainfall each year? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Tropical zone ', '(b) Temperate zone ', '(c) Dry zone ', '(d) Continental zone ']
solution: Sol.510.(a) Tropical Zone. The tropics are regions of t he Earth that lie roughly i n the middle of the globe. T he temperature remains high throughout the year. There is no marked winter season.

question: Q.511. What type of climate do the two island regions of I ndia, Lakshadweep and Andaman and Nicobar Islands experience? SSC CHSL 06/06/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Humid subtropical climate ', '(b) Hot semi-arid climate ', '(c) Tropical warm climate ', '(d) Subtropical highland climate ']
solution: Sol.511.(c) Tropical warm climates with average temperatures ranging between 27¬∞ C ‚Äì 32¬∞ C. Lakshadweep (an archipelago of 36 islands in the Arabian Sea). Hot semi-arid climate - Thar Desert .

question: Q.512. What type of precipitation is common at the equatorial depression in the Congo Basin, the Amazon Basin, and the islands of South-east Asia? SSC CHSL 07/06/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Conventional precipitation ', '(b) Monsoonal precipitation ', '(c) Orographic precipitation ', '(d) Frontal precipitation ']
solution: Sol.512.(a) Conventional precipitation occurs when the energy of the sun (or insolation) heats the earth's surface and causes water to evaporate, changing to water vapor. Most of India's rainfall is conventional. It is prevalent in equatorial regions. Orographic precipitation occurs when a topographic barrier like a mountain blocks the path of a movement of air horizontally. Frontal precipitation occurs along the zone of contact between a warm and cool air mass.

question: Q.513. According to K√∂ppen's climate classification scheme, dry climates are subdivided using the capital letter S for semi-arid regions or steppe and W for ________ region. SSC CHSL 09/06/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.513.(b) desert. The seasons of dryness are indicated by the small letters : f, m, w a nd s, where f corresponds to no dry season, m - Monsoon climate, w- winter dry season and s - Summer dry season.

question: Q.514. __ is concerned w ith constructing records of past climates and climatic events by analysis of tree growth characteristics, especially growth rings. SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Bioclimatology ', '(b) Historical- climatology ', '(c) Geo climatology ', '(d) Dendroclimatology ']
solution: Sol.514.(d) Dendroclimatology . Bioclimatology (biometeorology) is the study of the relationships between climate (weather) and living organisms. Historical climatology is the study of historical changes in climate and their effect on civilization from the emergence of hominids to the present day. Geo climatology is the study of c limate which defines how it changes over time. Industries

question: Q.515. Which of the following is the only vertically-integrated, primary copper producer in India ? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Sterlite Industries ', '(b) Jhagadia Copper Limited ', '(c) Hindalco Industries (Birla Copper) ', '(d) Hindustan Copper Limited ']
solution: Sol.515.(d) Hindustan Copper L imited . It is a public sector undertaking under the Ministry of Mines. The company was incorporated on 9th November 1967, under the Companies Act, 1956. Headquarter - Kolkata. Important Copper Project of HCL - Malanjkhand Copper Project (Madhya Pradesh), Taloja Copper Project (Maharashtra), Gujarat Copper Project (Jhagadia, Gujarat).

question: Q.516. At which of the following places was the shipbuilding industry started in 1941? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.516.(b) Visakhapatnam. Hindustan Shipyard Limited (Visakhapatnam) : It was set up by Scindia Steam Navigation Company a nd the first ship was l aunched in 1948. It was taken over by the Government in 1952 and was renamed as Hindustan Shipyard Ltd. In 1962, the shipyard became a central public sector enterprise. Cochin Shipyard Limited (Kochi) - Incorporated in 1972 as a company fully owned by the Government.

question: Q.517. When was the cement industry in India totally decontrolled ? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.517.(a) 1989. The Indian cement industry is the largest cement producing country in the world, next only to China. The first cement company became operational in Porbandar, Gujarat with a capacity of 10,000 tons in 1914. The industry decelerated in 1991. Types of cement manufacturing process: Wet Process, Dry Process. Satna in Madhya Pradesh is known as the cement city of India.

question: Q.518. At which of the following places did the Indian Iron and Steel Company set up its first factory? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.518.(b) Hirapur (now Burnpur), West Bengal (Established in 1922). Indian Iron and Steel Company ( IISCO) - A steel plant that is a part of the Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL), Established in 1918 as an Indian Iron and Steel Company under the flagship of the Martin Burn group.

question: Q.519. Which company has b een given the responsibility of construction, operation and maintenance of the Hazira-Vijaipur- Jagdishpur (HVJ) pipeline project? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) ', '(b) Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) ', '(c) TATA Petrodyne Limited (TPL) ', '(d) Gas Authority of India (GAIL) ']
solution: Sol.519.(d) Gas Authority of India (GAIL) - It is a central public sector undertaking under the ownership of the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India. Founded - 1984. Headquarters - GAIL Bhawan (New Delhi). Subsidiaries - Indraprastha Gas Limited, Petronet LNG, Mahanagar Gas Limited.

question: Q.520. The Kolar region of Karnataka is famous for which mineral from the following ? SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.520.(b) Gold. Kolar - Golden City of India. It is popularly k nown a s the land of Silk, Milk, Mango, G old. O ther Gold mines - Hutti Gold Mines (karnataka), Kolar Gold Fields (karnataka), Lava G old Mines (Jharkhand), Sonbhadra Mine (Uttar pradesh), Parasi (Jharkhand), Dadam (Haryana).

question: Q.521. Which state in India has the highest number of aluminium smelting plants? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Odisha ', '(b) Tamil Nadu ', '(c) Maharashtra ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.521.(a) Odisha. Aluminum smelting plants - Korba, Alupuram, Renukoot, Mettur, Hirakud, Angul, Jharsuguda and Faridabad. Aluminium Companies in India - Hindustan Aluminium Company (Mumbai, Maharashtra), Vedanta Limited (Jharsuguda, Odisha), Sacheta Metals (Mumbai, Maharashtra).

question: Q.522. Which of the following regions of India has the maximum concentration of iron and steel industries? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Western Ghats ', '(b) Deccan Plateau ', '(c) Chhota Nagpur plateau ', '(d) Indo- Gangetic plains ']
solution: Sol.522.(c) Chhota Nagpur plateau in eastern India covers Jharkhand, Odisha, West Bengal, Bihar and Chhattisgarh. It is primarily composed of Archaeon rocks of granite and gneiss. Deccan Plateau - Triangular, surrounded by three mountain ranges. It extends over Indian states such as - Telangana, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu. Western Ghats - Covers six states: Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat. Indo Gangetic Plain - Located between the Peninsular Plateau and the Himalayas.

question: Q.523. Which of the following industries is its own major consumer in India? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Iron and steel ', '(b) Aviation ', '(c) Automobile ', '(d) Chemical ']
solution: Sol.523.(d) Chemical. India is the 6th largest producer of chemicals in the world and 3rd in Asia. Also the fourth-largest producer of a grochemicals after the United States, Japan and China. Second-largest manufacturer and exporter of dyes of the world's production after China. Iron and steel - India is the largest producer of sponge iron in the world and the 3rd largest finished steel consumer in the world after China & USA.

question: Q.524. Which city in India is known as the ‚ÄòDetroit of I ndia‚Äô due to its automobile industry? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.524.(a) Chennai - It is contributing more than 40% of the country's auto parts and vehicles. The World's major automotive giants that operate in Chennai are TVS, Ashok Leyland, Royal Enfield, TI Cycle, TAFE, Hyundai, Mitsubishi etc. The automotive industry in India is the third-largest by production in the world as per 2023 statistics.

question: Q.525. The Kudremukh Mines are located in which of the following states? SSC CHSL 04/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.525.(a) Karnataka. Kudremukh Mines is an iron ore mine located in the Bellary, Chitradurga, Chikkamagaluru, Tumkur belt. Other Iron ore mines : Chhattisgarh - Rowghat Mines, Bailadila. Odisha - Balda Block, Joda East, Gorumahisani, Jajang Rungta. Madhya Pradesh - Agaria Iron Ore mine.

question: Q.526. Bokajan is a cement plant located in which of the following states? SSC CHSL 14/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Bihar ', '(b) Assam ', '(c) Madhya Pradesh ', '(d) Andhra Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.526.(b) Assam. The first cement plant was set up in Chennai in 1904. Cement Corporation of India Limited (CCI) : It is the only cement manufacturing Public S ector Undertaking of Government of India. F ounded - 1965. Headquarters - New Delhi, India. Its units are spread throughout the country: East (Bokajan in Assam), West (Akaltara, Mandhar in Chhattisgarh and Nayagaon in Madhya Pradesh), North (Rajban in Himachal Pradesh and Charkhi Dadri in Haryana) and South (Kurkunta in Karnataka and Adilabad, Tandur in Telangana), with one cement grinding unit in Delhi.

question: Q.527. In which of the following regions in India are there high-grade iron ore deposits? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Western Rajasthan ', '(b) Southern Punjab ', '(c) Eastern Uttar Pradesh ', '(d) Northern Odisha ']
solution: Sol.527.(d) Northern Odisha. The iron ore m ines are located near the coal fi elds in the northeastern plateau region . Odisha, Jharkhand, Chhattisgarh, Karnataka, Goa, Telangana, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu account for approximately 95% of total iron ore reserves. Iron Ore and Percentage of i ron : Magnetite - 72 %, Hematite - 60-70 %, Limonite - 40 to 60%, Siderite - 48 %.

question: Q.528. Before the rise of the modern industrial system, Indian exports consisted chiefly of manufactures like__. SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) electricals ', '(b) chemicals ', '(c) light machinery ', '(d) cotton and silk fabrics ']
solution: Sol.528.(d) Cotton and silk fabrics. The first cotton mill was established by the Bombay Spinning and Weaving Company (1854). The first modern silk textile factory was started by the East India Company at Howrah in 1832.

question: Q.529. Which is the first integrated steel plant in the public sector in India? S SC CGL 19/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) The Visvesvaraya Iron and Steel Limited ', '(b) Rourkela Steel Plant ', '(c) The Salem Steel Plant ', '(d) Indian Iron and Steel Company ']
solution: Sol.529.(b) Rourkela Steel Plant (Odisha - 1959 ) . Established with the help of West German Industrial Corporations. Steel plants built in India during the Second Five Year Plan (FYP): Durgapur Steel Plant (West Bengal - Britain Cooperation), Bhilai Steel Plant (Chattisgarh - USSR Cooperation).

question: Q.530. Which is the oldest aluminium refinery plant in India? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) The Damanjodi Plant ', '(b) The Muri Alumina Plant ', '(c) The Mettur Plant ', '(d) The Belgaum Plant ']
solution: Sol.530.(b) The Muri Alumina Plant - Situated near Chota Muri a t Swarnarekha River in Ranchi (Jharkhand). It was commissioned in 1948. Its capacity is 450 Kilo tonne per annum (present). The Mettur Plant, Tamil Nadu. Damanjodi - Located in the Koraput district (Odisha), famous for discovery of bauxite mines and setting up of NALCO (National Aluminium Company Limited).

question: Q.531. The capacity of Visakhapatnam, one of the oil refinery of Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Ltd, is: Higher Secondary 28/06/2023 ( Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) 6.5 million metric tonnes per annum ', '(b) 9.69 million metric tonnes per annum ', '(c) 8.3 million metric tonnes per annum ', '(d) 5.5 million metric tonnes per annum ']
solution: Sol.531.(c) HPCL operates 2 major refineries producing a wide variety of petroleum fuels and specialties, one in Mumbai (West Coast) of 7.5 Million Metric Tonnes Per Annum (MMTPA) capacity a nd the other in Visakhapatnam, (East Coast) with a capacity of 8.3 MMTPA. The first refinery was set up a t Digboi (Assam) in 1901.

question: Q.532. Which of the following is NOT an example of a minor industrial region of India? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 4)
options: ['(a) Ambala-Amritsar region ', '(b) Durg-Raipur region ', '(c) Hugli region ', '(d) Northern Malabar region ']
solution: Sol.532.(c) Hugli region. Minor I ndustrial regions : Jaipur- Ajmer, Indore- Dewas- Ujjain, Saharanpur-Muzaffarnagar- Bijnor, Kolhapur- South Kannada, Middle Malabar, Adilabad - Nizamabad, Prayag- Varanasi- Mirzapur, Bhojpur- Munger, Bilaspur- Korba, Brahmaputra valley . Major Industrial Regions of India : Kolkata - Hugli, Mumbai - Pune Belt, Bengaluru - Tamil Nadu Belt, Kollam - Thiruvananthapuram Belt, Visakhapatnam - Guntur Belt, Chotanagpur Plateau Belt, Ahmedabad - Vadodara Belt, Gurugram - Delhi - Meerut Belt.

question: Q.533. Tata Iron and steel company (TISCO) began producing steel in ______. SSC MTS 16/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.533.(a) 1912. Tata Iron and Steel Company (TISCO) was founded by Jamsetji Tata in 1907, and its first steel ingot was manufactured on 16 February 1912. Headquarter - Mumbai, Maharashtra.

question: Q.534. The first cotton textile mill in Ahmedabad was started in which year? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.534.(b) 1861. The Ahmedabad Spinning and Weaving Company Ltd was the first textile mill established in Ahmedabad. The first cotton textile mill in India - Established at Fort Glastor near Kolkata in 1818.

question: Q.535. Which of the following cities of India was a coastal settlement where ships unloaded goods from distant lands between 2200 and 1900 years ago? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.535.(d) Arikamedu (Pondicherry). Karaikal and Yanam (town in Pondicherry).

question: Q.536. Where was the first Jute factory in India established ? SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Cuttack, Odisha ', '(b) Ongole, Andhra Pradesh ', '(c) Rishra, West Bengal ', '(d) Raigarh, Chhattisgarh ']
solution: Sol.536.(c) Rishra, West Bengal. India's first jute mill (Acland m ill) was established by British entrepreneur George Acland and Bengali financier Babu Bysumber Sen in 1855 in Rishra, Kolkata. Jute is also known as Golden fibre. India is the largest producer of j ute in the world followed by Bangladesh, China, Uzbekistan, and Nepal.Top jute producing states are West Bengal followed by Bihar, Assam, Andhra Pradesh and Odisha.

question: Q.537. Match the industrial plant with its location. Name of industrial Related Location Plant 1. BALCO (A) Burnpur 2. IISCO (B) Chennai 3. NFL (C) Korba 4. ICF (D) Bhatinda SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.537.(c) BALCO (Bharat Aluminium Company Limited, 1965) has two working units, one in Korba (Chattisgarh) and one in Bidhanbag (West Bengal). ICF (Integral Coach Factory, 1955) is located in Perambur, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India.

question: Q.538. In the beginning of the 19th century cotton mills in India were mostly located in which of the following states? SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.538.(c) Maharashtra. The first cotton mill in India was set up as a spinning mill in Bombay in 1854. By 1900, over 84 mills (mostly by Parsi and Gujarati businessmen) started operating there.

question: Q.539. Which of the following is NOT an example of major industrial regions of India? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Gujarat region ', '(b) Hugli region ', '(c) Chota Nagpur region ', '(d) Northern Malabar region ']
solution: Sol.539.(d) Northern Malabar region . Mumbai Pune cluster, Bangalore - Tamil Nadu region, Ahmedabad - Baroda region, Chota Nagpur industrial belt, Vishakhapatnam - Guntur belt, Gurgaon - Delhi - Meerut region, Kollam - Thiruvananthapuram industrial cluster are some other industrial regions.

question: Q.540. Which of the following pairs of industries ‚Äì location is correct? I. Iron and steel plant ‚Äì Bhilai II. Cotton textile ‚Äì Lucknow SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Only II ', '(b) Neither I nor II ', '(c) Only I ', '(d) Both I and II ']
solution: Sol.540.(d) Cotton Textiles Centers - Maharashtra (Mumbai), Gujarat (Ahmedabad), Uttar Pradesh (Lucknow, Etawah, Varanasi), etc.

question: Q.541. With respect to value addition in the textile industry, knitting is followed b y which procedure? SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Garment manufacture ', '(b) Spinning ', '(c) Fiber production ', '(d) Dyeing and finishing ']
solution: Sol.541.(d) Process involved in converting Fiber Filament to Garment in textile industries are Spinning - Knitting and weaving - Dyeing, Printing, and Finishing - Sewing and Cutting.

question: Q.542. Which of the following is dark reddish coloured stone used as raw material in aluminum smelting? SSC MTS 25/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.542.(c) Bauxite. Process of Manufacturing in Aluminium Industry: Bauxite, the raw material used in the smelters is a very bulky, dark reddish coloured rock (Alumina:- Cryolite).

question: Q.543. The Paithani saree weaving industry is in which state? SSC MTS 06/10/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.543.(c) Maharashtra . They are woven by hand. They are made from very fine mulberry silk.

question: Q.544. Imphal valley of Manipur is an important center of ______ craft. SSC MTS 07/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.544.(a) Kauna . Godna (Chattisgarh), Butta (Andhra Pradesh), and Miri Jims (Assam).

question: Q.545. Which is the second most important metallurgical industry in India? SSC MTS 07/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.545.(c) Aluminium (after the iron and steel industry). It is light, resistant to corrosion, a good conductor of heat, malleable, and becomes s trong when it is mixed with other metals. It is used to manufacture aircraft, utensils, and wires.

question: Q.546. In which o f t he following places is a steel plant under SAIL located? SSC CGL 13/08/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.546.(b) Bhilai . Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) is a government -owned steel producer based in New Delhi, India. SAIL operates and owns fi ve integrated steel plants at Bhilai, Rourkela, Durgapur, Bokaro, and Burnpur ( Asansol) and three special steel plants at Salem, Durgapur, and Bhadravathi. Biosphere Reserves

question: Q.547. Correctly match the following. Bio-reserve States 1. Assam a. Pachmarhi 2. Madhya Pradesh b. Nokrek 3. Odisha c. Manas 4. Meghalaya d. Similipa SSC CHSL Tier II 02/11/2023
solution: Sol.547.(a) 1-c, 2-a, 3-d, 4-b. There are 18 biosphere reserves in India. Some Biosphere reserves: Cold desert - Himachal Pradesh, Nanda devi - Uttarakhand, Khangchendzonga - Sikkim, Dehang-Debang - Arunachal Pradesh, Great Rann of K utch - Gujarat, Sundarban - West Bengal, Seshachalam - Andhra Pradesh, Gulf of Mannar - Tamil Nadu, Agasthyamalai - Kerala, P anna - Madhya Pradesh etc. The Rann of Kutch is the largest Biosphere Reserve in India.

question: Q.548. Match the following. i) Gir National Park a) Rhinos ii) Rajaji National b) Siberian cranes Park iii) Keoladeo c) Lions NationalPark iv) Kaziranga d) Elephants National Park SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) i-d, ii-b, iii-c, iv-a ', '(b) i-d, ii-c, iii-a, iv-b ', '(c) i-c, ii-d, iii-b, iv-a ', '(d) i-a, ii-b, iii-c, iv-d ']
solution: Sol.548.(c) i-c, ii-d, iii-b, iv-a. Jim Corbett National Park (Uttarakhand) - Tiger; Sundarban National Park (West Bengal) - Bengal tiger; Dudhwa National Park (Uttar Pradesh) - Swamp deer and Tiger; Silent Valley National Park (Kerala) - Lion Tailed Macaque; Orang National Park (Assam) - One Horned Rhinoceros and the Royal Bengal Tiger.

question: Q.549. Manas, Ranthambore, Kanha and Sunderbans are: SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) national parks ', '(b) gene banks ', '(c) zoos ', '(d) bird sanctuaries ']
solution: Sol.549.(a) National Parks in India: Kanha (Madhya Pradesh), Sunderban (West Bengal), Manas (Assam), Khangchendzonga (Sikkim), Dudhwa (Uttar Pradesh), Valmiki (Bihar), Silent Valley (Kerala).

question: Q.550. Match the wildlife sanctuaries in column A with their corresponding states in column B. Column A Column B (Wildlife (States) Sanctuaries) 1. Tansa a. Tamil Nadu 2. Guindy b. Maharashtra 3. Orchha c. Madhya Pradesh 4. Kaziranga d. Assam SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.550.(b) 1-b, 2-a, 3-c, 4-d. Wildlife Sanctuaries in India: Koundinya (Andhra Pradesh), Netravali (Goa), Indian Wild Ass Sanctuary (Gujarat), Bhindawas (Haryana), Bandli (Himachal Pradesh), Parasnath(Jharkhand), Adichunchanagiri (Karnataka), Bori (Madhya Pradesh), Kodaikanal (Tamil Nadu), Bankapura Peacock Sanctuary (Karnataka).

question: Q.551. Which of t he following is declared as a Wild Ass Sanctuary? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Ladakh ', '(b) Sunderbans ', '(c) Spiti Valley ', '(d) Rann of Kachchh ']
solution: Sol.551.(d) Rann of Kachchh (Gujarat). It is the only home to wild ass in India. The sanctuary was set up in 1972. Wildlife Sanctuaries in India : Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary (Rajasthan), Chilka Lake Bird Sanctuary (Odisha), Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary (Kerala), Govind Wildlife Sanctuary (Uttarakhand), Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary (Tamil Nadu), Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary (Kerala).

question: Q.552. Which biosphere was d eclared as India's 16 th Biosphere Reserve in 2009, noted for the conservation of Red Fox, Blue Rock Pigeon and Lammergeier ? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Cold Desert ', '(b) Seshachalam ', '(c) Agasthyamalai ', '(d) Dehang Debang ']
solution: Sol.552.(a) Cold Desert (Himachal Pradesh). It includes the Pin Valley National Park, Chandratal and Sarchu, Kibber Wildlife Sanctuary. Seshachalam Biosphere Reserve (Andhra Pradesh). Agasthyamala Biosphere Reserve (Tamil Nadu-Kerala). Dehang -Debang Biosphere Reserve (Arunachal Pradesh).

question: Q.553. Which of the following is the closest wild relative of domestic cattle protected in some of the famous national parks of India like Nagarhole and Bandipur? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Red angus ', '(b) Asiatic buffalo ', '(c) Nilgai ', '(d) Gaur ']
solution: Sol.553.(d) Gaur. First population estimation exercise of the Indian Gaur (Bison) was carried out in the Nilgiris Forest Division (Tamil Nadu). National Parks: Corbett (1936) - Uttarakhand. Kanha (1955) - Madhya P radesh. Tadoba (1955) - Maharashtra. Gir (1965) - Gujarat. Bandipur (1974) - Karnataka. Ranthambore (1980) - Rajasthan. Simlipal (1980) - Odisha.

question: Q.554. In which B iosphere Reserve is the largest endangered marine mammal Dugong and sea turtles also found? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Khangchendzonga Biosphere Reserve ', '(b) Seshachalam Biosphere Reserve ', '(c) Pachmarhi Biosphere Reserve ', '(d) Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve ']
solution: Sol.554.(d) Gulf of Mannar Biosphere Reserve (Tamil Nadu, India‚Äôs first marine biosphere reserve) . Biosphere Reserves- Seshachalam (Andhra Pradesh), Khangchendzonga (Sikkim), Pachmarhi (Madhya Pradesh).

question: Q.555. In which state is Gorumara National Park located? SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.555.(b) West Bengal. Gorumara National Park was established in 1994. It is primarily known for its population of Indian rhinoceros. Other National Parks : West Bengal - Jaldapara, Sunderban, Singalila, Neora. Assam - Kaziranga, Nameri, Manas. Uttarakhand - Jim Corbett, Rajaji, Gangotri. Bihar - Valmiki. Rajasthan - Ranthambore, Keoladeo. Madhya Pradesh - Kanha, Van Vihar, Satpura.

question: Q.556. How many b iosphere reserves are there in India? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.556.(b) Eighteen . Biosphere Reserve - An international designation by UNESCO for representative parts of natural and cultural landscapes extending over large areas of terrestrial or coastal/marine ecosystems or a combination of both. The Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve (1986) - First biosphere reserve in India. UNESCO Protected Biosphere Reserves List (12 out of 18) : First - Nilgiri Biosphere Reserve (2000) in Tamil Nadu, Latest - Panna Biosphere Reserve (2020) in Madhya Pradesh.

question: Q.557. In India, Gir forest is the last remaining habitat of which animal? SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Asiatic Lion ', '(b) Snow leopard ', '(c) Black Panther ', '(d) Asian Cheetah ']
solution: Sol.557.(a) Asiatic Lion. Animals and their Habitat Place : Snow Leopards Hemis National Park, Gangotri National Park, Khangchendzonga National park. Black Panther - Pench National Park, Bhadra Tiger Reserve. The Asiatic cheetah is a critically endangered cheetah subspecies currently only surviving in Iran.

question: Q.558. Jim Corbett National Park is in which state of India? SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Punjab ', '(b) Himachal Pradesh ', '(c) Uttarakhand ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.558.(c) Uttarakhand. Jim Corbett National Park was the first National Park of India established in 1936. Initially, it was known as Hailey National Park. Other States and their respective national parks : Himachal Pradesh - Great Himalayan, Pin Valley, Inderkilla. Uttar Pradesh - Dudhwa. Punjab is the only state which does not have any national park.

question: Q.559. Which among the following National Parks is not located in Maharashtra? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Gugamal National Park ', '(b) Tadoba National Park ', '(c) Navegaon National Park ', '(d) Bandhavgarh National Park ']
solution: Sol.559.(d) Bandhavgarh National Park (Madhya Pradesh) - It was declared a national park in 1968 and then became Tiger Reserve in 1993.

question: Q.560. The famous Nelapattu Bird Sanctuary is located in which of the following states? SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Tamil Nadu ', '(b) Andhra Pradesh ', '(c) Karnataka ', '(d) Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.560.(b) Andhra pradesh. Nelapattu Bird Sanctuary - It is an important breeding site for spot-billed pelicans (Pelecanus philippensis). Other bird sanctuaries in Andhra Pradesh - Kolleru, Uppalapadu, Telineelapuram and Telukunchi. Tamil Nadu - Karikili Birds Sanctuary, Chitrangudi. Karnataka - Ranganathittu, Attiveri. Madhya P radesh - Ghatigaon, Karera Bustard Sanctuary.

question: Q.561. Which country is the only country in the world to have both tigers and lions? SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.561.(c) India. The natural habitat of the Indian lion is the Gir f orest in Gujarat. Tigers are found i n the forests of M adhya Pradesh, the Sundarbans of W est Bengal. Number of Lions in India - 674. Number of Tigers in India - 3167 (As April 2023). The first tiger reserve in India was established in 1973 (Project Tiger).

question: Q.562. Dachigam National Park is located in which of the following states/UT ? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon
options: ['(a) Karnataka ', '(b) Gujarat ', '(c) Kerala ', '(d) Jammu and Kashmir ']
solution: Sol.562.(d) Jammu and Kashmir. Dachigam National Park : Established - 1981. The park is famous for Hangul deer or Kashmir Stag. National parks (statewise) : Jammu and Kashmir: City Forest (Salim Ali), Kazinag, Kishtwar. Gujarat: Gir - It is famous f or a siatic lions. Kerala: Anamudi Shola, Periyar. Karnataka: Bandipur, Bannerghatta, Kudremukh.

question: Q.563. Which of the following is not a biosphere reserve in India? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Cold Desert ', '(b) Gir Forest ', '(c) Sunderbans ', '(d) Nilgiri ']
solution: Sol.563.(b) Gir Forest (Gujarat). The biosphere reserve network w as l aunched in 1971 by UNESCO.

question: Q.564. The Eld's deer subspecies, which is classified as endangered in the IUCN Red List, is found only in the: SSC CHSL 26/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Hemis National Park in Ladakh ', '(b) Ranthambore National Park in Rajasthan ', '(c) Keibul Lamjao National Park in Manipur ', '(d) Pench National Park in Madhya Pradesh ']
answer: (c) Keibul Lamjao National Park in Manipur
solution: Sol.564.(c) Keibul Lamjao National Park in Manipur. IUCN Headquarter is at Gland, Switzerland. The 7 categories of the IUCN Red List are Data Deficient (DD), Least Concern (LC), Near Threatened (NT), Vulnerable (VU), Endangered (EN), Critically Endangered (CR), Extinct In The Wild (EW), Extinct (EX).

question: Q.565. The Buxa Tiger Reserve in West Bengal is threatened by the ongoing: SSC MTS 05/10/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) dolomite mining ', '(b) copper mining ', '(c) magnetite mining ', '(d) hematite mining ']
solution: Sol.565.(a) Dolomite mining. Deforestation and large-scale developmental projects are t he main reasons for the depletion of the Buxa Tiger Reserve.

question: Q.566. In which o f t he following states is the Srivilliputhur Elephant Reserve located? SSC MTS 20/10/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Karnataka ', '(b) Telangana ', '(c) Tamil Nadu ', '(d) Andhra Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.566.(c) Tamil Nadu. There are 33 Elephant Reserves in India. The very first elephant reserve or elephant sanctuary was the Singhbhum Elephant Reserve of Jharkhand.

question: Q.567. Baghmara Pitcher Plant S anctuary is located in which of the following states? SSC CGL 13/08/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.567.(a) Meghalaya (South Garo Hills District). The sanctuary is named after a rare insectivorous Pitcher Plant that is endemic to this region only.

question: Q.568. In which o f t he following states is the Rowa Wildlife Sanctuary situated? SSC CGL 13/08/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.568.(a) Tripura. It is a small wildlife sanctuary covering an area of 0.86 square kilometers (0.33 sq mi). It is a paradise for b otanists, environmentalists, and ecologists.

question: Q.569. Laokhowa Wildlife S anctuary lies on the southern bank of w hich r iver in the northeastern states of India ? SSC CHSL 13/04/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.569.(b) Brahmaputra. Laokhowa Wildlife Sanctuary is protected area located in the state of Assam. This wildlife sanctuary covers 70.13 km 2 , on the south bank of the Brahmaputra River in Nagaon district.

question: Q.570. In which of the following Indian states is the Barnawapara Wildlife Sanctuary located? SSC CHSL 15/04/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.570.(d) Chhattisgarh (Balodabazar district). It was e stablished in 1976 under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972. The Jonk River flows through the sanctuary, which is a tributary of the Mahanadi river.

question: Q.571. In which of the following states is Kali Tiger Reserve located ? SSC CHSL 16/04/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.571.(b) Karnataka. Kali Tiger Reserve is a protected area and tiger reserve in Uttara Kannada district, in Karnataka. The p ark is a habitat of Bengal tigers, black panthers, and Indian elephants, amongst other distinctive fauna. The Kali River flows through the whole tiger reserve.

question: Q.572. Peppara Wildlife Sanctuary is situated in which of the following states ? SSC CHSL 16/04/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.572.(d) Kerala . Other Wildlife Sanctuaries in Kerala : Eravikulam, Periyar, Shendurney, Chinnar, Parambikulam, Idukki, Wayanad, Thattekad.

question: Q.573. Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary is located in which of the following states? SSC CHSL 05/08/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.573.(a) Karnataka. The Dandeli wildlife sanctuary is the second largest sanctuary in Karnataka and is located on the banks of River Kali. Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary is a bird watcher's paradise, housing nearly 200 species of birds, most famous for the great hornbill and the Malabar pied hornbill.

question: Q.574. In which of the following states is the Bhadra Wildlife Sanctuary located? SSC CHSL 05/8/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.574.(b) Karnataka. Bhadra Wildlife Sanctuary is located in the midst of the Western Ghats in the Chikmagalur and Shimoga districts of K arnataka. The area was first declared as 'Jagara Valley Wildlife Sanctuary' in 1951 by the then government of Mysore. It was renamed Bhadra Wildlife Sanctuary in 1974.

question: Q.575. Where is the Sariska Tiger Reserve located ? SSC CHSL 12/8/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.575.(a) Rajasthan . Sariska Tiger Reserve - It stretches over an area of 800Km 2 comprising scrub-thorn arid forests, dry deciduous forests, grasslands, and rocky hills.

question: Q.576. The wetland of Ashtamudi is located in: SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.576.(c) Kerala (in Kollam District). It has a unique wetland ecosystem and a large palm shaped waterbody. Ashtamudi Wetland is included in the list of wetlands of international importance.

question: Q.577. Which sanctuary is famous for endangered Estuarine Crocodiles conservation in India? SSC CHSL 13/10/2020(Morning)
options: ['(a) Indira Gandhi Wildlife Sanctuary ', '(b) Bhitarkanika Wildlife Sanctuary, Odisha ', '(c) Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary, Kerala ', '(d) Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary, Karnataka ']
solution: Sol.577.(b) Bhitarkanika Wildlife Sanctuary (Odisha) is a Ramsar site and is one of India‚Äôs biggest estuarine crocodile habitats and a major coastal ecosystem.

question: Q.578. Which wildlife sanctuary is a tri-state protected area in northern India? It is also famous for the Critically Endangered gharial, the red-crowned roofed turtle and the Endangered Ganges river dolphin? SSC CHSL 20/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) National Chambal Sanctuary ', '(b) Chinnar Wildlife Sanctuary ', '(c) Dandeli Wildlife Sanctuary ', '(d) Bhadra Wildlife Sanctuary ']
solution: Sol.578.(a) National Chambal Sanctuary i s located on the Chambal River near the tri-point of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.

question: Q.579. In which district of Karnataka is the Brahmagiri Wildlife Sanctuary located? SSC CGL 03/3/2020 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.579.(d) Kodagu (Coorg). Brahmagiri Wildlife Sanctuary is situated on the border between Wayanad District of Kerala state on the south and Kodagu District in Karnataka on the north side.

question: Q.580. Which National Park among the following is the largest protected area in the Eastern Himalayan sub-region? SSC CGL 05/3/2020 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Keibul Lamjao National Park ', '(b) Namdapha National Park ', '(c) Jim Corbett National Park ', '(d) Bandipur National Park ']
solution: Sol.580.(b) Namdapha National Park (Arunachal Pradesh). It has more than 1,000 floral and about 1,400 faunal species. It is a biodiversity hotspot in the Eastern Himalayas.

question: Q.581. Which of the following is NOT located in Odisha? SSC CGL 05/03/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Mahanadi Elephant Reserve ', '(b) Mayurbhanj Elephant Reserve ', '(c) Sonitpur Elephant Reserve ', '(d) Sambalpur Elephant Reserve ']
solution: Sol.581.(c) The Kameng-Sonitpur Elephant Reserve (KSER) is located in the eastern hill forests of A runachal P radesh and Assam in India. Physiographic Division of India

question: Q.582. With reference to the physical features of India, the ‚ÄòKayals‚Äô are _________. SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.582.(b) Backwaters: The inland water bodies, often formed by the merging of rivers and lakes or by the backflow of seawater, creating a network of interconnected waterways. In Kerala, these backwaters are locally known as kayals. Hillocks: Small hills or mounds. Mountain Passes: These are routes through mountain ranges. Valleys: Low areas between hills or mountains.

question: Q.583. Which of the following is NOT a subdivision of the Meghalaya plateau? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.583.(d) Dhansiri. It is a river in the state of Assam and Nagaland. It originates from the Laisang peak of Nagaland. It is a tributary of B rahmaputra river. Meghalaya plateau is an extension of the Indian Peninsular plateau. The plateau slopes down to Brahmaputra valley in the north and the Surma and Meghna valleys in the south. Highest Peak of Meghalaya Plateau - Shillong Peak (6433 feet).

question: Q.584. Which of the following Indian states is NOT covered by the Deccan Plateau ? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Telangana ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) Andhra Pradesh ', '(d) Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.584.(d) Madhya Pradesh. Deccan Plateau - Shape - Triangular. Bounded by - Satpura and Vindhya Mountains (North), Western Ghats (West), Eastern ghats (East). States Cover - Telangana, Maharashtra, Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu and some parts of Madhya Pradesh and Chattisgarh. states covered by Malwa Plateau - Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan.

question: Q.585. Which of the following physical divisions of India is densely populated? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) The North Indian Plains ', '(b) The islands ', '(c) The Himalayan Range ', '(d) The Thar Desert ']
solution: Sol.585.(a) The North Indian Plains has been formed by the interplay of t he three major river systems, namely the Indus, the Ganga and the Brahmaputra along with their tributaries, which m akes its soil highly fertile. Alluvial soil is the major s oil found in the plains. The swampy belt of the plains is known as terai.

question: Q.586. Which of the following is true about the Indian Desert? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Bounded to the west by the Aravalli ', '(b) Lies to the southeast of the Aravali ', '(c) Lies to the northwest of the Aravali ', '(d) Bounded to the south by the Aravali ']
answer: (c) Lies to the northwest of the Aravali
solution: Sol.586.(c) Lies to the northwest of the Aravali. The Thar Desert is the biggest Indian Desert, is a large arid r egion in the northwestern part of the Indian subcontinent. The Indian subcontinent's Northern-Western area is home to the mountain range known as the Aravalli Range. Indian Desert - Ladakh and Spiti (Trans-Himalayan cold desert), The Rann of Kutch, The sandy Thar Desert.

question: Q.587. India accounts for what percent of the total geographical area of the world ? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.587.(d) 2.4 %. The land mass of India has an area of 3.28 million square km. India is the seventh largest country in the world. Largest countries in the world: Russia, Canada, China, United States, Brazil, Australia, etc.

question: Q.588. The Standard Meridian of India (82¬∞30‚ÄôE) passes through _____ state of India. SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Karnataka ', '(b) Madhya Pradesh ', '(c) West Bengal ', '(d) Punjab ']
solution: Sol.588.(b) Madhya Pradesh. The Standard Meridian - A longitude that determines a standard t ime for t he whole country. The standard m eridian of I ndia - It passes from Mirzapur (Uttar Pradesh). It passes through the following five states: Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Q.589. Which of the following Indian states is biggest in terms of area? SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Rajasthan ', '(b) Uttar Pradesh ', '(c) Madhya Pradesh ', '(d) Maharashtra ']
solution: Sol.589.(a) Rajasthan. Indian states biggest in terms of area: Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Gujarat. Smallest state (in terms of area) - Goa. Smallest Union Territories (in terms of area) - Lakshadweep, Daman and Diu, Chandigarh, Puducherry, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Delhi.

question: Q.590. India's total length of c oastline of the mainland including Andaman and Nicobar and Lakshadweep is ________ SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.590.(c) 7516.6 km. Length of Coastline of the Indian mainland - 6100 km. The Coast of the Indian mainland is surrounded by Arabian Sea in the west, Bay of Bengal in the east , and Indian Ocean in the south. India's coastline extends to Nine states (Gujarat, Maharashtra, Goa, Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, A ndhra P radesh, Odisha, and West Bengal) and four Union Territories (Puducherry, Lakshadweep, Daman and Diu, and Andaman and Nicobar Islands). Largest coastline - Gujarat (1214 km).

question: Q.591. The plains from Ambala to the Sunderban stretch over nearly 1800 km, but the fall in its slope is hardly ________ metres. SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.591.(b) 300 . In other words, there is a fall of just one meter for every 6 km. Therefore, the river develops large meanders. Ambala is located on the water divide between the Indus and the Ganga river systems.

question: Q.592. Which union Territory of I ndia lies in the Bay of Bengal? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu ', '(b) Chandigarh ', '(c) Lakshadweep Islands ', '(d) Andaman and Nicobar Islands ']
solution: Sol.592.(d) Andaman and Nicobar Islands are separated by the Ten Degree Channel. Capital - Port Blair (South Andaman), Highest Peak - Saddle Peak (732 m) (North Andaman). Tribes: Sentinelese, Shompen. Barren Island is the only active volcano in India. Duncan passage separates Little Andaman from South Andaman. Ross Island (South Andaman) has been renamed as Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Dweep, N eil Island as Shaheed Dweep, and Havelock Island as Swaraj Dweep.

question: Q.593. Where does the East Coast of I ndia lie? SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Between Eastern Ghats and the Bay of Bengal ', '(b) Between Maharashtra and Kerala ', '(c) Between Diu and Kerala ', '(d) Between Gulf of Cambay and Cape Comorin ']
answer: (a) Between Eastern Ghats and the Bay of Bengal
solution: Sol.593.(a) Eastern coastal plains - Passes through the three Indian states; Tamil Nadu, Andhra P radesh and Odisha. Konkan Coast - Covers the western coasts of Maharashtra and Goa. Northern Circars - Part of the eastern coast and lie in Odisha and Andhra Pradesh. Malabar coast - Coast of Karnataka, Kerala and Tamilnadu.

question: Q.594. When the river approaches sea it breaks up i nto a number of d istributaries, each distributary forms its own mouth. The collection of sediments from all the mouths forms_____ SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.594.(c) Delta . Meander is a pronounced curve or loop in the course of a river channel. Floodplains are an area of low-lying ground adjacent to a river, formed mainly by flooding of rivers and the deposition of s and sediments on the riverbanks.

question: Q.595. Which of the following regions has more seasonal contrast than other regions of India? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Interiors of India ', '(b) Coastal areas of India ', '(c) Hilly areas of India ', '(d) Islands of India ']
solution: Sol.595.(a) Interiors of India. Because they are far away from the sea or mountains. With variation in places and seasons, the temperature and precipitation changes. This variation is termed as seasonal contrast.

question: Q.596. Devka Beach, a beautiful expanse of black sand is located in______ SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.596.(b) Daman. Radhanagar Beach (Havelock Island, Andaman). Juhu Beach, Mumbai. Ramakrishna Beach (Andhra Pradesh), Candolim Beach (Goa). Marina beach (Chennai) is India's longest and the world's second longest beach. Puri Beach (Golden beach), Odisha.

question: Q.597. Which of t he following factors are responsible for railways having not developed much in the north-eastern parts of India? (1) Highly dissected topography (2) Dense forests (3) Low population density (4) Heavy rainfall and frequent flooding SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) 1, 2 and 3 ', '(b) Only 3 and 4 ', '(c) Only 2 and 3 ', '(d) 1, 2 and 4 ']
solution: Sol.597.(d) 1,2 and 4. 7 Sister States of India - Nagaland (Kohima), Manipur (Imphal), Meghalaya (Shillong), Tripura (Agartala), Arunachal Pradesh (Itanagar), Assam (Dispur), and Mizoram (Aizawl). Kangchenjunga (8586 m), the third highest mountain in the world, is spread between India and Nepal.

question: Q.598. Which of the following is a mountain pass in the Pir Panjal range at a maximum altitude of 2832 meters that connects the Kashmir Valley in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir with the Outer Himalayas and the plains in the south? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Mana Pass ', '(b) Banihal Pass ', '(c) Bara-Lacha Pass ', '(d) ZojiLa Pass ']
solution: Sol.598.(b) Banihal pass (Jammu and Kashmir) is situated in the Pir- Panjal Range. It connects Banihal with Qazigund. Mana Pass (Uttarakhand) is located in the Greater Himalayas and connects Tibet with Uttarakhand. Bara lacha pass - connects Himachal Pradesh's Lahaul area with Ladakh. Zojila Pass connects Leh and Srinagar.

question: Q.599. Why do people living on the Konkan coast NOT encounter extremes of temperature and seasonal rhythm? SSC CHSL 30/05/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Undulating landform ', '(b) Location on leeward side of Sahyadri ', '(c) Coastal location ', '(d) Monsoon climate ']
solution: Sol.599.(c) Coastal location. The range of temperature increases as it moves away from coastal areas to interior parts of the country. Coastal Plains in India - Eastern Coastal Plains of India - Utkal Coast, Andhra Coast, Coromandel Coast. Western Coastal Plain - Kachchh and Kathiawar coast, Konkan coast, Kanara coast, Malabar coast.

question: Q.600. With reference to the major regions of the northern plains, Bhabar is: SSC CHSL 09/06/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) the older alluvium along the river beds forming terraces higher than the floodplain ', '(b) a narrow belt of about 8 to 16 km that runs in the west-east direction along the foot of the Himalayas from the river Indus to Teesta ', '(c) composed of newer alluvium and forms flood plains along the river banks ', '(d) a broad long zone of northern India and southern Nepal running parallel to the lower ranges of the Himalayas ']
answer: (b) a narrow belt of about 8 to 16 km that runs in the west-east direction along the foot of the Himalayas from the river Indus to Teesta
solution: Sol.600.(b) Bhabar is a narrow belt lying parallel to the slopes of the Shiwaliks in Uttarakhand. It is narrow in the east and wide in the western and northwestern hilly regions. It comprises gravel and un-assorted sediment deposits. Crop cultivation is not possible in this tract, only giant trees with deep roots grow.

question: Q.601. In which of the following regions of India is the natural habitat of White-bellied Heron largely distributed? SSC MTS 05/10/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) North-east ', '(b) Northern plains ', '(c) Deccan plateau ', '(d) Western coast ']
solution: Sol.601.(a) North-east. Northeast India is the easternmost region of India representing both a geographic and political administrative division of the country. It comprises eight states ‚Äì Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Tripura, and Sikkim.

question: Q.602. Which of the following statements is NOT true about plateaus? SSC MTS 11/10/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) The Deccan plateau is one of the oldest plateaus in India. ', '(b) A plateau is an elevated flat land. ', '(c) Plateaus are rich in mineral deposits. ', '(d) The Marwar plateau is the highest plateau in the world. ']
answer: (d) The Marwar plateau is the highest plateau in the world.
solution: Sol.602.(d) Marwar is a sandy plain lying northwest of the Aravalli Range, which runs southwest-northeast through Rajasthan state. The Qinghai-Tibetan plateau is the highest and largest plateau in the world.

question: Q.603. Which of the following locations has the highest altitude? SSC CGL 16/08/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.603.(c) Ranikhet . It is a famous hill station in Uttarakhand at an altitude of 1,869 meters (6,132 ft) above sea level and within sight of the western peaks of the Himalayas.

question: Q.604. Deserts, rain,forests, coral reefs, and mangroves are features of ______ diversity. SSC CGL 16/08/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.604.(d) Ecological. Ecological diversity includes species diversity, genetic diversity, and ecosystem diversity. They are collectively considered biodiversity . It is the sum of all kinds of animals and plants living on this earth along with their habitat.

question: Q.605. Which of the following is a district-cum-tourism hotspot of Arunachal Pradesh? SSC CGL 18/08/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.605.(d) Tawang. Kalimpong, Alipurduar, and Jalpaiguri are the districts in West Bengal.

question: Q.606. The archaeological site of Atranjikhera is located in ______. SSC CGL 18/08/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Himachal Pradesh ', '(b) Uttarakhand ', '(c) Uttar Pradesh ', '(d) Maharashtra ']
solution: Sol.606.(c) Uttar Pradesh. This site was first identified by Sir Alexander Cunningham in 1862 but excavated by R C Gaur in 1962.

question: Q.607. Nathu La Pass connects India with which of its neighbouring countries? SSC CGL 20/08/2021(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.607.(d) China . It is a mountain pass in the Himalayas between the Indian state of Sikkim and China's Tibet Autonomous Region, Yadong County.

question: Q.608. Which natural port is located along the west coast of India? SSC CHSL 9/8/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.608.(d) Marmagao (Goa). Major Ports on West Coast of India : Kandla Port (Gujarat), Mumbai (Maharashtra), Navasheva (Jawaharlal Nehru Port, Mumbai), New Mangalore (Karnataka), Kochi (Kerala)

question: Q.609. In the state of ______, the general direction of the Himalayas is from southwest to northeast. SSC CHSL 11/8/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.609.(d) Arunachal Pradesh. Himalayas in the Darjeeling and Sikkim regions lie in an east-west direction.

question: Q.610. Which of the following mountain is situated in the state of Uttarakhand? SSC CHSL 11/8/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Nathu La Pass ', '(b) Baralacha La Pass ', '(c) Bomdi La Pass ', '(d) Mangsha Dhura Pass ']
solution: Sol.610.(d) Mangsha Dhura Pass. Other passes in Uttarakhand :- Kalindi Pass, Lipulekh Pass, Mana Pass, Auden's Col, Muling La, Nama Pass, Niti Pass, Traill's Pass.

question: Q.611. W hich among the following states does NOT share its border with Odisha? SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.611.(c) B ihar. Odisha is surrounded by 4 states: Andhra Pradesh from the south, Chhattisgarh from the west and Jharkhand and West Bengal from the north.

question: Q.612. River Sutlej enters India through which pass? SSC CHSL 16/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Shipki la ', '(b) Lipulekh ', '(c) Zoji la ', '(d) Nathula ']
solution: Sol.612.(a) Shipki La - From here, Satluj traverses through many Himalayan valleys before it merges with Chenab in Pakistan before landing into Indus.

question: Q.613. Which among the following is a western coast island? SSC CHSL 26/10/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.613.(b) Elephanta island is located in Mumbai Harbour of the Arabian Sea. Pamban (between peninsular India and Sri Lanka), Parikud (Odisha), and Sriharikota (Andhra Pradesh).

question: Q.614. Which of the following states does NOT share its boundary with Madhya Pradesh? SSC CGL 07/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.614.(b) Odisha. Madhya Pradesh shares its border with 5 states namely Uttar Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Maharashtra, Gujarat and Rajasthan. Transportation

question: Q.615. Match the following details regarding Phase-I of Bharatmala Project. Scheme Targeted Length (in km) A. Economic corridors 1. 9000 B. Border and 2. 2000 international connectivity roads C. Expressways 3. 800 D. Inter-corridors and 4. 6000 feeder roads SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023
solution: Sol.615.(c) A-1, B-2, C -3, D-4. Phase-I of Bharatmala Pariyojana also includes development of : National Corridor Efficiency improvement - 5000 km, Coastal & port connectivity roads - 2000 km. It includes the development of a subtotal of 24,800 km. In addition, it also includes 10,000 kms of balanced road works under NHDP.

question: Q.616. In which of the following years was the air transport in India launched? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.616.(d) 1911. Air Transportation: Air transport in India was launched between Allahabad and Naini (10 km). George Light started Air Transport in India. The first airmail flight was piloted by French pilot Henri Pequet. Air transport was nationalised and two Corporations, Air India International and Indian Airlines were formed in 1953.

question: Q.617. Atal Tunnel connects which two places? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Manali and Lahaul-Spiti valley ', '(b) Shimla and Nainital ', '(c) Manali and Nainital ', '(d) Shimla and Mansoori ']
solution: Sol.617.(a) Manali and Lahaul-Spiti valley. Atal tunnel built under the Rohtang Pass in the eastern Pir Panjal range of the Himalayas on the Leh -Manali Highway in Himachal Pradesh, India. It is 9.02 km long. It is the world's longest highway single tube tunnel above 10,000 feet. Built by: Border Roads Organisation (BRO). Other Tunnels (India): Trivandrum Port Railway Tunnel (Kerala), Banihal Qazigund Road Tunnel (Jammu and Kashmir), and Karbude Railway Tunnel (Maharashtra). India‚Äôs longest electrified tunnel (6.6 km) constructed between Cherlopalli and Rapuru railway stations.

question: Q.618. In India, which of the following modes of transportation reduces trans-shipment losses and delays in supply of petroleum and gas? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.618.(c) Pipelines are cost-effective and can transport large volumes of liquids or gasses over long distances with minimal environmental impact. Advantages - Dedicated Infrastructure, Minimized Handling, Continuous Flow, Cost-Effective, Environmental Benefits, Energy Efficiency, Reduces Congestion. Naharkatia-Noonmati -Barauni Pipeline is the first crude oil pipeline constructed i n India. Jamnagar-Loni LPG Pipeline is India's Longest pipeline.

question: Q.619. Which of the following is NOT a part of the six communication mail channels in India? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Metro channel ', '(b) Monthly channel ', '(c) Rajdhani channel ', '(d) Business channel ']
solution: Sol.619.(b) Monthly Channel. The six communication mail channels i n India: Rajdhani (Yellow colored mailboxes are installed at post offices), Metro (Blue colored mailboxes are installed at post offices), Green (Green colored mailboxes are installed at post offices in large and metropolitan cities), Business (Physical mail that is commercial in nature), Periodical (Intended for newspapers, magazines, and other periodical publications) and Bulk (Consists of letters, newsletters, leaflets, and other similar products).

question: Q.620. The North-South corridor, which i s a part of the Golden Quadrilateral super highways, links which two cities of India from the following? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Delhi and Chennai ', '(b) Leh and Chennai ', '(c) Jammu and Kanyakumari ', '(d) Srinagar and Kanyakumari ']
solution: Sol.620.(d) Srinagar and Kanyakumari. Golden Quadrilateral (5,846 km) is a network of highways connecting India's four top metropolitan cities: Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai and Kolkata. The East-West corridor links Silchar (Assam) and Porbandar (Gujarat).

question: Q.621. What is the total route length of the Indian Railways (as of March 2020) ? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.621.(a) 67,956 km. Lord Dalhousie (Governor-General of India from 1848 to 1856 ) - The ‚ÄòFather of Indian Railways‚Äô . On 16 April 1853, the first passenger train ran between Bori Bunder (Bombay) and Thane, a distance of 34 km. The recommendation of the Acworth Committee separated the Railway budget from the General budget in 1924 and merger took place on 21 September 2016. Indian Railways is the fourth-largest national railway network i n the world.

question: Q.622. Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of National Highways in India? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Meant for inter-state transport ', '(b) Connect state capitals and major cities ', '(c) Construction of border roads in high altitude areas ', '(d) Maintained by the Central Government ']
answer: (c) Construction of border roads in high altitude areas
solution: Sol.622.(c) Border Roads Organisation (BRO): Functions under the control of t he Ministry of Defence . Formation - 1960. Headquarters - Seema Sadak Bhawan (New Delhi). National Highways Authority of India - Formed under the NHAI (National Highways Authority of India Act) in 1988. Headquarters - New Delhi. It operates under the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

question: Q.623. New Delhi is the headquarters of which railway zone? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Southern railway zone ', '(b) Eastern railway zone ', '(c) Central railway zone ', '(d) Northern railway zone ']
solution: Sol.623.(d) Northern railway zone. By 2023 - The Indian Railway System has 19 Zones (including Metro Railway, Kolkata). Railway zones and Headquarters : Central Railway (Mumbai), North Central Railway (Prayagraj), North Eastern Railway (Gorakhpur), North Western Railway (Jaipur), Eastern Railway (Kolkata), East Central Railway (Hajipur), East Coast Railway (Bhubaneswar), Southern Railway (Chennai), South Central Railway (Secunderabad).

question: Q.624. Which project aims to develop state roads along coastal border areas, including connectivity of non-major ports? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Golden Quadrilateral ', '(b) Setubharatam Pariyojana ', '(c) District Headquarters Connectivity Scheme ', '(d) Bharatmala ']
solution: Sol.624.(d) Bharatmala. This centrally funded project is an ecosystem of road development which includes development of tunnels, bridges, elevated corridors, flyovers, overpasses, interchanges, bypasses, ring roads etc. Golden Quadrilateral - Highway network which links 4 largest metropolises: Delhi (north), Kolkata (East), Mumbai (west), and Chennai (south). Setu Bharatam - To make all National Highways free of railway level crossings.

question: Q.625. Which two cities of India are connected by the Grand Trunk Road ? SSC CHSL 10/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.625.(a) Amritsar-Kolkata. Grand Trunk Road (built by Sher Shah Suri) - One of the oldest road routes in India. Length - 2400 km. It links Central Asia to the Indian Subcontinent. Route was called Uttarapatha. NH-44 - India‚Äôs longest highway. NH-548 - India‚Äôs shortest highways.

question: Q.626. Which waterway provides connectivity with mainland India through the India - Bangladesh Protocol route? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.626.(c) NW - 2 (891 Km) Between Sadiya and Dhubri on river Brahmaputra. Pandu port (Assam) is the largest river port in Assam. NW - 1 ( 1620 km): G anga - Bhagirathi - Hooghly River (Allahabad - Haldia). It is the Longest and oldest National Waterways in India. NW-10 : Amba River . NW-69 : It is the smallest waterway (5 km).

question: Q.627. Asansol, Howrah, Malda and Sealdah division come under which railway zone of India? SSC CGL 18/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) West Central Railway ', '(b) Northern Railway ', '(c) Central Railway ', '(d) Eastern Railway ']
solution: Sol.627.(d) Eastern Railway. F ormed on - 14 April 1952 by amalgamating three lower divisions of the East Indian Railway: Howrah, Asansol and Danapur, the entire Bengal Nagpur Railway (BNR) and the Sealdah division of the erstwhile Bengal Assam Railway. Headquarters - Kolkata. Kalka Mail of Eastern Railway is the oldest running train in the history of Indian Railways.

question: Q.628. Which autonomous body was operationalised under the Ministry of Surface Transport in 1995 ? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Border Roads Organization (BRO) ', '(b) Centre for Railway Information System (CRIS) ', '(c) Inland Waterways Authority of India (IWAI) ', '(d) National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) ']
solution: Sol.628.(d) National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) - Operationalised in 1995 and established under the National Highways Authority of India Act, 1988. Headquarters - New Delhi. Other organizations:- Border Roads Organization (BRO) - Formed, 7 May 1960. Headquarters - New Delhi. Center for Railway Information System (CRIS) - Founded, July 1986. Headquarters - New Delhi. Inland Waterways Authority of India (IWAI) - Founded, 27 October 1986 and headquartered - Noida (Uttar Pradesh).

question: Q.629. Which of the following is the only rack railway in India that was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 2005? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Nilgiri Mountain Railway ', '(b) Kangra Valley Railway ', '(c) Matheran Hill Railway ', '(d) Kalka‚ÄìShimla Railway ']
solution: Sol.629.(a) Nilgiri Mountain Railway. Darjeeling Himalayan Railway (In UNESCO list in 1999), Kalka Shimla Railway (2008) and Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, Mumbai (2004). India is currently home to 42 UNESCO World Heritage Sites (6 th in the world) - Cultural (34), Natural (7), and Mixed (1 - Khangchendzonga National Park, Sikkim) .

question: Q.630. Select the natural port of India from the following. Higher Secondary 27/06/2023 ( Shift - 3)
options: ['(a) Mumbai Port ', '(b) Chennai Port ', '(c) Deendayal Port ', '(d) Kolkata Port ']
solution: Sol.630.(a) Mumbai Port - India‚Äôs largest natural port. Chennai Port (Madras Port) - It is a man-made, all-weather harbor with wet docks, the largest port in the Bay of Bengal. Deendayal Port (Kandla Port) - Largest port of I ndia by volume of cargo handled. Kolkata Port (Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port) - Oldest operating port in India, built by East India Company.

question: Q.631. Which of the following National Waterways is located in Tamil Nadu? Matric Level 28/06/2023 (Shift - 1)
