options: ['(a) National Waterway-97 ', '(b) National Waterway-93 ', '(c) National Waterway-98 ', '(d) National Waterway-99 ']
solution: Sol.631.(d) National Waterway (NW) - 99. NW - 1 (Ganga - Bhagirathi - Hooghly): The longest waterways in India (Prayagraj to Haldia) - Uttar Pradesh, Bihar, Jharkhand & West Bengal. NW - 2 (Brahmaputra River) - Assam. NW - 3 (West Coast Canal and Champakara and Udyogamandal Canals) - Kerala. NW - 98 (Sutlej River) - Punjab and Himachal Pradesh. NW - 10 (Amba River) - Maharashtra. NW - 93 (Simsang River) - Meghalaya. NW - 83 (Rajpuri Creek) - Maharashtra. NW - 111 (Zuari River) - Goa. NW - 73 (Narmada River) - Gujarat and Maharashtra. NW - 97 (Sundarbans Waterways) - West Bengal.

question: Q.632. In India, roads are classified in the _____ classes according to their capacity. SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.632.(d) Six. Classification of R oads : Expressways, National highways, State highways, District roads, Rural roads, and Border roads or Project roads . NH-44 is the longest national highway in India with a length of 3 745 Kilometers running from Srinagar in the north to Kanyakumari in the south.

question: Q.633. ______ is the deepest landlocked and well - protected port. SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.633.(c) Visakhapatnam - It is a major port (total 13 in India) located in Andhra Pradesh coast of Bay of Bengal. It is a natural harbor. The major c ommodities i n this port include Iron ore, manganese ore, steel products, general cargo, coal and crude oil.

question: Q.634. The Vadhavan Port is located in _____. SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Kerala ', '(b) Tamil Nadu ', '(c) West Bengal ', '(d) Maharashtra ']
solution: Sol.634.(d) Maharashtra. It will be India's 13th port. Other ports of india: Largest Port - Mumbai Port. Deepest Sea Port - Gangavaram Port (Andhra Pradesh). Largest Artificial Port - Jawaharlal Nehru Port.

question: Q.635. Where is the Jawahar Lal Nehru Port located? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.635.(d) Navi Mumbai. The Jawaharlal Nehru Port (Nhava Sheva Port) (opened in 1989) is the largest container port in India. Other famous ports: Mundra (Kutch, Gujarat), Chennai (Tamil Nadu), Syama Prasad Mukherjee Port (Kolkata, West Bengal), Chidambaranar (Tuticorin, Tamil Nadu), Deendayal Port (Kandla, Gujarat), Visakhapatnam (Andhra Pradesh), Cochin (Kochi, Kerala), Hazira (Gujarat), Paradip (Odisha).

question: Q.636. Which among the following is India's first corporatised port? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.636.(d) Ennore (Kamarajar port). Located - Coromandel Coast, Tamil Nadu. The Kochi International Container Transshipment Terminal ( ICTT ) , locally known as the Vallarpadam Terminal , is the first transshipment terminal in India and the first container terminal to operate in a SEZ (Special Economic Zone).

question: Q.637. In Trans-Siberian railway system Vladivostoclies on_________coast. SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.637.(d) Pacific. The Trans-Siberian Railway is the longest railway system connecting St. Petersburg in Western Russia to Vladivostok on the Pacific coast.

question: Q.638. Through which of the following states does the National Waterway-96 pass? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Assam ', '(b) Uttar Pradesh ', '(c) Odisha ', '(d) Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.638.(c) Odisha. National Waterway - 96 passes through the states of Jharkhand, Orissa, and West Bengal.

question: Q.639. Recently, some mail channels have been introduced to facilitate quick delivery of mail in large towns and cities in India. Which of the following is NOT a part of these mail channels? SSC CHSL 24/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) State Channel ', '(b) Rajdhani Channel ', '(c) Metro Channel ', '(d) Green Channel ']
solution: Sol.639.(a) State channels refer to the process in which users transact with one another directly outside of the blockchain, or 'off-chain,' and greatly minimize their use of 'on-chain' operations.

question: Q.640. On the basis of the track width of Indian Railways, what type of gauge is Matheran Hill Railways? SSC CHSL 26/05/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Narrow gauge ', '(b) Medium gauge ', '(c) Broad gauge ', '(d) Standard gauge ']
solution: Sol.640.(a) Narrow gauge. There are mainly four types of railway gauge used in India: Broad Gauge- wide gauge or large line - 5 ft 6 inches (1676 mm). 1 Standard gauge (Delhi Metro)- 4 ft 8 2 3 inches (1435 mm). Meter Gauge- 3 ft 3 8 inches or 1,000 mm. Narrow Gauge (Small Line)- 2 ft 6 in (762 mm).

question: Q.641. The ancient port, Sopara is located in which of t he following states ? SSC MTS 22/10/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.641.(a) Maharashtra. The ancient port, Sopara (capital of the ancient Aparanta) - In ancient times, it was the largest township on India's west coast, trading with Mesopotamia, Egypt, Cochin, Arabia and Eastern Africa.

question: Q.642. Which pair of cities does the Yamuna Expressway connect to? SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Agra ‚Äì Panipat ', '(b) Greater Noida ‚Äì Agra ', '(c) Delhi ‚Äì Jaipur ', '(d) Lucknow ‚Äì Allahabad ']
solution: Sol.642.(b) Greater Noida ‚Äì Agra. The Yamuna Expressway starts from Pari Chowk in Greater Noida and ends at Kuberpur, Agra on NH-2 towards Kanpur.

question: Q.643. National Highway No. 7 connects: SSC CHSL 11/8/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Fazilka to Mana ', '(b) Kashmir to Kanyakumari ', '(c) Varanasi to Kanyakumari ', '(d) Kanpur to Silchar ']
solution: Sol.643.(a) Fazilka to Mana. Fazilka (Punjab) - Rishikesh - Badrinath - Mana (Uttarakhand).

question: Q.644. Which of the following ancient ports was situated on the Malabar Coast? SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.644.(b) Muziris Port. It became popular when Babylonians, Assyrians, and Egyptians came to the Malabar Coast in search of spices in 3000 BC.

question: Q.645. What is the approximate length of the navigable inland waterways of India? S SC CHSL 17/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.645.(a) 14,500 km. To promote Inland Water Transport (IWT) in the country, 111 waterways (including 5 existing and 106 new) have been declared as National Waterways (NWs) under the National Waterways Act, 2016 which came into effect from 12th April, 2016.

question: Q.646. What was National Highway 66 (NH 66) previously known as? SSC CGL 06/03/2020(Evening)
solution: Sol.646.(d) NH 17. It connects Panvel in Maharashtra to Kanyakumari in Tamil Nadu state. Population

question: Q.647. According to the Census of India-2011, which of the following options represents a group of the most urbanized union territories in India? SSC CHSL Tier II 10/01/2024
options: ['(a) Chandigarh and Lakshadweep ', '(b) Delhi and Chandigarh ', '(c) Puducherry and Delhi ', '(d) Lakshadweep and Puducherry ']
solution: Sol.647.(b) Delhi and Chandigarh. As p er Census 2011, the most urbanized state - Goa. Highest sex ratio: Kerala (States) and Puducherry (Union Territory). Highest Literacy rate : Kerala (States) and Lakshadweep (UT). Highest Population : Uttar Pradesh (States) and Delhi (UT). The decennial Census is conducted under the Census Act (1948), by the Office of t he Registrar General and Census Commissioner, Ministry of H ome Affairs. question: Q.665. The ___________ birth rate indicates the number of live births occurring during the year per 1000 population estimated at midyear. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.665.(d) crude. Birth rate is the total number of live births in a particular area (an entire country, a state, a district or other territorial unit) during a specified period (usually a year) divided by the total population of that area in thousands. Death rate is expressed as the number of deaths in a given area during a given time per 1000 population. Rate of natural increase refers to the difference between the birth rate and the death rate.

The first Census of India - 1872 (under t he rule o f Lord Mayo). The First Official Census in India (First synchronized census) - 1881 (under Lord Rippon).

question: Q.701. The sex ratio in various states and Union Territories is very important to get information about women in the country. Given below are statistics as per Census of India 2011. Match the following and identify the correct option. States/UT Females per 1000 males 1. Kerala a. 1037 2. Puducherry b. 1084 3. Delhi c. 879 4. Haryana d. 868 SSC CGL 21/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.701.(b) 1-b, 2-a, 3-d, 4-c. Sex ratio is defined as the number of females per 1000 males in a given population. Sex Ratio according to the 2011 census of the country - 943 females per 1000. Top five states/ U.T. - Kerala (1084), Puducherry ( 1037), Tamil Nadu (996) and Andhra Pradesh (993), Chhattisgarh (991).

question: Q.702. Which of the following periods is known as the period of population explosion in India? SSC CGL 24/07/2023( 4th shift)
solution: Sol.702.(d) 1951-1981 . During this period the population of India grew rapidly from 361 million (1951) to 683 million (1981). The average annual growth rate of this period was 2.14 percent.

question: Q.703. Which year census is the 15 th National census survey conducted by the Census Organization of India? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift)
solution: Sol.703.(d) 2011. Census - Conducted b y the Office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner, Ministry of H ome Affairs after every 10 years. Q.704 . Identify the option that arranges the following states' literacy rates in descending order, according to Census 2011. A. Kerala B. Himachal Pradesh C. Haryana SSC CGL 26/07/2023 (2nd shift) (a) (A), (C), (B) (b) (B), (A), (C) (c) (C), (B), (A) (d) (A), (B), (C) Sol.704.(d) (A), (B), (C).

question: Q.705. Which union territory has the highest sex ratio value according to the 2011 census? Higher Secondary 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) Daman and Diu ', '(b) Andaman and Nicobar Islands ', '(c) Puducherry ', '(d) Delhi ']
solution: Sol.705.(c) Puducherry.

question: Q.706. As per the 2011 census, what is the sex ratio of Daman & Diu? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)
solution: Sol.706.(d) 618 . Daman and Diu have the lowest Sex ratio from Union Territory (UT).

question: Q.707. Which of the following statements is INCORRECT about migration in India? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 3)
options: ['(a) Migration may be rural to urban. ', '(b) Migration does not depend on social factors. ', '(c) Migration has pull and push factors. ', '(d) It may be urban to rural areas. ']
answer: (b) Migration does not depend on social factors.
solution: Sol.707.(b) Migration - Any person who is moving or has moved across an international border or within a state away from his/her habitual place of residence. Types of Migration : Temporary, Permanent and Voluntary. Causes of Migrations: Push Factor - people away from their home and include things like war; and Pull Factors - people t o a new home and include things like better opportunities.

question: Q.708. What does the Lincoln index measure? Matric Level 30/06/2023 (Shift - 4)
options: ['(a) Population Size ', '(b) Population Natality Rate ', '(c) Population Mortality Rate ', '(d) Population Density ']
solution: Sol.708.(a) Population Size. Lincoln index described by Frederick Charles Lincoln (in 1930). Population Natality Rate - The number of births per unit of time in a population, often expressed as births per 1,000 individuals per year. Population Mortality Rate - The number of deaths per u nit of t ime in a population, often expressed as deaths per 1,000 individuals per year.

question: Q.709. The population of a nation in the working age group is generally grouped between _________. SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.709.(c) 15-59 years. The 2011 Census has divided the working population of India into four major categories: Cultivators, Agricultural Labourers, Household Industrial Workers, Other Workers. The NYP (National youth Policy) ‚Äì 2014 has defined ‚Äòyouth‚Äô as persons in the age group of 15‚Äì29 years.

question: Q.710. According to census 2011, which Union territory had the highest decadal population growth rate between 2001 - 11? SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) NCT of Delhi ', '(b) Lakshadweep ', '(c) Dadra & Nagar Haveli ', '(d) Chandigarh ']
solution: Sol.710.(c) Dadra & Nagar Haveli. Decadal growth rate of Union territory (2001-2011): Chandigarh (17.2), Lakshadweep (6.3), NCT of Delhi (21.2). Census 2011: Highest population density - Bihar (1106 per sq km) , Lowest population density - Arunachal Pradesh (17 per s q . km), Union territory with least population - Lakshadweep.

question: Q.711. In which o f t he following decades, there was a negative growth rate in the Indian population? SSC MTS 04/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.711.(a) 1911-1921. Decadal Growth Rates in India: Census year (% of Growth) - 1911 (+ 5.75), 1921 (- 0.31). Percentage growth in 2001-2011 is 17.64%; males 17.19% and females 18.12%.

question: Q.712. According to census 2011, which is the second largest religious minority of India? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.712.(a) Christians. As per Census 2011 - Total Population in 2011 was 121.09 crores.

question: Q.713. According to census 2011, which of the following is NOT included in the top ten most populous countries? SSC MTS 09/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.713.(d) Canada (Population - 36,991,981 as of Canada census 2021, Capital - Ottawa, Currency - Canadian Dollar).

question: Q.714. According to census 2011, which state has the highest decadal population growth rate between 2001-11? SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.714.(d) Meghalaya (27.9%). States with the highest decadal growth rate - Arunachal P radesh (26%), Bihar (25.40%), Jammu Kashmir (23.60%), Mizoram (23.05%).

question: Q.715. According to the Union Home Ministry, the census 2021 (which got postponed due to COVID 19) was supposed to collect data for _ ________ for the first time. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (afternoon)
options: ['(a) Schedule Tribes ', '(b) Schedule Castes ', '(c) Economically weaker sections ', '(d) Other Backward Castes ']
solution: Sol.715.(d) Other Backward Castes. Fifteenth Census (2011). The Socio - Economic and Caste Census (SECC) was conducted in 2011 for t he first time since 1931. 29 questions canvassed during Population Enumeration in census 2011.

question: Q.716. As per the standard census definition, main worker is a person who works for at least ______ in a year. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.716.(d) 183 days or six months . As per the census 2001, the percentage of main workers o f t he total population was 31%.

question: Q.717. As per census 2011, What is the Total Fertility Rate in India? (provide an approximate range) SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.717.(b) 2.1 - 2.9. According to the census 2011: Highest Literacy Rate - Kerala (94.00%), Lowest Literacy Rate - Bihar (61.8%), Highest Population - Uttar Pradesh (19.98 Crores) and Density 829 people per sq km, Lowest Population - Sikkim. Largest States by Area - Rajasthan.

question: Q.718. The long term objective of National Population Policy (NPP) 2000 is to achieve a stable population by _________ with sustainable economic growth, social development and environmental protection. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.718.(a) 2045. The immediate objective of the National Population Policy (NPP) 2000 is to address the unmet needs for contraception, health care infrastructure, and health personnel, and to provide integrated service delivery for basic reproductive and child health care.

question: Q.719. Which of the following factors affect distribution of population? I. Climate II. Soil III. Topography IV. Water SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) II and IV ', '(b) I, III and IV ', '(c) I and III ', '(d) I, II, III, and IV ']
solution: Sol.719.(d) I, II, III, and IV. The main factors determining population distribution - landforms, energy and mineral resources, accessibility like distance from sea coast, natural harbors, navigable rivers or canals, cultural factors, political boundaries, controls on migration and trade, government policies, types of economic activities, technology. Including type of farming and transportation facilities, social organization. On the basis of age, the population of a nation is generally grouped into three broad categories. Categories: Children (generally below 15 years), Working Age (15-59 years), Aged (above 59 years).

question: Q.720. If Birth rate of a country is more t han the death rate then the population will ___________. SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) decrease by 50% ', '(b) decrease gradually ', '(c) increase ', '(d) remain constant ']
solution: Sol.720.(c) increase. Birth Rate - The number of babies born every year per 1000 people in a population. Death Rate - The number of deaths every year per 1000 people in a population. If B irth Rate > Death Rate: Population will increase , Birth rate = Death rate: Population will remain constant , Birth rate < Death rate: Population will decrease .

question: Q.721. As per census 2011, which among the following is the most spoken language of India? SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.721.(c) Hindi - As per census 2011, Most spoken language in India, having 52.83 crore speakers and 43.63 per c ent of t he population speaking this language. It is followed by Bengali, Marathi, Telugu, Tamil, Gujarati, Urdu, Kannada.

question: Q.722. The first urban settlement to reach a population of one million was __. SSC MTS 15/06/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.722.(b) London . Approximately 175 cities in the world had crossed the one million population mark from 1810 to 1982. Presently 48% of the world‚Äôs population lives in urban settlements compared to only 3% in the year 1800. London (Capital of United Kingdom) - Located on the bank of the Thames river.

question: Q.723. Which of the following factors can affect distribution of population? I. Geographical factors II. Social factors III. Cultural factors IV. Economic factors SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) I, II, III only ', '(b) I and II only ', '(c) I, II, III and IV ', '(d) II and III only ']
solution: Sol.723.(c) Geographical Factors - Availability of water, Landforms, Climate, Soils. Economic Factors - Minerals, Urbanisation, Industrialisation. Social and Cultural Factors - religious beliefs attract people, better housing, health facilities, educational institutions and transport systems etc.

question: Q.724. Settlements in which houses are built close to each other are called ________. SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon
options: ['(a) Scattered settlement ', '(b) Compact settlement ', '(c) Line settlement ', '(d) Grid settlement ']
solution: Sol.724.(b) Compact settlement. Grid settlements are settlements in which houses are built in a grid p attern, such a s cities. Scattered settlements are settlements in which houses are spaced apart, such as forests or deserts, rural areas . Line settlements are settlements in which houses are built along a road or river and canals.

question: Q.725. Officially, the first recorded data on transgenders in India was c ollected in which census? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon
solution: Sol.725.(a) 2011 - It was the 15th census and 7th after independence. The Registrar General of India (RGI), during Enumeration of C ensus 2011, for t he first time provided three codes; these are Male-1, Female-2 and other-3 for enumeration.

question: Q.726. According to census 2011, what is the population (nearest value) of tribals in India? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.726.(c) 10.42 crore. According to the 2011 census, 'Scheduled Tribes' (ST) - 8.6% of the total population of the country. The state and Union Territory with the largest tribal population - Madhya Pradesh, and Lakshadweep. The population density in India is 382 per km 2 .

question: Q.727. As per census 2011, which among the following states has the highest sex ratio? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Madhya Pradesh ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) Meghalaya ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.727.(c) Meghalaya. According to Census 2011: Sex Ratio of North East States (Highest to Lowest) - Meghalaya (989), Manipur (985), Mizoram (976), Tripura (960), Assam (958), Arunachal Pradesh (938), Nagaland (931). Q.728 . As per the census of 2011, what is the annual growth rate in the population of India from 2001 to 2011? SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (4th Shift) (a) 1.97 percent (b) 1.64 percent (c) 2.16 percent (d) 2.22 percent Sol.728.(b) 1.64 percent. Census 2011 - 1 5th census of India and 7th census (post Independence). Literacy Rate: Overall Literacy (74.04%), Males (82.14%), Females (65.46%).

question: Q.729. Which of the following states has the highest fertility rate in India according to the 2011 census? SSC CGL Tier II 03/03/2023
solution: Sol.729.(d) Bihar. Total fertility rate (TFR) : Total number of children born or likely to be born to a woman in her lifetime if she were subject to the prevailing rate of age-specific fertility in the population. Q.730 . The annual growth rate percentage population in India gradually started declining in the year_________ SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (1st Shift) (a) 1991 (b) 1981 (c) 1971 (d)1951 Sol.730.(b) 1981. Growth rate in 1981 was 2.30% and 0.68% during 2022. India's population is 17.7% of the total world population.

question: Q.731. Which state in India received the largest number of immigrants as per the 2001 Census? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Gujarat ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) West Bengal ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh S ol.731.(b) Maharashtra. Fourteenth Census ( 2001 ) . The decennial Census is conducted by the Office of the Registrar General and Census Commissioner, Ministry of Home Affairs. The population census is a Union subject under Article 246 of India Constitution.']

question: Q.732. As p er t he 75th NSS report, _ _____ has the lowest number of literate females in the state, with the female literacy percentage for the state pegged at 57.6%. SSC CPO 10/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Rajasthan ', '(b) Uttar Pradesh ', '(c) Andhra Pradesh ', '(d) Bihar ']
solution: Sol.732.(a) Rajasthan. Top Female literacy rate - Kerala (95.2%). India's literacy rate male (84.7%) and female (70.3%) India‚Äôs average literacy rate stands at 77.7%. National Sample Survey (NSS) conducts large scale sample surveys in diverse fields on an All India basis.

question: Q.733. Given here are the sex ratios of some states of India according to the Census of India 2011. Match the following pairs correctly. States Females per 1000 males 1.Goa a. 996 2.Tamil Nadu b. 979 3. Manipur c. 985 4. Odisha d. 973 Graduate Level 01/08/2022 ( Shift - 4 )
Q.734. Why is there low population growth in a society that is underdeveloped and technologically backward? SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Because both death rate and birth rate are high ', '(b) Because both death rate and birth rate are low ', '(c) Because such countries usually have strict government policies related to population growth ', '(d) Because people migrate from underdeveloped countries ']
answer: (a) Because both death rate and birth rate are high
solution: Sol.734.(a) The first stage is that of low population growth in society because both the death rate and the birth rate are very high so the difference between the two (or the net growth rate) is low. Stage II (Higher than death rate), Stage III (Low birth rate; Curves of both death and birth rate get closer; Population growth rate- Very low), and Stage IV (Birth rate curve further dips, more than the death rate curve; Net population goes down).

question: Q.735. As per the 2011 census of India, population density of which of the following states was less than 100 people per square kilometer? SSC MTS 07/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.735.(c) Sikkim. Five least density (less than 100 per square km) p opulated states/UTs of India: Arunachal Pradesh (17); Andaman and Nicobar Island (46); Mizoram (52); Jammu and Kashmir (56); Sikkim (86).

question: Q.736. According to the Socio-Economic Census 2015, which s tate has the largest population of households with ‚Äòdestitute / living on alms‚Äô? SSC MTS 13/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.736.(d) Odisha. Socio-Economic Census 2015 is a study of the socio-economic status of r ural and urban h ouseholds and allows the ranking of households based on predefined parameters.

question: Q.737. The first census of Independent India was conducted in ______. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.737.(c) 1951. The first Census of Independent India began on 9 February 1951 . As per the 1951 Census literacy rate - 18.33% (Male - 27.16, Female - 8.86). The last census was taken in 2011. The 16th National Census (8th National census after independence, 2021 Census) earlier scheduled to be held in the year 2022 has been further pushed to 2023-24.

question: Q.738. According to the Census 2011, which of the following is the third-lowest state in terms of literacy rate ? SSC MTS 15/07/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.738.(c) Rajasthan. According to the 2011 Census, States having the least literacy rate are Bihar (61.80%), Arunachal Pradesh (65.38%), Rajasthan (66.11%), and so on. The highest literacy rate is in Kerala (94%).

question: Q.739. Half of India‚Äôs population lives in just five states. Which of the following is one of those states? SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.739.(d) West Bengal. As per 2011 Census, five states - Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra, Bihar, West Bengal, and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Q.740. The number of deaths per thousand persons in a year is known as ______. SSC MTS 19/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) gross reproduction rate ', '(b) crude rate ', '(c) birth rate ', '(d) death rate ']
solution: Sol.740.(d) Death rate . The gross reproduction rate (GRR) is the average number of daughters a woman would have if she survived all of her childbearing years, which is roughly to the age of 45, subject to the age-specific fertility rate and sex ratio at birth throughout that period.

question: Q.741. As per the 2011 Census, arrange the following languages in descending order of Speakers strength: Marathi, Hindi, Maithili. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Marathi, Hindi, Maithili ', '(b) Marathi, Maithili, Hindi ', '(c) Hindi, Maithili, Marathi ', '(d) Hindi, Marathi, Maithili ']
solution: Sol.741.(d) Hindi, Marathi, Maithili. Languages in the descending order of their speakers in India: Hindi, Bengali, Marathi, Telugu, Tamil, Urdu, Kannada, Odia, Malayalam, Punjabi, Assamese, English, and so on.

question: Q.742. Growth rate of population refers to the: SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) difference between birth rate and GDP ', '(b) addition of birth rate and death rate ', '(c) difference between birth rate and death rate ', '(d) difference between death rate and GDP ']
answer: (c) difference between birth rate and death rate
solution: Sol.742.(c) Population growth rate is the change in the number of i ndividuals over a specific period of time. The rate of population growth is the rate of natural increase combined with the effects of migration.

question: Q.743. The distribution of the population according to different types of occupation is known as __________. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) occupational structure ', '(b) age composition ', '(c) adolescent population ', '(d) Migration ']
solution: Sol.743.(a) Occupational structure refers to the aggregate distribution of the population according to different occupations in society, defined by skill level, and economic status. The age composition refers to the number of people in different age groups in a country.

question: Q.744. Which period in India is referred to as a steady population growth period? SSC CHSL 9/06/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.744.(a) 1921-1951. Four phases of population growth in India: Stagnant population (1901-1921), Steady growth stage (1921-1951), Rapid growth stage (1951- 1981) and high growth with definite signs of slowing down (1981-2011).

question: Q.745. What is the percentage of rural child population to the total child population of the country in India as per Provisional Population Totals of Census 2011? SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.745.(a) 74.05% . As per the Provisional Population Totals of Census 2011, the total population of India was 1210.2 million. Of this, the rural population stands at 833.1 million and the urban population at 377.1 million.

question: Q.746. The number of deaths during the first 28 completed days of life p er 1000 live births in a given year or period is defined as ______. SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Evening )
options: ['(a) neonatal mortality rate ', '(b) age-specific mortality rate ', '(c) crude mortality rate ', '(d) infant mortality rate ']
solution: Sol.746.(a) neonatal mortality rate . An age-specific mortality rate is a mortality rate limited to a particular age group. The crude death r ate is calculated as the number of deaths in a given period divided by the population exposed to risk of death in that period. The infant mortality rate is the number of infant deaths for every 1,000 live births.

question: Q.747. What was the estimated national mortality rate of children under the age of five in the country as per Census of India 2011? SSC CGL 18/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.747.(b) 55 . As per Census 2011, the share of c hildren (0-6 years) accounts f or 13.1 % of the total population in the Country.

question: Q.748. As per the theory of d emographic transition, the post-transitional stage of demographic transition is characterised by ______. SSC CGL 19/04/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) low and nearly equal birth and death rates ', '(b) falling birth rates and high death rates ', '(c) high and nearly equal birth and death rates ', '(d) falling death rates and high birth Rates ']
answer: (a) low and nearly equal birth and death rates
solution: Sol.748.(a) The demographic transition model has four stages: pre-industrial, urbanizing/industrializing, mature industrial, and post-industrial.

question: Q.749. The total population per net cultivated area of a country refers to its ______. SSC CHSL 10/8/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) physiological density ', '(b) population density ', '(c) agricultural density ', '(d) livestock density ']
solution: Sol.749.(a) physiological density. A higher physiological density suggests that the available agricultural land is being used more a nd may reach its output limit sooner than a country that has a lower physiological density. Atmosphere

question: Q.750. All the changes in climate and weather takes place in _____________ _ . SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.750.(b) Troposphere. Stratosphere (contains the ozone layer) - 2nd layer of the Earth's atmosphere, extending from about 10 to 50 km in altitude. Mesosphere - 3 r d layer of the Earth's atmosphere, extending from about 50 to 85 km in altitude. Most meteors burn up in this atmospheric layer. Thermosphere - 4 t h layer of the Earth's atmosphere, extending from about 85 to 500 km in altitude. Exosphere - Outermost layer of the atmosphere.

question: Q.751. Which of the following claims about chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) is accurate? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) CFCs are used as repairers of the troposphere ', '(b) CFCs are used as fuel for air crafts ', '(c) CFCs are used as repairers of the ozone layer ', '(d) CFCs are used as refrigerants ']
solution: Sol.751.(d) CFCs are used as refrigerants. CFCs (Chlorofluorocarbons) are now banned in India as they cause depletion of the Ozone layer. It was also used in the production of plastic foams, cleaning certain electronic components, pressurizing agents in aerosol cans. CFCs are now replaced by hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) which have ozone depletion potential (ODP) of 0.

question: Q.752. What is the height of the troposphere near the poles and the equator, respectively? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) 8 km and 18 km ', '(b) 16 km and 6 km ', '(c) 4 km and 16 km ', '(d) 18 km and 8 km ']
solution: Sol.752.(a) 8 km and 18 km. Troposphere: The bottom most layer of atmosphere and contains about 75% of the Earth's atmosphere and almost all of its water vapor. Almost all the weather phenomena like rainfall, fog and hailstorm occur in this layer. Most aviation takes place here.

question: Q.753. What is the purpose o f t he Earth's magnetic field? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) To provide an energy source for life on Earth ', "(b) To control the Earth's climate ", '(c) To shield the Earth from solar wind and cosmic radiation ', '(d) To cause the tides in the ocean ']
answer: (c) To shield the Earth from solar wind and cosmic radiation
solution: Sol.753.(c) Earth's m agnetic field (Geomagnetic field) - The magnetic field that extends from Earth's interior out into space, where it interacts with the solar wind, a stream of charged particles emerging from the Sun. Earth‚Äôs Magnetism - Generated by convection currents of molten iron and nickel in the earth‚Äôs core. These convection currents are caused by heat escaping from the core, a natural process called a geodynamo.

question: Q.754. Which of the following layers of the atmosphere means "region of mixing"? SSC MTS 15/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.754.(b) Troposphere : "Region of mixing‚Äù - Because all weather phenomena (Temperature, pressure, winds, clouds, thunder, lightning and precipitation) occur within the troposphere.

question: Q.755. What is the main objective of the 'Graded Response Action Plan'? SSC MTS 19/06/2023 (Afternoon
options: ['(a) legalizing illegal colonies ', '(b) To control the cases of malaria ', '(c) introduction of electric vehicles ', '(d) controlling air pollution ']
solution: Sol.755.(d) Controlling air pollution. Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) : It was formulated in 2016 and notified in 2017 for Delhi and the National Capital Region (NCR) by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.

question: Q.756. Which of the following is an example of an artificial ecosystem? SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.756.(d) Aquariums are a transparent tank of water in which fish, other water creatures and plants are kept. Grassland is an area where the vegetation is dominated by grasses.

question: Q.757. Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding the stratosphere ? SSC CHSL 14/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) It lies above the mesosphere. ', '(b) It extends up to a height of 50 km. ', '(c) It contains a layer of ozone gas. ', '(d) This layer is almost free from clouds. ']
solution: Sol.757.(a) Stratosphere - Its height of the bottom varies with latitude and with the seasons. Aviation & Jet Streams fly in the Stratosphere.

question: Q.758. In which layer of atmosphere does the meteorites burn up on entering from space? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.758.(c) Mesosphere. Meteorites are space rocks that fall to Earth's surface. Meteorites are the last stage in the existence of these types of space rocks.

question: Q.759. How much percentage of oxygen is present in the atmosphere? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.759.(d) 21%. Percentage of G ases by Volume in Atmosphere: Nitrogen (78.08%), Oxygen (20.95%), Argon (0.93%), Carbon dioxide (0.036%), Neon (0.002%), Helium (0.0005%), Hydrogen (0.00005%), etc. The atmosphere contains a mixture of gases and huge numbers of Aerosols (solid and liquid particles).

question: Q.760. Which layer of atmosphere helps in radio transmission? SSC CGL 02/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.760.(b) Thermosphere. The temperature starts increasing again with increasing height in this layer. Aurora and satellites occur in this layer.

question: Q.761. What is the average temperature of Chennai in the cold season? SSC CPO 09/11/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.761.(c) 24 o - 25 o Celsius. Chennai has warm temperatures year round ranging between 29¬∞C (84¬∞F) and 37¬∞C (98¬∞F). {Coldest month (January - 29¬∞C (84¬∞F)}. Chennai features a t ropical wet and dry climate. Chennai lies on the thermal equator and is also coastal, which prevents extreme variation in seasonal temperature.

question: Q.762. People of ______ have hardly any idea of extremes of temperature and the seasons rhythm of weather. SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.762.(b) Mumbai has moderate climate as it is along the shoreline of Arabian Sea.

question: Q.763. In India, from June to September which type of weather prevails? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Autumn ', '(b) Winter ', '(c) Spring ', '(d) Monsoon / Rainy season ']
solution: Sol.763.(d) Monsoon / Rainy season. Major seasons in India: Rainy {(Southwest Monsoon Season) June to September}, Autumn {(Season of Retreating Monsoon) October and November}, Winter {(Cold Weather Season) December to February}, and Summer {(Hot Weather Season) March to May}.

question: Q.764. At what height do t he Jet Streams blow in India during winter months? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.764.(d) 9-13 km. Jet Streams (geostrophic wind) are relatively narrow bands of strong wind. Types: Polar-Night Jet Stream, SubTropical Jet Streams (westerlies), Tropical Easterly Jet Stream.

question: Q.765. Which cycle shows the movement of water? SSC CHSL 02/06/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Carbon cycle ', '(b) Nitrogen cycle ', '(c) Geological cycle', '(d) Hydrological cycle ']
solution: Sol.765.(d) Hydrological cycle . Carbon cycle shows the movement of carbon in elemental and combined states on earth. The nitrogen cycle is a series of processes that convert nitrogen gas to organic substances and back to nitrogen in nature. The Geological cycle refers to a series of intertwined processes that are important for the formation and break down of physical Earth features.

question: Q.766. The climate of Assam can be described as: SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Evening)
options: ['(a) subtropical humid climate ', '(b) mountain climate ', '(c) tropical dry climate ', '(d) tropical monsoon rainforest climate ']
solution: Sol.766.(d) Tropical Monsoon Rainforest Climate . Tropical monsoon climates have monthly mean temperatures above 18 ¬∞C (64 ¬∞F) in every month of the year and a dry season. Tropical monsoon climate is the intermediate climate between the wet Af (or tropical wet climate) and the drier Aw (or tropical savanna climate).

question: Q.767. ____is a naturally occurring phenomenon that is responsible for the heating of the Earth‚Äôs surface and atmosphere. SSC CPO 25/11/2020(Evening)
options: ['(a) Radiation ', '(b) Global warming ', '(c) Greenhouse effect ', '(d) Global heating ']
solution: Sol.767.(c) Greenhouse Effect . When the Sun's energy reaches the Earth's atmosphere, some of it is reflected back to space and the rest is absorbed and re-radiated by greenhouse gases. The absorbed energy warms the atmosphere and the surface of the Earth.

question: Q.768. Which statement best explains why Shillong gets around 200 cm rainfall annually; whereas Cherrapunji, which is around 30 km away (as the crow flies), gets over 1250 cm of rainfall annually? SSC CHSL 15/10/2020(Evening)
options: ['(a) Cherrapunji gets rainfall from rain-laden clouds coming from the Himalayas, whereas Shillong gets rainfall from the Malabar branch of monsoon. ', '(b) Cherrapunji lies on the leeward side of the Khasi hills and Shillong lies on the windward side of the Khasi hills, and thus, gets only wind and no rain. ', '(c) The average temperature of Shillong has gone up due to excessive deforestation and pollution. ', '(d) Cherrapunji lies on the windward side of the Khasi hills and receives rainfall from the Bay of Bengal branch of monsoon, while Shillong lies on the leeward side of the Khasi hills, which forms the rain shadow area. ']
answer: (d) Cherrapunji lies on the windward side of the Khasi hills and receives rainfall from the Bay of Bengal branch of monsoon, while Shillong lies on the leeward side of the Khasi hills, which forms the rain shadow area.
solution: Sol.768.(d) Cherrapunji, also known as Sohra, is a high-altitude town in the northeast Indian state of Meghalaya, is renowned for its unique living root bridges.

question: Q.769. Cirrus and cumulus are types of ______. SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Morning)
solution: Sol.769.(b) Clouds. Cirrus clouds are wispy, veil-like clouds that form in the upper t roposphere while cumulus clouds are stacked, dense and fluffy and they form much closer to the ground.

question: Q.770. Which environmental phenomenon has been linked to synthetic chemicals like chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs)? SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Electromagnetic interference ', '(b) Tidal flow ', '(c) Ozone depletion ', '(d) Wave propagation ']
solution: Sol.770.(c) Ozone depletion. Ozone depletion can cause increased amounts of UV radiation to reach the Earth which can lead to more cases of skin cancer, cataracts, and impaired immune systems.

question: Q.771. Above which layer of the atmosphere does the Exosphere lie? SSC CHSL 19/10/2020(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.771.(b) Thermosphere . The exosphere is the very edge of our atmosphere. This layer separates the rest of the atmosphere from outer space.

question: Q.772. The term ‚Äòmonsoon‚Äô is derived from a/an: SSC CHSL 21/10/2020 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Italian word ', '(b) Latin word ', '(c) Arabic word ', '(d) Greek word ']
solution: Sol.772.(c) Arabic word ‚Äò mausim‚Äô, which means weather. The term w as r eportedly first used in English in British India and refers to the seasonal change in the direction of the prevailing winds of a region. Rocks

question: Q.773. Which of the following is the correct match between column-A and column-B? Column-A Column-B (Type of rock) (Method of formation) i. Sedimentary a. Transformed its Rock chemical qualities from other type of rocks ii. Metamorphic b. Derived from magma Rock that was poured out or ejected at the Earth's Surface iii. Igneous c. Formed from Rock fragments of other rocks or the remains of plants or animals SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) i-a, ii-b, iii-c ', '(b) i-b, ii-a, iii-c ', '(c) i-c, ii-a, iii-b ', '(d) i-a, ii-c, iii-b ']
solution: Sol.773.(c) i-c, ii-a, iii-b. The rock cycle is a web of processes that outlines how each of the three major rock types - igneous, metamorphic, and sedimentary - form and break down based on the different applications of heat and pressure over time. Igneous rocks (Granite, gabbro, pegmatite, basalt). Sedimentary Rocks (Sandstone, limestone, shale, chalk). Metamorphic Rocks (Gneissoid, Syenite, Slate, Schist, Marble, quartzite).

question: Q.774. Structural geology deals with: SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) the age of rocks ', '(b) the components and chemical nature of soil ', '(c) the form, classification, mechanism, and causes of rock structures‚Äô evolution ', '(d) the cause of volcano formation ']
answer: (c) the form, classification, mechanism, and causes of rock structures‚Äô evolution
solution: Sol.774.(c) Petrology is the science of rocks. Rock: Any natural mass of m ineral matter that makes up the Earth's crust. On the basis of their mode of formation rocks are classified in 3 types - (i) Igneous Rocks - solidified from magma and lava; (ii) Sedimentary Rocks - The result of deposition of fragments of rocks by exogenous processes; (iii) Metamorphic Rocks - Formed out of existing rocks undergoing recrystallisation.

question: Q.775. Which of the following is a yellowish green to green coloured gemstone often found in mafic and ultramafic igneous rocks such as basalt, gabbro, dunite, diabase and peridotite? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.775.(b) Olivine. T he mineral olivine is a magnesium iron silicate with the chemical formula (Mg,Fe) SiO . It is a 2 4 type of nesosilicate or orthosilicate. Bornite , also known as peacock ore, is a sulfide mineral with a chemical composition of Cu FeS . Tremolite is a 5 4 member of the amphibole group of silicate minerals with composition of Ca Mg Si O (OH) . Garnets are a group 2 5 8 22 2 of silicate minerals All species of g arnets possess similar physical properties and crystal forms, but differ in chemical composition.

question: Q.776. The breaking up of the rocks on the earth's surface is called as _________. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.776.(a) Weathering - The process of wearing, breaking up, and fragmentation of the rock that creates the surface of the ground and that remains exposed to the weather.

question: Q.777. Which type of rock can be considered as a biological sedimentary rock? SSC CGL 05/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.777.(d) Limestone. Depending upon the mode of formation, sedimentary rocks are categorized into three g roups - Mechanically formed (Eg: Sandstone, conglomerate, limestone, shale, loess, etc.), Chemically formed (Eg: Chert, limestone, halite, potash, etc.), Organically formed or Biologic sedimentary rocks - formed when living organisms die, pile up, and are then compressed and cemented together. Example - coal (from plants), limestone and coquina (from marine organisms), Geyserite, chalk, etc.

question: Q.778. Which of the following is a characteristic of sedimentary rocks? SSC CGL 07/12/2022 (4th Shift)
solution: Sol.778.(d) Lithification includes all the processes which convert unconsolidated sediments into sedimentary rocks. Foliation in geology refers to repetitive layering in metamorphic rocks. Banding means that the rock consists of alternating, thin layers of two different mineral compositions.

question: Q.779. The steep rocky coast rising almost vertically above sea water is called ______. SSC MTS 06/07/2022 (Morning)
options: ['(a) sea caves ', '(b) sea cliff ', '(c) sea arches ', '(d) ox-bow lake ']
solution: Sol.779.(b) Sea cliffs are steep faces of rock and soil that are formed by destructive waves. A Sea cave is a cave formed on a cliff b y the wave action of a n ocean or lake. A sea arch is a natural arch or bridge made of stone that has been created when water wears a way the underside of a rock, leaving just the top behind.

question: Q.780. The core of the Great Himalayas is composed of ______. SSC MTS 20/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.780.(b) Granite rock (Igneous rock) . Lesser Himalaya consists of metamorphosed sedimentary rocks (quartzite, marble, slate, phyllite, schist and gneiss). Q.781 Which of t he following determines the colour, texture,chemical properties, mineral, content and permeability of the soil? SSC MTS 22/07/2022 (Morning) (a) Parent rock (b) Time (c) Relief (d) Climate Sol.781.(a) Parent rock . The color in the soil is mainly due to two factors ‚Äì organic content and the chemical nature of iron compounds found in the soil.

question: Q.782. How many t ypes of i gneous rocks are there? SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.782.(b) Two. Based on the texture of rocks, igneous rocks are classified into Intrusive igneous rocks (Plutonic rocks) and Extrusive igneous rocks (Lava or Volcanic rocks).

question: Q.783. Mushroom rocks are formed due to _____. SSC MTS 26/07/2022 (Evening)
options: ['(a) glacial deposition ', '(b) deposition of sea waves ', '(c) running water erosion ', '(d) wind erosion ']
solution: Sol.783.(d) Wind erosion. A mushroom rock (perched rock) is a typical mushroom-shaped landform that is formed by the action of wind erosion. These rocks are mostly found in arid regions. Such rocks are found i n the Thar Desert of India.

question: Q.784. What type of rocks were once igneous or sedimentary, but have metamorphosed as a result of intense heat and/or pressure within the Earth's crust? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.784.(b) Quartzite. Granite is a coarse-grained (phaneritic) intrusive igneous rock composed mostly of quartz, alkali feldspar, and plagioclase. S andstone is a clastic sedimentary rock composed mainly of sand-sized silicate grains. Basalt is a mafic e xtrusive rock, is the most widespread of all igneous rocks, and comprises more than 90% of all volcanic rocks.

question: Q.785. Which of the following rocks floats in water? SSC MTS 26/10/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.785.(c) Pumice is a light-colored, extremely porous igneous rock that forms during explosive volcanic eruptions. Obsidian has been used across history to make weapons, implements, tools, ornaments, and mirrors. Granites are a type of hard and compact igneous rock formed by quartz, feldspar, as well as mica. Slate is a type of metamorphic rock.

question: Q.786. ______ plains are formed due to the weathering of soluble rocks such as limestone and dolomite. SSC CHSL 04/08/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.786.(b) Karst regions contain aquifers that are capable of providing large supplies of water. Typical karst forms include sinkholes, caves, natural bridges and sinking streams. Mountain

question: Q.787. The Garo, Khasi and Jaintia hills are a subdivision of: SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Assam valley ', '(b) Barak basin ', '(c) Surma basin ', '(d) Meghalaya plateau ']
solution: Sol.787.(d) Meghalaya Plateau. The plateau is separated from the main block of the peninsular plateau by a gap called the Garo-RajMahal gap. It is located on the northeastern flank of Peninsular India. It is one of the rainiest, most tectonically active areas in the world. Hills in North East India - Lushai Hills or Mizo Hills (Mizoram and Tripura), Chin Hills (Manipur to Chin State of M yanmar), Barail Range (Assam), Dafla Hills and Abor Hills (Arunachal Pradesh).

question: Q.788. The Karewa formations a re found in the __________ . SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Morning) ( a) North Easter Hills (b) Kashmir Himalayas (c) Uttaranchal Himalayas (d) Terai Region Sol.788.(b) Kashmir Himalayas. The Karewa term means ‚Äúelevated table land‚Äù. Firstly, this term was used by Godwin Austin in 1859. ‚ÄúVudr‚Äù is the local name for i t in Kashmiri language. Karewa formations are useful for the cultivation of Zafran (Saffron), almond, walnut, apple, and orchards in Kashmir valley.
Q.789. Siachen in Himalayas is: SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) a glacier ', '(b) a dam ', '(c) a national park ', '(d) a lake ']
solution: Sol.789.(a) A glacier. T he Siachen Glacier is located in the Eastern Karakoram range in the Himalayas. It is the world's highest battlefield. Nubra river originates from Siachen Glacier. It is situated to the North of Nubra Valley.

question: Q.790. The holy mountain 'Kailash' is located in which neighbouring country of India ? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.790.(d) China. Mount Kailash - Located near Lake Mansarovar and Lake Rakshastal. The Indus River originates from Mansarovar l ake (Tibet). Some highest mountain peaks : India - Kanchenjunga (8598m), Nanda Devi (7817m). Nepal - Mount E verest (8848.86 m), Dhaulagiri (8172m). Hindu temple outside India : Nepal - Pashupatinath Temple, Indonesia - Prambanan Temple, Bangladesh - Dhakeshwari temple, Cambodia - Angkor Wat.

question: Q.791. Which of the following hills are located in Purvachal ? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Mizo hills and Naga hills ', '(b) Shevroy hills and Javadi hills ', '(c) Khasi and Jaintia hills ', '(d) Anai Mudi and Doda Betta ']
solution: Sol.791.(a) Mizo hills and Naga hills. The Patkai Bum, Mizo Hills or Lushai Hills and Naga Hills are mountain ranges in Northeastern India. Shevaroy hills (Tamil Nadu) and Javadi hills (Tamil Nadu). Khasi and Jaintia hills (Meghalaya). Anamudi (Kerala) and Doda Betta (Tamil Nadu).

question: Q.792. Which mountain range from the following is associated with Rajasthan state? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Satpura Range ', '(b) Sahyadri Range ', '(c) Aravalli Range ', '(d) Vindhya Range ']
solution: Sol.792.(c) Aravali Range. It lies on the western and northwestern margins of t he Peninsular Plateau. They extend from Gujarat to Delhi in a southwest-northeast direction. The Guru Shikhar (1722m) is the highest peak of the Aravalli range. Important passes (Rajasthan) : Goran Ghat, Haldighati Pass. River Sabarmati originates from the Aravali ranges.

question: Q.793. Identify the southernmost range of the Himalaya from the following. SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Shiwaliks Range ', '(b) Trans Himalaya Range ', '(c) Lesser Himalaya Range ', '(d) Greater Himalaya Range ']
solution: Sol.793.(a) Siwaliks Range. Himalayan Ranges: Himadri (Greater Himalayas or Inner Himalayas), Himachal (Lesser Himalayas), Shiwaliks (Outer Himalayas). Divisions (West to east) : Punjab Himalayas (between rivers Indus and Sutlej), Kumaon Himalayas (Between Sutlej and Kali rivers), Nepal Himalayas (between rivers Kali and Teesta), Assam Himalayas (between rivers Tista and Dihang), Purvanchal (beyond the Dihang river).

question: Q.794. The western Ghats and the Eastern Ghats meet at which of the following places in southern India? SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Satpura Hills ', '(b) Nallamala Hills ', '(c) Nilgiri Hills ', '(d) Mahendragiri Hills ']
solution: Sol.794.(c) Nilgiri Hills: Highest Peak - Doda Betta. Located at the tri-junction of the states of K arnataka, Kerala and Tamil Nadu. Named after the Neelakurinji flowers (purplish-blue flowers) found in Shola forests. Satpura Hills - The range begins in eastern Gujarat and runs east through Maharashtra and Madhya Pradesh before ending in Chhattisgarh. Nallamala Hills - Andhra Pradesh, eastern ghats. Mahendragiri Hills is located in the district of G ajapati, Odisha (eastern ghats). Q.795 . Name an oval-shaped range of hills sculpted by glacial flow. SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (1st shift) (a) Sandur (b) Drumlins (c) Moraines (d) Esker Sol.795.(b) Drumlins - It is formed by the filling of heavy rocky debris in the glacial crevices and its stay under the ice. One end of the drumlins facing the glacier called the stoss end and the other end called tail. Eskers: When glaciers melt in summer, the water flows on the surface of the ice. These waters accumulate beneath the glacier and flow l ike streams in a channel beneath the ice. Moraine: Materials (Soil and Rock) l eft behind by a moving glacier.

question: Q.796. The Japfu range, which is 3,014 meters high, is located in which state? SSC CGL 14/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.796.(d) Nagaland. Mt. Japfu is called the Switzerland of the East. Other peaks: Nagaland - Kapu, Zanubou, Glory Peak, Zephu. Meghalaya - Garo (Nokrek is the highest point), Khasi, and Jaintia hills. Assam - Barail is the highest hill range. Arunachal Pradesh - Mishmi, Dafla range, Namcha Barwa.

question: Q.797. In which part of the Indian Himalayas does its highest mountain peak, Kanchenjunga, lie? SSC CGL 24/07/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Arunachal Himalayas ', '(b) Kashmir Himalayas ', '(c) The Darjeeling and Sikkim Himalayas ', '(d) Uttarakhand Himalayas ']
solution: Sol.797.(c) The Darjeeling and Sikkim Himalayas. Kanchenjunga is the world‚Äôs third-highest mountain, with an elevation of (8,598 meters). The mountain is part of the Greater Himalayas or Himadri Range. It is delimited in the west by the Tamur River, in the north by Lhonak Chu and Jongsang La, and in the east by the Teesta River. Other Mountains and their states - Nanda Devi (Uttarakhand), Anamudi - (Kerala), Doddabetta (Tamil Nadu), Guru shikhar (Rajasthan).

question: Q.798. The Shevaroy Hills are located in which state of India? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.798.(d) Tamil Nadu ( Aanna Malai, Doddabetta, Nilgiri). Famous hills:- Chhattisgarh - Tulasi Dongar, Bailadila, Balaraja Gutta. Odisha - Devmali, Turia Konda, Mahendragiri, Devagiri. Rajasthan - Guru Shikhar, Mt. Abu, Sunda. Kangchenjunga (Sikkim) - Highest mountain peak in India. Jindhagada Peak (Andhra pradesh) - Highest peak of Eastern Ghats. Anamudi (Kerala) - Highest peak of Western Ghats.

question: Q.799. Which among the following is the highest peak of West Bengal? SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Sandakphu ( b) Saramati (c) Doddabetta (d) Deomali Sol.799.(a) Sandakphu ( 3636 m ). It is located on the border between India and Nepal, belongs to the Singalia Mountain ranges. It is a part of the Purvanchal range. Doddabetta ( 2637 m ) - It is the highest peak of Tamil Nadu and a part of Nilgiri Mountain Range.', '', '', '']

question: Q.800. The Himalayan Mountain range was formed by the collision of ________. SSC MTS 18/05/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) African Plate and Australian Plate ', '(b) Indian Plate and African Plate ', '(c) Eurasian Plate and African Plate ', '(d) Indian Plate and Eurasian Plate ']
solution: Sol.800.(d) Indian Plate and Eurasian Plate. Plates - They are large, rigid pieces of the Earth's lithosphere that fit together like a jigsaw puzzle, and their movements are responsible for shaping the Earth's surface through processes such as earthquakes and the formation of mountains. Major plates (7) - African Plate, Antarctic P late, Eurasian Plate, North American Plate, South American Plate, Pacific Plate and Indo-Australian Plate.

question: Q.801. The rock shelters of Bhimbetka are in the foothills of which mountains? SSC MTS 16/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.801.(d) Vindhyan (Raisen district, Madhya Pradesh). Bhimbetka - In 1957, V. S. Wakankar discovered this site. It is inside the Ratapani Wildlife Sanctuary and declared as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 2003. Other caves in Vindhya Range: Pandav Caves, Udayagiri Caves, Adamgarh Caves, Chota Mahadev Cave etc.

question: Q.802. Dhinodhar Hills is located in which Indian state/Union Territory? SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Andaman and Nicobar Islands ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) Gujarat ', '(d) West Bengal ']
solution: Sol.802.(c) Gujarat. Dhinodhar Hill is a tourist and pilgrimage spot. Other hills in Gujarat - Chotila, Pavagadh, Palitana, Saputara, Girnar, Bardo, Gabbar. Hills : Maharashtra - Mahabaleshwar, Panchgani, Matheran, Lonavala, Amboli etc. West Bengal - Gorgaburu Hill, Ajodhya Hills, Susunia Hill etc. Andaman and Nicobar Islands - Ross Island, Barren Island, Saddle Peak, Katchal, Narcondam Island etc.

question: Q.803. Which among the following peaks is the highest peak of Jharkhand? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.803.(d) Parasnath. It is named after Lord Parshvanath (23rd Jain Tirthankara). Anamudi peak (Kerala) and Kangto peak (Arunachal Pradesh). State and Highest Peak - Gujarat (Girnar Peak), Rajasthan (Guru Shikhar), Andhra Pradesh (Arma Konda), Haryana (Karah Peak), Karnataka (Mullayanagiri Peak).

question: Q.804. Which of the following statements is NOT correct? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Mahendragiri is the highest peak in the Eastern Ghats. ', '(b) The height of the Western Ghats progressively decreases from north to south. ', '(c) The Western Ghats cause orographic rain. ', '(d) The Eastern Ghats stretch from the Mahanadi Valley to the Nilgiris in the south. ']
answer: (b) The height of the Western Ghats progressively decreases from north to south.
solution: Sol.804.(b) The height of the Western Ghats progressively increases from north to south. The highest peaks of Western Ghats include the Anai Mudi (2,695 metres) and the Doda Betta (2,637 meters).The Western Ghats, also known as the Sahyadri Hills, Mainly traverse the States of Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Goa, Maharashtra and Gujarat.

question: Q.805. Which among the following glaciers is not located in Jammu & Kashmir ? SSC CHSL 13/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.805.(b) Milam (Uttarakhand) . Glaciers of Himachal Pradesh: Bara Shigri, Chota Shigri, Gefang Glacier, Chandra glacier, Milang glacier, Bhaga glacier, Malana Glacier.

question: Q.806. Which of the following hills are NOT part of the Purvanchal hills? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Manipur hills ', '(b) Naga hills ', '(c) Patli hills ', '(d) Mizo hills ']
solution: Sol.806.(c) Patli hills (Himachal) . The Purvanchal Hills are a range of hills in northeastern India, located in Assam, Arunachal Pradesh, and Nagaland. Its major ranges - The Dafla Hills, Patkai Hills, Khasi Hills, Jaintia Hills and Mishmi Hills.

question: Q.807. Which among the following is the largest of all the duns of the Shiwaliks mountain range in India? SSC CHSL 15/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Patli Dun ', '(b) Jammu Dun ', '(c) DehraDun ', '(d) Kotli Dun ']
solution: Sol.807. (c) Dehradun (Length - 35-45 km, Width - 22-25 km). Dun- Valleys that lie between the Shivalik and Lesser himalaya. Other duns of Uttarakhand - Kota dun, P atli dun, H ar k i dun. Kotli dun - Himachal Pradesh. Kashmir Himalayas - Jammu dun and Pathankot dun.

question: Q.808. Kalsubai peak is located in which of the following Indian states? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Madhya Pradesh ', '(b) Maharashtra ', '(c) Andhra Pradesh ', '(d) Himachal Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.808.(b) Maharashtra. Kalsubai (Everest of Maharashtra) is the highest peak of Maharashtra‚Äôs Ahmednagar district in Akola taluka. Other Highest Peaks and related states : Mount Dhupgarh or Dhupgarh - Mahadeo Hills (Satpura Range), Madhya Pradesh; Arma Konda (Sitamma Konda) - Andhra Pradesh; Guru Shikhar - Aravalli Range in Rajasthan.

question: Q.809. Which of the following is NOT a type of a fold mountain? SSC CHSL 17/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Aravali range ', '(b) The Rhine Valley ', '(c) Appalachians ', '(d) Ural Mountains ']
solution: Sol.809.(b) Rhine Valley . Fold m ountains are the most common type of mountain in the world. The rugged, soaring heights of the Himalayas, Andes, Alps and Aravalli Range (oldest range) are all active fold mountains. Rhine Valley (Germany) is the valley of the river Rhine in Europe. It is also known as Alpine Rhine. The Appalachian Mountains are found in North America.

question: Q.810. The approximate length of the Great Himalayan range, also known as the central axial range, is _____ km from east to west. SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.810.(b) 2500. The great Himalayan range width varies between 160-400 km from north to south. Famous peaks of Himalayas: Mount E verest (8848 m), Mt. Kanchenjunga (8598 m), Mt. Makalu (8481 m), Mt. Dhaulagiri (8172 m). The Himalayas consist of three parallel ranges - Himadri (Great Himalayas or the Higher Himalayas), Himachal (Lesser Himalayas or the Lower Himalayas) and Shiwaliks (Outer Himalayas).

question: Q.811. What is the average height of inner Himalayas? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.811.(a) 6000 metres. The Himalayas consist of three parallel ranges, the Greater Himalayas or the Inner Himalayas or the Himadri, the Lesser Himalayas called the Himachal (with an average height of 3,700 to 4500 meters), and the Shivalik hills (with an average height of 900 to 1100 meters), which comprise the foothills.

question: Q.812. Asia is separated from Europe by ______ mountains. SSC CGL 03/12/2022 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.812.(d) Ural . Alps mountain (natural boundary between France and Italy), Andes Mountains range (South American countries of Chile and Argentina), Himalaya (plains of the Indian subcontinent from the Tibetan Plateau). Caucasus mountains (Asia and Europe).

question: Q.813. Which of the following have mountain range young fold mountains? SSC CGL 13/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Appalachians mountain range ', '(b) Alps mountain range ', '(c) Aravali mountain range ', '(d) Ural mountain range ']
solution: Sol.813.(b) Alps mountain range. Fold mountains form when two or more of t he Earth's tectonic plates collide. Types - Anticline, Syncline, Monocline, Isocline. Features - rugged relief, imposing height (lofty), high conical peaks. Examples are the Rockies, the Andes, the Alps, the Himalayas, etc. Old fold Mountain - An Appalachian mountain range, Aravali mountain range, and Ural mountain range.

question: Q.814. The uplifted blocks of block mountains are called ______. SSC MTS 14/07/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.814.(a) Horsts. Block mountains are formed due to the upward m ovement of the middle block between two normal faults. The up-thrown block i s also called a horst. Graben is bounded by normal faults dipping toward each other. These mountains include the Great African Rift Valley , the Rhine Valley (graben) in Germany, etc.

question: Q.815. Which of t he following mountains is formed as a result of t he compression of tectonic plates, leading to the formation of large fold-like structures on the Earth's crust? SSC CHSL 25/05/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Ural mountain in Russia ', '(b) Vosges mountain in Europe ', '(c) Mt.Kilimanjaro in Africa ', '(d) Harz mountains in Germany ']
solution: Sol.815.(a) Ural mountain in Russia. Fold Mountains - Himalayan Mountains in Asia, the Alps in Europe, the Andes in South America, the Rockies in North America.

question: Q.816. Which of t he following mountains were formed when molten rock from the depths of the earth rose from the crust and piled up on its own? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Mount Kilimanjaro in Africa ', '(b) Rockies in North America ', '(c) Ural mountain in Russia ', '(d) Alps in Europe ']
solution: Sol.816.(a) Mount Kilimanjaro in Africa (Tanzania) . Top mountains in Africa:- Mount Kenya, Mount Stanley, Mount Speke, Mount Baker, Mount Emin.

question: Q.817. Correctly match the following peaks of the Himalayas to their heights. Peak Height in meters 1. Mt. Everest a. 8167 2. Dhaulagiri b. 8848 3. Kamet c. 8078 4. Annapurna d. 7756 SSC CHSL 06/06/2022(Afternoon)
Q.818. Fotu La, the Great Mountain Pass, at an altitude of 4108 m above sea level, is the highest point of which Indian state/UT? SSC CHSL 09/06/2022(Morning)
options: ['(a) Ladakh ', '(b) Jammu and Kashmir ', '(c) Himachal Pradesh ', '(d) Sikkim ']
solution: Sol.818.(a) Ladakh. Fatu La is a mountain pass on the Srinagar-Leh highway in the Zanskar Range of the Himalayas in Ladakh, UT. It is one of t wo high mountain passes between Leh and Kargil, the other being Namika La.

question: Q.819. Which of the following is also known as the ‚ÄòWhite Mountain‚Äô? SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.819.(c) Dhaulagiri mountain massif of the Himalayas in west-central Nepal. Cho O yu , mountain, in the Himalayas on the Nepalese‚ÄìTibetan (Chinese) border. Makalu Mountain is located in the Mahalangur Himalayas 19 km southeast of Mount Everest, on the border between Nepal and Tibet. Lhotse Mountain - The main summit is on the border between Tibet and the Khumbu region of Nepal.

question: Q.820. Which of the following statement(s) is/are correct regarding mountains? I - Mountains may be arranged in a line known as range. II- The Aravali range in India is one of t he oldest fold mountain systems in the world. III- Mt. Kilimanjaro in South America is an example of Volcanic Mountain SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Evening )
options: ['(a) Only I and II ', '(b) Only II ', '(c) I, II and III ', '(d) Only I ']
solution: Sol.820.(a) Only I and II. Mount Kilimanjaro is a dormant volcano in Tanzania. It is the highest mountain in Africa .

question: Q.821. The Deomali is the highest mountain peak of ______. SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Morning)
solution: Sol.821.(d) Odisha. The Deomali peak height is 1,762 m. T he Borail Range is the highest Mountain Ranges in Assam. Someshwar Fort is the highest peak of Bihar. It is part of Shivalik hill.

question: Q.822. In which Indian state will you find Mount Tiyi? SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Arunachal Pradesh ', '(b) Odisha ', '(c) Himachal Pradesh ', '(d) Nagaland ']
solution: Sol.822.(d) Nagaland . Some other mountains: Japfu Peak, Changkikong Range, Mount Saramati, Veda Peak, Ongpangkong Range.

question: Q.823. In which of the following Indian states will you find the Netarhat Mountains, also called ‚ÄòQueen of Chotanagpur‚Äô? SSC CGL 13/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.823.(b) Jharkhand. The Chota Nagpur area has the most valuable concentration of mineral resources in India. The Chota Nagpur Plateau is known for having the highest concentration of iron and steel industries.

question: Q.824. In which of the following Indian states is the Gorichen peak located? SSC CGL 13/04/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Madhya Pradesh ', '(b) Arunachal Pradesh ', '(c) Himachal Pradesh ', '(d) Nagaland ']
solution: Sol.824.(b) Arunachal Pradesh. Gorichen Peak with a height of 6 858 m i s the highest peak in Arunachal Pradesh. The Dhupgarh Peak is the highest peak of Madhya Pradesh. Reo Purgyil is the highest mountain peak in the state of Himachal Pradesh.

question: Q.825. Mountaineers refer to altitudes above about ______ meters as the ‚Äòdeath zone‚Äô. SSC CGL 19/04/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.825.(b) 8,000. The death zone refers to altitudes above a certain point where the pressure of oxygen is insufficient to sustain human life for an extended time span.

question: Q.826. In which o f t he following states is Vindhya Range NOT located? SSC MTS 22/10/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Gujarat ', '(b) Madhya Pradesh ', '(c) Rajasthan ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.826.(c) Rajasthan. Vindhya Ranges- Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Gujarat, Southern parts of Uttar Pradesh, and Bihar. Borders on- Satpura Range and Chota Nagpur Plateau.

question: Q.827. Which of the following is a mountain peak that rises above the surrounding peaks at the mountainous border of the Indian state of Nagaland and the Sagaing region of Myanmar? SSC MTS 26/10/2021 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Mount Kalsubai ', '(b) Mount Doddabetta ', '(c) Mount Saramati ', '(d) Mount Dhupgarh ']
solution: Sol.827.(c) Mount Saramati. Doddabetta is the highest mountain in the Nilgiri Mountains at 2,637 meters. Kalsubai (highest point) is a mountain in the Western Ghats, located in the Indian state of Maharashtra.

question: Q.828. Which Indian city has the Nilachal Hills? SSC MTS 27/10/2021 (Evening)
solution: Sol.828.(b) Guwahati (Assam). The famous Kamakhya temple (Goddess Durga) is situated a t the top of Nilachal Hills.

question: Q.829. Generally, a steep hill with an elevation of more than ______ meters is classified as a mountain. SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.829.(a) 600. Within the earth, a continuous movement is taking place. The internal process leads to the upliftment and sinking of the earth's surface at several places. The external process is the continuous wearing down and rebuilding of the land surface. Eg: Erosion and Deposition.

question: Q.830. Which of the following mountain ranges is home to the second highest peak of the world, K2? SSC MTS 02/11/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Karakoram Range ', '(b) Ladakh Range ', '(c) Pir Panjal Range ', '(d) Zanskar Range ']
solution: Sol.830.(a) Karakoram R anges is known as the 'backbone of high Asia'. It is also known as Krishnagiri which i s situated in the northernmost range of the Trans-Himalayan ranges.

question: Q.831. ______ i s created by the collision of convergent plate boundaries. SSC CGL 16/08/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) Mid-ocean ridge ', '(b) Land erosion ', '(c) Oceanic trench ', '(d)Mountain building ']
solution: Sol.831.(d) Mountain building . A convergent boundary is an area on earth where two or more lithospheric plates converge or collide and one plate eventually slides beneath the other.

question: Q.832. Which of t he following Himalayan peaks is NOT located in Nepal? SSC CGL 20/08/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.832.(a) Kamet is the second highest mountain in the Garhwal region of Uttarakhand.

question: Q.833. 'Pidurutalagala' is the highest mountain peak in ______. SSC CHSL 15/04/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.833.(b) Sri Lanka . Pidurutalagala or Mount Pedro in English, is an ultra prominent peak and the tallest mountain in Sri Lanka, at 2,524 m situated in the town of Nuwara Eliya.

question: Q.834. Which of the following hills is situated in Assam? SSC CHSL 15/04/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Aravali Hills ', '(b) Karbi Anglong Hills ', '(c) Javadi Hills ', '(d) Shevaroy Hills ']
solution: Sol.834.(b) Karbi Anglong Hills . Javadi Hills and Shevaroy Hills are located in Tamil Nadu. Aravali hills are located in Rajasthan.

question: Q.835. Where is Mount Diavolo, an important mountain peak in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Located? SSC CHSL 05/08/2021(Morning)
options: ['(a) Great Nicobar ', '(b) North Andaman ', '(c) Middle Andaman ', '(d) South Andaman ']
solution: Sol.835.(d) South Andaman. It has an elevation of 295 meters. Middle Andaman is separated from North Andaman Island by Austen Strait, and from Baratang Island at the south by Homfray's Strait.

question: Q.836. Mount Jopuno is situated in which of the following states? SSC CHSL 09/8/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.836.(b) Sikkim. Mount Jopuno is positioned in western Sikkim at a lofty elevation of 5603 meters. This imposing peak lies under Khangchendzonga National Park.

question: Q.837. Which of the following hills is situated in Andhra Pradesh? SSC CHSL 10/8/2021(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Kaimur Hills ', '(b) Pachmarhi Hills ', '(c) Nagari Hills ', '(d) Girnar Hills ']
solution: Sol.837.(c) Nagari hills . Other hill stations in Andhra Pradesh include Tirumala, Araku Valley, Horsley Hills, Lambasingi, Nallamala Hills.

question: Q.838. In which o f t he following states is the Shatrunjaya Hills located? SSC CHSL 10/8/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) Gujarat ', '(b) Andhra Pradesh ', '(c) Madhya Pradesh ', '(d) Karnataka ']
solution: Sol.838.(a) Gujarat . Other prominent hills in Gujarat include‚Äì Bhujia Hill, Dhinodhar, Girnar, Kalo Dungar, Pavagadh Hill, Thaltej-Jodhpur Tekra, Wilson Hills.

question: Q.839. Which of t he following mountains is situated near the Siachen region of Ladakh in India? SSC CHSL 20/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Kirat Chuli Mountain ', '(b) Kabru Mountain ', '(c) Kanchenjunga Mountain ', '(d) K12 Mountain ']
solution: Sol.839.(d) K12 Mountain. Kirat Chuli Mountain or Tent Peak is a mountain in the Himalayas. Kabru is a mountain in the Himalayas on the border of eastern Nepal and India. Kanchenjunga is part of the Great Himalaya Range. K12 is the second highest peak in the Saltoro Mountains, a subrange of t he Karakoram range in the Siachen region, in Ladakh.

question: Q.840. What is the height of Mt. Godwin Austen, also known as Mt. K2? SSC CHSL 21/10/2020 (Evening)
solution: Sol.840.(a) 8611m. Mt. K2 is India's highest mountain peak and the second - highest mountain in the world, after Mount Everest above sea level. It is located on the China-Pakistan border.

question: Q.841. Borra Caves are situated on the East Coast of India in which of the following hills? SSC CGL 03/3/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Nallamala Hills ', '(b) Horsley Hills ', '(c) Nagari Hills ', '(d) Ananthagiri Hills ']
solution: Sol.841.(d) Ananthagiri Hills. Borra Caves, also called Borra Guhalu, are located on the East Coast of I ndia, in the Ananthagiri hills of the Araku Valley of the Visakhapatnam district in Andhra Pradesh. Volcano Q.842 . Which of the following statements is best related to the 'pacific ring of fire'? SSC MTS 14/09/2023 (2nd Shift) (a) Known for thermal power station (b) Known for volcano and earthquakes (c) Known for only glacial formations (d) Known for tropical rainforests Sol.842.(b) The 'ring of fire' is a ring of volcanoes in the Pacific Ocean. Instrument used for measuring Earthquake: Seismograph. V olcanoes are built up by the liquid and solid rock erupting from the earth‚Äôs interior.

question: Q.843. When a volcano erupts on Earth, the erupted material is typically a liquid rock known as _________ . SSC MTS 17/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.843.(b) Lava. Volcanoes are generally found where tectonic plates come together or separate, but they can also occur in the middle of plates due to volcanic hotspots. Active volcanoes : Barren Island (only one in India), Mauna Loa (Hawaii), Stromboli (Italy). Oldest Active Volcano - Mt. Etna (Italy). Youngest Volcano: Paricutin ( Mexico). Dormant Volcano: Vesuvius (Italy).

question: Q.844. The forces which act in the interior of the earth are called ______. SSC MTS 03/05/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) gravitational forces ', '(b) frictional forces ', '(c) endogenic forces ', '(d) exogenic forces ']
solution: Sol.844.(c) Endogenic forces. Examples - Volcanism, metamorphism, earthquakes, crustal warping, folding, and faulting, mountain development.

question: Q.845. Which of the following is an example of the most explosive type of volcano? SSC CHSL 13/10/2020(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Cinder cones volcanoes ', '(b) Flood basalt volcanoes ', '(c) Shield volcanoes ', '(d) Calderas volcanoes ']
solution: Sol.845.(d) Calderas volcanoes is a bowl-shaped depression formed when a volcano collapses into the void p lace left when its magma chamber is emptied. Rhyolite caldera complexes are the most explosive of Earth‚Äôs volcanoes but often don‚Äôt even look like volcanoes. They are usually so explosive that when they erupt they end up collapsing in on themselves rather than building any tall structure. World Geography and Map

question: Q.846. Which of the following are some regions in the world, known for their thriving citrus fruit production? SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023
options: ['(a) Africa ', '(b) Equatorial regions ', '(c) Caribbean ', '(d) Mediterranean regions ']
solution: Sol.846.(d) Mediterranean regions - These are known as ‚ÄòOrchards of the world‚Äô. Plants grow in Mediterranean regions - Citrus fruits like lemons, orange and grapefruit, Rosemary, Olive. Mediterranean woodlands are found in the Mediterranean Sea region, Central Chile, the Southwest United States, Australia, and Africa.

question: Q.847. Copacabana beach is situated in __________. SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.847.(b) Brazil. Copacabana beach: I t is located in the South Z one of t he city of Rio de Janeiro. Some famous B eaches in the world: Praia do Cassino (‚ÄúCassino beach‚Äù) is the longest beach in the world, located in Brazil. Monolithi beach, Greece (longest beach of E urope), Marina beach, Chennai (longest beach in Asia). Beaches in India - Puri Beach (Odisha), Rushikonda Beach (Andhra Pradesh), Eden Beach (Puducherry), Radhanagar beach (Andaman and Nicobar), Minicoy Thundi beach (Lakshadweep).

question: Q.848. What is the geographic location of the world's largest coral reef, known as the Great Barrier Reef? SSC MTS 05/09/2023 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.848.(b) Australia (Queensland) in the Pacific Ocean. The Great Barrier Reef was inscribed as World Heritage in 1981. The majority of coral reefs are found within tropical a nd subtropical waters (between 30 o north and 30 o south latitudes). The Coral reefs found i n India - Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Gulf of Kutch and Gulf of Mannar.

question: Q.849. What is the name of the geographic feature that serves as a boundary between Europe and Africa ? SSC MTS 06/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Bosporus Strait ', '(b) Strait of Gibraltar ', '(c) Dardanelles Strait ', '(d) Malacca Strait ']
solution: Sol.849.(b) Strait of Gibraltar separates Morocco and Spain. It joins the Mediterranean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean. Bosporus Strait (the narrowest strait of the world) - It is a natural strait connecting the Black Sea to the Sea of Marmara. Dardanelles strait (separates Asian Turkey from European Turkey) - It connects the Aegean Sea with the Sea of Marmara. Malacca Strait (Separates Malay Peninsula and Indonesian Island of Sumatra) - Connects the Andaman Sea (Indian Ocean) and the South China Sea (Pacific Ocean).

question: Q.850. What is the name of the geographic feature that serves as a boundary between India and Sri Lanka ? SSC MTS 12/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
