options: ['(a) Strait of Gibraltar ', '(b) Dardanelles Strait ', '(c) Bosporus Strait ', '(d) Palk Strait ']
solution: Sol.850.(d) Palk Strait is a water body between the Jaffna district (Sri Lanka) and the Tamil Nadu state (India). It connects the Bay of Bengal in the northeast with Palk Bay in the southwest. The Vaigai River flows into the Palk Strait. It is named after the Governor of Madras Robert Palk during company rule.

question: Q.851. Mid-latitude deserts (BWK) are found between 35¬∞ and __________ N and S, which are poleward of subtropical high- pressure areas. SSC CHSL 02/08/2023 (1st shift)
solution: Sol.851.(b) 60¬∞. Mid-latitude deserts - An excessively dry region with an arid climate. Location - Found in the interior parts of the continents. Examples - Argentina's Patagonian Desert (Argentina), Gobi Desert (China and Mongolia), Turkestan (Kazakhstan), Ladakh (Jammu and Kashmir). Crops - Cacti, Prickly Shrubs, Long-rooted wiry grasses.

question: Q.852. According to the World Bank, what was the density of the population of Sri Lanka in 2020? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 4th shift)
options: ['(a) 554 Persons per sq . km. ', '(b) 300 Persons per sq . km. ', '(c) 354 Persons per sq . km. ', '(d) 364 Persons per sq . km. ']
solution: Sol.852.(c) 354 Persons per sq . km. Other Countries' population density (Food and Agriculture Organization and World Bank population estimates in 2020) in square Km:- India (470), China (150), Myanmar (82), Nepal (205), Bangladesh (1286), New Zealand (19).

question: Q.853. Which of the following combinations of "animal" and "area they found" is INCORRECT? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 4th shift)
options: ['(a) Kangaroo - Australia ', '(b) Orangutan - Caribbean islands ', '(c) Ostrich - Savanna and desert regions, ', '(d) Lemurs - Madagascar ']
solution: Sol.853.(b) Orangutans - Caribbean islands . Scientific name (Pongo), Family (Hominidae). These are large, orange-haired apes that are native to the rainforests of Borneo and Sumatra. Kangaroos: Scientific name (Macropodidae), Phylum (Chordata). Ostriches: Phylum (Chordata), found in savanna and desert regions. Lemurs: Scientific name (Lemuroidea), Phylum (Chordata), found in Madagascar.

question: Q.854. As o f 2 020, which c ountry has the largest proven coal reserves in the world? SSC CHSL Tier II (26/06/2023)
solution: Sol.854.(c) The United States of America (Largest Coal Reserves) . Largest coal producer (1st China, 2nd India). Jharia Coal Field (Jharkhand) produces the highest coal in India. Central Institute of Mining and Fuel Research (2007) - Dhanbad. Largest Producer: Bauxite (Australia), Gold (China), Diamond (Russia), Silver (Mexico), Chromium (South Africa), Copper (Chile), Uranium (Kazakhstan), Thorium (India).

question: Q.855. "Eskimos" are associated with which geographical region? SSC MTS 02/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Arid Region ', '(b) Polar Region ', '(c) Savanna Grassland ', '(d) Tropical Rainforest Region ']
solution: Sol.855.(b) Polar Region (the area around the Earth‚Äôs North Pole or the South Pole). Igloo (small hut-like house made of snow where Eskimos live). Arid regions are dry and have little rainfall. Example - Central and western Asia, North and South America, central and northwest Australia.

question: Q.856. In which of the following regions, a cyclone is known as "Typhoon"? SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.856.(b) Japan. Other names of Cyclones : Hurricane - USA, Mexico, Caribbean Sea, A tlantic Ocean. Typhoon - China. Willy Willy - Australia. Tornado - West Africa and southern USA.

question: Q.857. Which sea separates Africa from the Arabian peninsula ? SSC MTS 14/06/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Red Sea ', '(b) Black Sea ', '(c) White Sea ', '(d) Caspian Sea ']
solution: Sol.857.(a) Red Sea. It extends southeast from Suez, Egypt (initially as the Gulf of Suez), for about 1,200 mi (1,930 km) t o the Strait of M andeb, which connects with the Gulf of Aden and then with the Arabian Sea. The Black Sea separates Europe from Asia. White Sea - A southern inlet of the Barents Sea located on the northwest coast of Russia. The Caspian Sea - The world's largest inland water body.

question: Q.858. Which is the highest plateau in the world ? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) East African Plateau ', '(b) Deccan plateau ', '(c) Western plateau ', '(d) Tibet plateau ']
solution: Sol.858.(d) Tibet plateau (Roof of the world) is the largest and highest plateau in the world. It is a vast elevated plateau located at the intersection of Central, South and East Asia.

question: Q.859. T he Sahara Desert is located in which of the following continents? SSC CGL 06/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
options: ['(a) South America ', '(b) North America ', '(c) Africa ', '(d) Australia ']
solution: Sol.859.(c) Africa. Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world and the third-largest desert overall, smaller only than the deserts of Antarctica and the northern Arctic.

question: Q.860. In ‚ÄòAndes Mountain‚Äô of South America animals which are used for transportation is ______ . SSC CGL 08/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.860.(d) Llamas {Scientific name: Lama glama, Trophic level: Herbivorous}. Longest Mountain Ranges: Andes (South America, longest continental mountain}, Rockies (North America), Great Dividing Range (Australia), Transantarctic Mountains (Antarctica), Atlas Mountains (Africa) etc.

question: Q.861. The world's longest river the Nile flows through which of the following continents? SSC CGL 09/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Africa ', '(b) North America ', '(c) South America ', '(d) Europe ']
solution: Sol.861.(a) Africa. The Nile (6650 km) flows from Lake Victoria into the Mediterranean Sea through 11 countries (Democratic Republic of the Congo, Tanzania, Burundi, Rwanda, Uganda, Kenya, Ethiopia, Eritrea, South Sudan, Republic of the Sudan, and Egypt). Missouri (3467 km) i s the longest river in North America. The Amazon River (6400 km) is the longest of S outh A merica. The Volga River (3690 km) i s the longest river in Europe.

question: Q.862. _ ____ is the only continent through which the tropic of cancer, the equator and the tropic of capricorn passes. S SC CGL 13/12/2022 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.862.(b) Africa (Dark continent). It is the second largest continent after Asia. The equator runs almost through the middle of the continent.

question: Q.863. Which water body is adjacent to the Atlantic Ocean, located in the southeast of the Gulf of Mexico? SSC CHSL 31/05/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Arabian Sea ', '(b) Baltic Sea ', '(c) Caspian Sea ', '(d) Caribbean Sea ']
solution: Sol.863.(d) Caribbean Sea . The Caspian Sea is the world's largest inland body of water, often described as the world's largest lake or a full-fledged sea. The Baltic Sea is an arm of the Atlantic Ocean.

question: Q.864. Death Valley is a desert valley in the ________ that is the hottest and driest place with a world record highest air temperature of 134¬∞F. SSC CHSL 08/06/2022 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Mojave Desert of California ', '(b) Atacama Desert of Chile ', '(c) Lut Desert of Iran ', '(d) Sahara Desert of Africa ']
solution: Sol.864.(a) Mojave Desert of California. Death Valley is a desert valley in the northern Mojave Desert, bordering the Great Basin Desert. Rivers: Furnace Creek; Amargosa River.

question: Q.865. Which country has the most t ime zones in the world? SSC MTS 13/10/2021(Evening)
options: ['(a) France ', '(b) United States of America ', '(c) Russia ', '(d) United Kingdom ']
solution: Sol.865.(a) France (12). Russia has 11 time zones, the United Kingdom has 1 time zone and India has only one-time zone.

question: Q.866. A major portion of 'Sufed Koh' mountain range lies in ______. SSC CHSL 09/8/2021(Morning)
solution: Sol.866.(a) Pakistan. Safed Koh is a mountain range on the Pakistan -Afghanistan border. It parallels the Kabul River. A spur of the range is crossed by the Khyber Pass.

question: Q.867. A mass of snow and ice that moves slowly under the influence of gravity along a confined course away from its place of accumulation is called a ______. SSC CHSL 09/8/2021(Evening)
solution: Sol.867.(b) Glacier is a slowly moving mass or river of ice formed by the accumulation and compaction of snow on mountains or near the poles. A lagoon is a stretch of saltwater separated from the sea by a low sandbank or coral reef. A plateau is a flat area of land that is elevated above sea level. Miscellaneous

question: Q.868. Based on current scientific knowledge, it is currently postulated that the Earth has an estimated age of: SSC CGL Tier II 26/10/2023
options: ['(a) about 4,50,00,00,000 years ', '(b) about 95,00,00, 00 years ', '(c) about 45,00,000 years ', '(d) about 65,00,000 years ']
solution: Sol.868.(a) about 4,50,00,00,000 (4.5 billion) years. Estimate age of celestial bodies : Universe - 13.8 billion years, Milky Way galaxy - 13.6 billion years, Sun - 4.5 billion years, Solar system - 4.5 billion years, Oldest star (Methuselah) - 14.5 billion years, Moon - 4.5 billion years. Life on the earth appeared around 3.8 billion years before the present.

question: Q.869. Which concept was proposed by Hutchinson i n 1957 to express the relationship of a n individual or population to all aspects of its environment? SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Ecological stratification ', '(b) Ecological pyramid ', '(c) Ecological succession ', '(d) Ecological niche ']
solution: Sol.869.(d) Ecological niche - A term f or the position of a species within an ecosystem. It refers to the Interrelationship of a species with all the biotic and abiotic factors affecting it. Ecological stratification - The vertical layering of a habitat; the arrangement of vegetation in layers. Ecological pyramid - It is a graphical representation of the relationship between the different living organisms at different trophic levels. Ecological succession - The process by which the mix of species and habitat in an area changes over time.

question: Q.870. Which of t he following companies had constructed Asia‚Äôs first cross -country pipeline as a mode of transport for liquids and gasses over long distances ? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Oil and Natural Gas Corporation ', '(b) Indian Oil Corporation ', '(c) Bharat Petroleum ', '(d) Oil India Limited ']
solution: Sol.870.(d) Oil India Limited. Naharkatia (Assam)-Barauni (Bihar) Pipeline (First cross-country pipeline). The Pipeline between Naharkatia and Nunmati became operative in 1962 and that between Nunmati and Barauni in 1964. Total Length 1167 Kilometers. Hajira (Gujarat)-Bijapur (Madhya Pradesh) -Jagdishpur (Uttar Pradesh) (HBJ) Gas Pipeline is the longest pipeline of India having a length of 1750 km. It was constructed by GAIL (India) Limited.

question: Q.871. The term physical geology was c oined by _____________ SSC Stenographer 12/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) William Hopkins ', '(b) Georgius Agricola ', '(c) Louis Agassiz ', "(d) Aziz Ab'Saber "]
solution: Sol.871.(a) William Hopkins . Father's of Various Fields - Economics (Adam Smith), Telephone (Alexander Graham Bell), Modern Chemistry (Antoine Lavoisier), Classification/ Taxonomy (Carl Linnaeus), Evolution (Charles Darwin), Geography (Eratosthenes).

question: Q.872. Which ecological law states that body form or shape is linear in warm climates and more rounded and compact in cold climates ? SSC Stenographer 13/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ["(a) Allen's rule ", '(b) Yoda‚Äôs rule ', "(c) Jordan's rule ", '(d) Gloger‚Äôs rule ']
solution: Sol.872.(a) Allen's rule is a zoogeographic rule that states that endothermic animals of colder climates tend to have shorter limbs and appendages than those of warmer climates. Jordan's rule states that endothermic animals of colder climates tend to be larger than those of warmer climates. Gloger's rule states that endothermic animals of more humid climates tend to be more d arkly pigmented than those of drier climates.

question: Q.873. Who was the first ecologist to describe the specific shape of eco-trophic interactions, Which he called the pyramid of numbers, in the 1920s? SSC CPO 03/10/2023 (Evening)
options: ['(a) Ernst Haeckel ', '(b) Howard Thomas Odum ', '(c) Edward O Wilson ', '(d) Charles Elton ']
solution: Sol.873.(d) Charles Elton. He introduced the concept of food web, food chain and ecological niche in the classic textbook ‚ÄúAnimal Ecology‚Äù in 1927. Ernest Haeckel - He coined the term ‚ÄòEcology‚Äô in 1866. Edward O Wilson - Proponent of Sociobiology.

question: Q.874. Which of the following places of India can have maximum temperature difference between the day and night ? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.874.(a) Jaisalmer. Factors contribute to the temperature difference between day and night in desert regions: Low Humidity - Because of it dry air heats up and cools down more quickly t han moist air. Low Vegetation - It allows for faster heating of the ground in sunlight and rapid cooling at night. Low Thermal Capacity of Sand - Desert soils, especially sandy ones, heat up swiftly in the sun and cool down rapidly, given their low capacity to retain heat.

question: Q.875. In Which year did Ernst Haeckel introduce the term ‚Äòecology‚Äô to describe the economies of living forms? SSC CPO 04/10/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.875.(b) 1866. Ecology is the study of the relationships between living organisms, including humans, and their physical environment. Biogenetic law, also called Recapitulation Theory and the term ‚Äúphylum‚Äù given by Ernst Haeckel. The term ‚ÄúEcosystem‚Äù was coined by Sir Arthur George Tansley (in 1935).

question: Q.876. Vultures are: SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.876.(a) carnivores. Vultures belong to a special class of carnivore known as a scavenger (animals that consume dead organisms). Other examples of Carnivores: Lion, Wolf, Leopard, C heetah etc. Herbivores - Those feed mostly on plants, Examples - Cow, Buffalo, Horse, Rabbits. Decomposers are the microorganisms which convert the dead plants and animals to humus. Detritivores include millipede, springtails, woodlice, dung flies and slugs that feed on the dead or decaying plants or animals.

question: Q.877. _______ is characterized by abundant dissolved oxygen, sunlight, nutrients, generally high wave energies and water motion, and, in the intertidal subzone, alternating submergence and exposure. SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) The Lentic Zone ', '(b) The Limnetic Zone ', '(c) The Littoral Zone ', '(d) The Benthic Zone ']
solution: Sol.877.(c) The Littoral Zone - It is an area close to the shore and submerged in water to some degree. Lentic Zone - Ecosystem entails a body of standing water, ranging from ditches, seeps, ponds, seasonal pools, basin marshes and lakes. Benthic Zone - The lowest ecological zone in a water body. Limnetic zone - The top layer of l ake water distant from the coast, and extends only as deep as sunlight can penetrate (200 m).

question: Q.878. Which ecosystem is the only one that does NOT thrive on solar energy? SSC CPO 05/10/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Marine organisms ', '(b) Deep sea hydro-thermal ecosystem ', '(c) Nitrogen fixing bacteria ', '(d) Phytoplanktons ']
solution: Sol.878.(b) Deep sea hydro-thermal ecosystem. These ecosystems are found around deep sea vents, where hot, mineral-rich water spews out from the Earth's crust. This water contains a variety of chemicals, including hydrogen sulfide, which are used by chemosynthetic bacteria to produce food. These bacteria are the foundation of the deep sea hydrothermal food chain, supporting a variety of other organisms, such as tubeworms, clams, and crabs.

question: Q.879. In which o f t he following states is there hardly any differences in day and night temperatures? SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (2nd Shift)
solution: Sol.879.(c) Kerala. These regions are located closer to the equator, near the Indian Ocean. The large water bodies act as heat reservoirs, keeping the temperatures relatively stable throughout the day and night. The presence of vegetation helps in cooling the area, reducing the temperature difference between day and night.

question: Q.880. The Wild Life (Protection) Amendment Act, 2022 seeks to implement the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora ( CITES). Which of the following statements is correct about CITES? 1. CITES is an agreement between governments to ensure that international trade in the specimens of wild animals and plants does not threaten the survival o f the species. 2. Under CITES, plant and animal specimens are classified into five categories based on the threat to their extinction. 3. The Convention requires countries to regulate the trade of all listed specimens through permits. 4. It also seeks to regulate the possession of live animal specimens. SSC MTS 01/09/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.880.(b) 1, 3 and 4. The CITES secretariat is administered by UNEP ( The United Nations Environment Programme) and is located at Geneva, Switzerland. It entered into force in July 1975.

question: Q.881. Which of the following is NOT an objective of National Rehabilitation and Resettlement Policy (2007) of the Government of India? SSC CHSL 03/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) To maximize the focus on rehabilitation without really caring for resettlement ', '(b) To integrate rehabilitation concerns into the development planning and implementation process ', '(c) To minimise displacement and to promote, as far as possible, non-displacing or least-displacing alternatives ', '(d) To provide a better standard of living, making concerted efforts for providing sustainable income to the affected families ']
answer: (a) To maximize the focus on rehabilitation without really caring for resettlement
solution: Sol.881.(a) The Rehabilitation and Resettlement Bill, 2007 - Formulated by the government of I ndia, Ministry of Rural Development.It establishes the post of Ombudsman to address any grievances from the rehabilitation and resettlement process.

question: Q.882. Which ecologist showed in a long-term experiment on outdoor plots that biodiversity is of central importance to the productivity, stability, resistance to the invasion of ecosystems and fertility of their soils? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Karl Mobius ', '(b) David Tilman ', '(c) Herbert Spencer ', '(d) Edward Osborne Wilson ']
solution: Sol.882.(b) David Tilman. Edward O. Wilson - Father of biodiversity . Karl M√∂bius - First to develop the concept of ecological community, biocenosis, or living community.

question: Q.883. What is the name of the two small moons o rbiting Mars discovered by American a stronomer Asaph Hall in 1877 ? SSC CHSL 07/08/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Phobos and Deimos ', '(b) Miranda and Triton ', '(c) Enceladus and Titan ', '(d) Charon and Dysnomia ']
solution: Sol.883.(a) Phobos and Deimos. Phobos is the innermost and larger of the two natural satellites of Mars, other being Deimos. Phobos is largely made up of carbonaceous chondrites.

question: Q.884. Which hypothesis was proposed by Paul Ehrlich to suggest the importance of species richness in the maintenance of ecosystems ? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (1st shift)
options: ['(a) Portfolio hypothesis ', '(b) Redundancy hypothesis ', '(c) Predation hypothesis ', '(d) Rivet popper hypothesis ']
solution: Sol.884.(d) Rivet popper hypothesis. The hypothesis suggests the importance of species richness in the maintenance of the ecosystem. Redundancy hypothesis - It predicts that the species redundancy in a plant community enhances community stability. Predation hypothesis - It predicts that group-living animals are adapted to make alarm calls that distract or confuse predators.

question: Q.885. Which states are involved in the joint venture of the Chambal Project? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Rajasthan and Haryana ', '(b) Rajasthan and Uttar Pradesh ', '(c) Uttar Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh ', '(d) Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.885.(d) Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh. Chambal Project : Initiated in - 1954. Aim - Harnessing the Chambal River for irrigation, Power generation and for prevention and control of s oil erosion in the valley.

question: Q.886. Which of the following is the primary factor contributing to the dryness of old wells? SSC CHSL 08/08/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Wells have been covered. ', '(b) People have stopped utilizing wells. ', '(c) A lot of boring pumps have been set up in the adjacent areas. ', '(d) The ground surrounding the wells has been covered with a layer of vegetation. ']
answer: (c) A lot of boring pumps have been set up in the adjacent areas.
solution: Sol.886.(c) The reasons for t he drying up of water in wells - The increase in population also needs more use of w ater. Wells are dumped with waste as they do not contain any more water.

question: Q.887. Which of the following states is NOT a major producer of fertilisers? SSC CHSL 09/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Himachal Pradesh ', '(b) Gujarat ', '(c) Maharashtra ', '(d) Uttar Pradesh ']
solution: Sol.887.(a) Himachal Pradesh. Gujarat is the l argest producer of fertilizers in India and accounts for more than one- fourth of the production of nitrogenous as well as phosphatic fertilizers. India is one of the largest producers of nitrogenous fertilizers in the world.

question: Q.888. In the context of ecology, the given equation shows the relationship between the size of an area and the number of species present in it. Accordingly, by which letter is the regression coefficient denoted? log S = log C + Z log A SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (2nd shift)
solution: Sol.888.(c) Z. The species-area relationship is often evaluated in conservation science in order to predict extinction rates in the case of habitat loss and habitat fragmentation. The equation: log S = log C + Z log A, w here S = species richness, A = area, C = Y-intercept.

question: Q.889. In the 1930s, which of the following theories was propounded by Arthur Holmes about the mantle ? SSC CHSL 11/08/2023 (4th shift)
options: ['(a) Theory of Faunal Succession ', '(b) Slab Pull Theory ', '(c) Convectional Current Theory ', '(d) Theory of Faulting ']
solution: Sol.889.(c) Convectional current Theory. The Convectional currents are generated due to radioactive elements causing thermal differences in the mantle portion. Arthur Holmes - The first earth scientist to grasp the mechanical and thermal implications of mantle c onvection, which led eventually to the acceptance of plate tectonics.

question: Q.890. Name a unit designed for w et and dry bulb thermometers to protect temperature sensors from being affected by direct or reflected sunlight. SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (2nd shift)
options: ['(a) Stevenson screen ', '(b) Skywarn screen ', '(c) Clarinet screen ', '(d) Cardinal screen ']
solution: Sol.890.(a) Stevenson screen - It is also known as a cotton region shelter, an instrument shelter, a thermometer shelter, a thermoscreen, or a thermometer screen. Skywarn screen - It is a national network of volunteer severe weather spotters. It was established to obtain critical weather information b y the National Weather Service.

question: Q.891. Which of the following steps is NOT involved in a Water Cycle? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.891.(a) Hydration. Water cycle - Cycle that involves the continuous circulation of water in the Earth-atmosphere system. Steps Involved in the water cycle : Liquid w ater evaporates into water vapor, condenses to form clouds, and precipitates back to earth in the form of rain and snow.

question: Q.892. The Physical Quality of Life Index does NOT include which of the following indicators? SSC CHSL 17/08/2023 (3rd shift)
options: ['(a) Life expectancy ', '(b) Gender development index ', '(c) Infant mortality ', '(d) Literacy ']
solution: Sol.892.(b) Gender development index (GDI). The Physical Quality of Life I ndex (PQLI) is a measure that combines three basics - literacy rate, life expectancy, and infant mortality rate. It was developed by Morris David Morris, an American economist, as an alternative to the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) as a measure of a country‚Äôs progress and development.

question: Q.893. Which of the following hill stations do NOT experience snowfall in winters? SSC CGL 17/07/2023 (4th shift)
solution: Sol.893.(a) Ooty Renowned as Udhagamandalam. It is located in the state of T amil Nadu and is surrounded by the Nilgiri Mountain Range.

question: Q.894. Which state is also known as the 'Molasses basin', which is made up of soft unconsolidated deposits? SSC CGL 19/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.894.(a) Mizoram (The Land of r olling mountains). Manipur is known as ‚ÄòThe Jewel of land‚Äô in India. Nagaland - The falcon capital of the world. Meghalaya - The Abode of Clouds.

question: Q.895. Which is the largest Dun formation in India? SSC CGL 25/07/2023( 3rd shift) ( a) Harike Dun (b) Nalagarh Dun (c) Kota Dun (d) DehraDun Sol.895.(d) DehraDun ( Uttarakhand ) Contains pilgrimage sites like Gangotri, Yamunotri, Kedarnath, Badrinath, and Hemkund Sahib. The longitudinal valley (accumulated with coarse alluvium passed down by Himalayan rivers) lying between lesser Himalaya and the Shiwaliks are known a s Duns. Examples : Kotli dun, Patli dun (Uttarakhand), Nalagarh Dun (Himachal Pradesh).
Q.896. In which year was an approach and program named Joint Forest Management (JFM) launched in the context of National Forest Policy? SSC CGL 27/07/2023 (3rd shift)
solution: Sol.896.(b) 1988. Joint Forest Management is about involving local communities in the management and restoration of degraded forests.

question: Q.897. Eugene Odum is well known for: Graduate Level 30/06/2023 ( Shift - 1)
options: ['(a) contribution in ecology ', '(b) contribution in animal hormonal balance ', '(c) contribution in plant stress regulation ', '(d) contribution in animal physiology ']
solution: Sol.897.(a) Contribution in ecology. Eugene Pleasants Odum (Father of modern ecology). Alexander von Humbolt - Father of ecology. Arthur G. Tansley - First to coin the term ecosystem in 1935. Vladimir Vernadsky - Founded the biosphere concept.

question: Q.898. Which of the following is considered as small earthquakes in underground caves and mines which are caused by the seismic waves produced by the eruption of rock on the surface? Matric Level 27/06/2023 (Shift - 2)
options: ['(a) Explosion earthquake ', '(b) Collapse earthquake ', '(c) Reservoir induced earthquakes ', '(d) Volcanic earthquake ']
solution: Sol.898.(b) Collapse earthquake. Explosion earthquakes (Blast-induced earthquake) - Occurs due to the detonation of large explosives, as during mining operations. Reservoir-induced earthquakes are triggered by the filling of large reservoirs, as dams. Volcanic earthquakes occur due to volcanic activity.

question: Q.899. Which of the following is the scientific discipline concerned with the description and classification of the Earth's topographic features? SSC CHSL Tier-2 26/06/2023
solution: Sol.899.(a) Geomorphology is a term that studies change in the earth‚Äôs surface due to these exogenic and endogenic forces, where exogenic forces are the external forces originating within the earth‚Äôs atmosphere and endogenic forces are internal forces generated from within the earth. Acarology - Study of mites and ticks. It also involves the study of the Acarina order - it means study of arachnids like spiders, scorpions,etc.

question: Q.900. The ancient name o f w hich o f t he following rivers is Vipasha? SSC MTS 08/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.900.(d) Beas.

question: Q.901. _______ species are those species of plants and animals which are found exclusively in a particular area. SSC MTS 10/05/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.901.(a) Endemic. Example of Endemic Species - Kangaroos originally endemic to Australia and found n owhere else in the world. Endemic Species of India - Asiatic Lion (Gir Forest), Kashmir Stag (Kashmir Valley), Purple Frog (Western Ghats), Sangai Deer (Loktak Lake), Nilgiri Tahr (Nilgiri Hills).

question: Q.902. In countries like Japan, _______ birth rates make the population pyramid _______ at the base. SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Morning)
options: ['(a) Low, Broad ', '(b) High, Broad ', '(c) Low, Narrow ', '(d) High, Narrow ']
solution: Sol.902.(c) Low, Narrow. A population pyramid is a way to visualize age and sex of a specific population. Decreased Death rates allow numbers of people to reach old age. A country in which birth and death rates are high, the pyramid is broad at the base and rapidly narrows towards the top (Kenya).

question: Q.903. When a person moves to a new country, it is called ________. SSC MTS 11/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.903.(a) Immigration. Emigration - When a person leaves one's own c ountry to settle permanently in another (moving abroad). Out-migration - The action of leaving one place to settle in another, especially within a country. Internal Migration - The movement of people within a country, results in a more efficient allocation of human resources to sectors and regions where they are better utilized.

question: Q.904. Which is the second largest family in modern Indian languages? SSC MTS 12/05/2023 (Evening)
solution: Sol.904.(d) Dravidian (Dravida). Major Dravidian Languages - Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam. They are mainly spoken in southern India, central India, north-east Sri Lanka.

question: Q.905. Which among the following occur when two tectonic plates are moving past each other with different speeds? SSC MTS 19/05/2023 (Afternoon)
solution: Sol.905.(b) Earthquake. Seismograph - Records the tremors of an earthquake.

question: Q.906. Which ministry is related to the "Deep Ocean Mission"? SSC MTS 13/06/2023 (Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Ministry of Earth Sciences ', '(b) Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate change ', '(c) Ministry of Mines ', '(d) Ministry of Defence ']
solution: Sol.906.(a) Ministry of Earth Sciences. Deep Ocean M ission: It will be a mission mode project to support the Blue Economy (sustainable use of ocean resources) Initiatives of the Government of India. India will now be the sixth country to have it after the USA, Russia, France, Japan and China. The National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) will carry out this mission. Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is also one of the collaborators in this mission.

question: Q.907. The point on the surface, nearest to the focus of the earthquake, is called _______. SSC MTS 20/06/2023 (Morning)
solution: Sol.907.(b) Epicenter. Hypocenter - A point beneath the Earth's surface where the vibrations of a n earthquake originate. Richter scale is the most common standard of measurement for earthquakes. The R ichter Magnitude - It is a measure of the amount of energy released during an earthquake and expressed by the Richter scale.

question: Q.908. Little Andaman in the south is separated from the Nicobar Islands by the ________. SSC CHSL 09/03/2023 (3rd Shift)
solution: Sol.908.(b) 10 Degree Channel: Situated at bay of Bengal. 9-degree channels: Separate Minicoy and Lakshadweep. 7-degree channel: Separates Rutland Island of Great Andaman and South Andaman to the north and Little Andaman to the south.

question: Q.909. Which of the following is a rare species as per International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN)? SSC CHSL 10/03/2023 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Lion tailed macaque ', '(b) Asiatic buffalo ', '(c) Gangetic dolphin ', '(d) Blue sheep ']
solution: Sol.909.(b) Asiatic buffalo. The International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) - Organization working in the field of nature conservation and sustainable use of natural resources. Founded - 1948, Headquarter - Gland, Switzerland. Important rare species - African Forest Elephant, Kondana Rat, Large Rock Rat or Elvira Rat, Namdapha Flying Squirrel, Malabar Civet. Lion-tailed macaque - Rarest and most threatened primates.

question: Q.910. Which of the following is an extinct species? SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Hornbill ', '(b) Andaman wild pig ', '(c) Pink head duck ', '(d) Andaman teal ']
solution: Sol.910.(c) Pink head ducks (Rhodonessa caryophyllacea) were one of the rarest species of waterfowl that were found in India. They mainly inhabited the area around the lower areas north of the Ganges and west of the Brahmaputra River. Andaman Wild Pig (sus scrofa andamanensis) - endangered porcine species of Andaman and Nicobar islands. Hornbills (bucerotidae) - family of birds found in tropical and subtropical Africa and Asia. Andaman Teal (anas albogularis) - Species of duck endemic to the Andaman archipelago in the Bay of Bengal.

question: Q.911. Indian Standard T ime (IST) is ahead of Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) by ________. SSC CHSL 16/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) 3 hours 45 min ', '(b) 7 hours 15 min ', '(c) 2 hours ', '(d) 5 hours 30 min ']
solution: Sol.911.(d) 5 hours 30 minutes . The Greenwich Mean Time is 0¬∞ longitude While going eastwards the time increases by 4 minutes and in the west decreases with the same rate. So (82.5 x 4 = 330 minutes or 5 hours 30 minutes).

question: Q.912. Which of the following earthquake waves are longitudinal waves? SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) L waves ', '(b) P waves ', '(c) N waves ', '(d) S Waves ']
solution: Sol.912.(b) P waves. Earthquake waves (Seismic waves) are vibrations in the earth that transmit energy. Q.913 ._____ species are the species which are not found after searches of known or likely areas where they may occur. SSC CHSL 20/03/2023 (3rd Shift) (a) Extinct (b) Endangered (c) Normal (d) Vulnerable Sol.913.(a) Extinct. An endangered species is a type of organism that is threatened by extinction. Examples: Black Rhino, Tiger, Whale, Red Panda, Chimpanzee, Asian Elephant etc.

question: Q.914. Which of the following is a vulnerable species? SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (2nd Shift)
options: ['(a) Himalayan brown bear ', '(b) Horn bill ', '(c) Asiatic cheetah ', '(d) Asiatic elephant ']
solution: Sol.914.(d) Asiatic elephant. A vulnerable species is a species which has been categorized by the International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) as being threatened with extinction.

question: Q.915. Which of the following pairs of "term - definition" is correct? I. Strait - a narrow strip of land joining two landmasses II. Isthmus - a narrow passage of water connecting two large water bodies SSC CHSL 21/03/2023 (4th Shift)
options: ['(a) Only II ', '(b) Both I and II ', '(c) Neither I nor II ', '(d) Only I ']
solution: Sol.915.(c) Neither I nor II. Strait - Narrow body of water that connects two larger bodies of water, Examples - Cook strait (New Zealand), Malacca strait (Indonesia-Malaysia), Mesina strait (Italy-Sicily), Bering strait (Alaska -Russia), Hormuz strait (Gulf of persia-Gulf of Oman), etc. Isthmus - narrow strip of land that connects two larger landmasses and separates two bodies of water, Examples - Isthmus of Panama, Isthmus of suez.

question: Q.916. In 1962, who published 'The History of Ocean Basins', which outlined the theory of how tectonic plates could move, later called 'sea floor spreading'? SSC CGL Tier II 03/03/2023
options: ['(a) George Edward Backus ', '(b) Alfred Wegener ', '(c) Louis Bauer ', '(d) Harry Hammond Hess ']
solution: Sol.916.(d) Harry Hammond Hess. According to the theory of plate tectonics, the earth‚Äôs lithosphere is broken into distinct plates which are floating on a ductile layer called asthenosphere.

question: Q.917. Below are a few statements given about afforestation. A. Afforestation could prevent flooding. B. Afforestation can balance our ecosystem. Which of the above statements is/are correct? SSC CGL Tier II 03/03/2023
options: ['(a) Both A & B are incorrect ', '(b) Only B ', '(c) Both A & B ', '(d) Only A ']
solution: Sol.917.(c) Both A and B. Afforestation : process of planting trees and establishing forests in areas where they did not previously exist.

question: Q.918. The national census does NOT recognise_________groups within India. SSC CGL Tier II 06/03/2023
solution: Sol.918.(b) Ethnic. Census - Process of collecting, compiling, analyzing and disseminating demographic, economic and social data pertaining, at a specific time, of all persons in a country or a well-defined part of a country.

question: Q.919. 'Anaconda' , one of the world's largest snakes, is found in _______. SSC CGL 12/12/2022 (1st Shift)
options: ['(a) Tropical evergreen forest ', '(b) Monsoon forest ', '(c) Temperate evergreen forest ', '(d) Temperate grasslands ']
solution: Sol.919.(a) Tropical Evergreen Forests (Amazon forest). They are categorized under the genus Eunectes (great swimmers) and family (Boidae). They thrive very well in hot, humid places with dense foliage. Tropical rainforests are found in South America, Africa, and Southeast Asia around the equator.

question: Q.920. Wearing away of landscape by different agents like water, wind and ice is called________ SSC CGL 01/12/2022 (1st Shift)
solution: Sol.920.(b) Erosion. Metamorphism is the transformation of existing rock to rock with a different mineral composition or texture. Sedimentation refers to the process of particles settling out from the suspension of water because of the effect of gravity.

question: Q.921. According to the field guide ‚ÄòBirds of India‚Äô authored by the Zoological Survey of India, how many bird species are there in India? SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Evening)
solution: Sol.921.(d) 1,331. ZSI: Founded (1 July 1916), Headquarters (Kolkata), Director (Dr Kailash Chandra, Dec.2022), Parent Organization (Ministry of Environment, forest, and Climate Change).

question: Q.922. The study of the structure, evolution and dynamics of Earth and its natural mineral and energy resources is called: SSC CPO 11/11/2022 (Morning)
solution: Sol.922.(b) Geology. James Hutton is known as the father of geology. Eratosthenes is called the father of geography. The study of mountains is called Orology. The study of Rocks is called Petrology.

question: Q.923. Which floating fern damages aquatic ecosystems by outgrowing and replacing native plants that provide food and habitat for native animals and waterflow? Graduate Level 01/08/2022 ( Shift - 4 )
options: ['(a) Salvinia minima ', '(b) Osmunda regalis ', '(c) Giant salvinia ', '(d) Azolla pinnata ']
solution: Sol.923.(c) Giant salvinia ( aquatic fern, native to south-eastern Brazil, Scientific name - Salvinia molesta). Salvinia minima (common salvinia or water spangles), Osmunda regalis (Royal fern), Azolla pinnata (mosquito fern, feathered mosquito fern and water velvet).

question: Q.924. The process of wastewater treatment is commonly called _____ treatment. SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.924.(a) Sewage . The 4 steps of sewage treatment are Sludge Thickening,Sludge Digestion, Dewatering, Disposal.

question: Q.925. ______ refers to a sanitation system in which toilets collect human excreta in sealable, removable cartridges that are transported to treatment facilities. SSC CGL 11/04/2022(Evening )
options: ['(a) Ecological sanitation ', '(b) Container-Based sanitation ', '(c) Community-led total sanitation ', '(d) Dry sanitation ']
solution: Sol.925.(b) Container Based Sanitation . Ecological sanitation is that protects human and ecosystem health while preventing water pollution, conserving energy, and capturing nutrients.

question: Q.926. The greater one-horned rhino is listed under the Schedule ______ of the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 SSC CGL 12/04/2022(Evening)
solution: Sol.926.(d) I . Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 - Provides for t he protection of w ild animals, birds and plants.

question: Q.927. In which of the following towns will you find the ‚ÄòKachari Ruins‚Äô? SSC CGL 13/04/2022(Afternoon)
solution: Sol.927.(d) Dimapur ( Nagaland) . The Kachari Rajbari Ruins are a series of mushroom domed pillars.

question: Q.928. ______ is an environmental policy under which producers are given a significant responsibility ‚Äì financial and/or physical ‚Äì for the treatment or disposal of products that are no longer useful to the consumer SSC CGL 19/04/2022(Evening)
options: ['(a) Producers‚Äô Environmental Responsibility ', '(b) Ethical Producer Responsibility ', '(c) Extended Producer Responsibility ', '(d) Post-consumer Environmental Responsibility ']
solution: Sol.928.(c) Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR). The concept was first formally introduced in Sweden by Thomas Lindhqvist in 1990.

question: Q.929. Which of the following is NOT a broad mitigation technique of landslide? SSC CGL 21/04/2022(Afternoon)
options: ['(a) Construction of retention wall to stop land from slipping ', '(b) The surface drainage control works to control the movement of landslide along with rain water and spring flows ', '(c) Hazard mapping to locate areas prone to landslides ', '(d) Reduction in the vegetation cover to arrest landslide ']
answer: (d) Reduction in the vegetation cover to arrest landslide
solution: Sol.929.(d) Landslide is the movement of a mass of r ock, debris or earth down a slope. 4 types of landslides: fall and toppling, slides (rotational and translational), flows and creep.
